“当父母无力维系亲子关系时，孩子就必须承担起这个责任。她会通过做一个乖孩子来做到这一点。她会通过早熟和智力成熟来做到这一点。当她到了能够进行抽象思考的年龄，大约十三四岁，大脑中的这些连接真正形成时，她突然就成了你的知己。这段关系不再基于她的需求，而是更多地基于你的需求。比如，当那个男孩试图爬到她身上时，她为了保护你免受情感上的伤害，选择不告诉你。她不让你知道这件事。她是在保护你。”

“She wants to keep peace in the family. That’s not the child’s role. The child’s role is to go to her mother and say, ‘This bastard tried to climb on top of me! To hell with whether there is peace or not!’ I know that’s what you would’ve wanted her to do. None of this is deliberate. It all goes back to your own experience as a child.

“她想维持家庭和睦。但这并非孩子的职责。孩子的职责是去找她妈妈，说：‘这个混蛋想爬到我身上！管它什么和睦与否！’我知道你希望她这么做。这一切都不是她刻意为之。这一切都源于你自身的童年经历。”

“I’ve had very similar interactions with my eldest son as you describe with Barbara. He said to me at one point, ‘Dad, I don’t know where you end and I begin.’ That’s just how it is. I’ve always said that I’m not worried my kids will be angry with me, I’m worried they won’t be angry enough.

“我和我大儿子之间的互动和你描述的芭芭拉的情况非常相似。他曾经对我说：‘爸爸，我不知道你和我之间的界限在哪里。’就是这样。我一直说，我不担心孩子们会生我的气，我担心的是他们不够生气。”

“What you were finally seeing in Barbara’s last six months of life is that she was beginning to set boundaries. She was saying no, and the anger that she had repressed was coming out.”

“在芭芭拉生命的最后六个月里，你终于看到她开始划清界限。她会说‘不’，她一直压抑的愤怒也开始爆发出来。”

“Right …”

“正确的 …”

“This is how I perceive it. The people that I see with cancers and all these conditions have difficulty saying no and expressing anger. They tend to repress their anger or, at the very best, express it sarcastically, but never directly. It all comes from the early need to build the relationship with the parent, to work at the relationship.

“我是这么理解的。我见过的那些患癌症或其他类似疾病的人，很难说‘不’，也很难表达愤怒。他们往往会压抑自己的愤怒，或者最多也只是用讽刺的方式表达，但绝不会直接发泄。这一切都源于他们早期需要与父母建立关系，需要努力维系这段关系。”

“I think for Barbara it was a lot of work to maintain the relationship with you. I recall just very gingerly raising the issue. She indicated to me that there was something going on, but she also didn’t want to talk very much. She was very much pulled into herself—I was a total stranger to her. She wasn’t about to open up to me.”

“我觉得对芭芭拉来说，维持和你的关系很不容易。我记得当时我只是非常小心翼翼地提起这件事。她暗示我她可能遇到了什么事，但她也不想多说。她把自己封闭起来——我对于她来说完全是个陌生人。她根本不可能向我敞开心扉。”

“It wasn’t easy for her to open up. In the last months she would actually ask for me to come and smoke a joint with her, so then we could be relaxed and talk,” Betty says.

“她很难敞开心扉。在生命的最后几个月里，她甚至会邀请我去和她一起抽大麻，这样我们才能放松下来好好聊聊，”贝蒂说。

“How was that?”

“感觉怎么样？”

“It was good because she would talk about herself. She would say, ‘I feel that I don’t know what cancer is, but it’s here and it seems like it’s been visited on me.’ She said, ‘I’ve invited the cancer into my body.’ I remember being horrified and saying, ‘Barbara, I don’t understand that.’ She said, ‘Well, it’s because I experience it as part of my own life and that you’re a part of this too, Mom. You have your own part of my cancer.’

“这很好，因为她会谈论自己。她会说，‘我觉得我不知道癌症是什么，但它就在这里，好像是它找上门来了。’她说，‘是我把癌症招进了我的身体。’我记得当时我很害怕，我说，‘芭芭拉，我不明白。’她说，‘嗯，那是因为我把它当作自己生活的一部分来体验的，而你也是其中的一部分，妈妈。你也有你自己的那部分癌症。’”

“You know something else, Gabor—she saw somebody the night before she died. She said there was a man who’d come to take her, and she told him she wasn’t ready. The next night, she said to me, ‘That man—I want him to come.’ I said, ‘What man? Do you want me to call the doctor?’ She said, ‘No, the man who came for me and I told him I wasn’t ready.’ She said that she was ready now.

“你知道吗，加博尔——她去世前一晚见到了一个人。她说有个男人来接她，她告诉他她还没准备好。第二天晚上，她对我说：‘那个男人——我想让他来。’我说：‘什么男人？你想让我叫医生吗？’她说：‘不，就是那个来接我，我告诉他我还没准备好的男人。’她说她现在准备好了。”

“I had told her a few hours before that if she was tired of being sick, she didn’t have to hold on any longer. I’d said, ‘Okay,’ and it was then she told me this about the man. She told me that she was ready for him now, and she died at eight that morning. Have you ever read any Kubler-Ross stuff? You know where she says about escorts … people who come for us as we die. It was so weird. It really made the hair stand up on the back of my neck.”

“几个小时前我告诉她，如果她不想再生病了，就不用再坚持了。我说‘好的’，然后她就跟我说了关于那个男人的事。她说她现在准备好了，然后那天早上八点她就去世了。你读过库伯勒-罗斯的著作吗？你知道她写的关于护送者的事……那些在我们临终时来接我们的人。真是太诡异了。我听得后颈的汗毛都竖起来了。”

“Why is that weird for you?”

“你为什么觉得这很奇怪？”

“Well, do you mean there really is an angel of death?”

“那么，你的意思是说，真的有死神吗？”

“Does it have to be like that? The mind has an experience, and we translate it into an image. There is a deeper sense of something that’s happening, but the mind can only experience it in terms of thoughts and images.”

“一定要这样吗？大脑会产生一种体验，然后我们将其转化为图像。虽然对正在发生的事情有一种更深层次的感受，但大脑只能通过思想和图像来体验它。”

Betty had one final question. “Why can’t parents see their children’s pain?”

贝蒂还有最后一个问题：“为什么父母看不到孩子的痛苦呢？”

“I’ve had to ask myself the same thing. It’s because we haven’t seen our own. When I read your book, Clayoquot , I saw the evidence in your writing that you hadn’t recognized your own pain yet. It would not be possible for you to clearly see Barbara’s, either.

“我也一直在问自己同样的问题。这是因为我们都没有真正正视自己的痛苦。克莱奥科特，当我读你的书时，我从你的文字中看出，你当时还没有意识到自己的痛苦。你也不可能清楚地看到芭芭拉的痛苦。”

“If you think of it only in terms of you and Barbara, you’re going to feel more guilt—you may accuse yourself of things that wouldn’t be fair to you. The fact is, you are the product of a certain upbringing and a certain kind of life. Your life has always been about trying to find yourself and about trying to find truth in the world. It’s been a real struggle. It’s amazing what you’ve done, coming from the background that you described. Still, are you sure you want to hear this?”

“如果你只从你和芭芭拉的角度来考虑这件事，你会感到更加内疚——你可能会责怪自己一些对你不公平的事情。事实上，你是特定成长环境和特定生活方式的产物。你的人生一直都在寻找自我，寻找世界的真相。这的确是一段艰辛的历程。考虑到你所描述的背景，你取得的成就令人惊叹。不过，你确定你想听这些吗？”

“Please, continue.”

请继续。

“You dedicate Clayoquot to Barbara Ellen but also to your ‘wonderful mother.’ Your mother may well have been wonderful, but when you write this, you are not fully aware of how angry you are with your own mother and how hurt you were by her. ‘My mother was warm and loving, but I always knew she favoured my brother and sister. She was so full of love that some of it slopped over to me.’ How does that actually feel to a child—whose perspective is this?”

“你把《克拉约科特》献给芭芭拉·艾伦，也献给你的‘慈母’。你的母亲或许确实很慈母，但当你写下这些话时，你并没有完全意识到你对自己的母亲有多么愤怒，以及她曾给你带来多么大的伤害。‘我的母亲热情慈爱，但我一直都知道她更偏爱我的哥哥和姐姐。她如此充满爱，以至于有些爱也流到了我身上。’这对于一个孩子来说究竟是怎样的感受——这究竟是谁的视角？”

“I never felt unloved.”

“我从未感到不被爱。”

“Of course you didn’t feel unloved, and I’m not saying your mother didn’t love you. But partially you didn’t feel unloved because you shut off your pain around it. You write, ‘After I grew up I once confronted my mother with my secret knowledge, and she was hurt and astonished and insisted that if she paid more attention to the other two, it was because they needed her more than I did, that I was always more emotionally independent.’ That was your particular ruse to make it look like you are emotionally independent, to protect your mother and to avoid your hurt feelings. That was suppressing your own pain.

“当然，你并不觉得自己不被爱，我也不是说你母亲不爱你。但你之所以没有感到不被爱，部分原因是你封闭了自己内心的痛苦。你写道：‘长大后，我曾就我所知道的秘密质问过母亲，她既伤心又震惊，并坚持说，如果她更关注另外两个孩子，那是因为他们比我更需要她，因为我一直都比较独立。’这其实是你为了让自己看起来独立而耍的伎俩，目的是为了保护你的母亲，也是为了逃避自己受伤的感受。这其实是在压抑你自己的痛苦。”

“‘Although I always knew she favoured my brother and sister, she was so full of love some of it slopped over onto me’ is also the perspective of an adult trying to distance herself from the emotional reality of the experience. The child’s perspective would be different. How did it actually feel?”

“‘虽然我一直都知道她更偏爱我的弟弟妹妹，但她充满爱心，也把一些爱倾注到了我身上’，这也是一个成年人试图与这段经历的情感现实保持距离的视角。孩子的视角则截然不同。他们当时的真实感受究竟是什么呢？”

“I know I used to resent the attention paid to my little sister because she would hold her breath and turn blue. Later, she studied to be a nurse practitioner, to get a nursing degree, and she had four children. She was an addict and an alcoholic, and she died before she was fifty from an overdose. My parents tried with her … my mother tried desperately with her.”

“我知道我以前很嫉妒大家对妹妹的关注，因为她会屏住呼吸，脸色发青。后来，她学习成为一名执业护士，获得了护理学位，并生了四个孩子。她染上了毒瘾，酗酒成瘾，不到五十岁就因吸毒过量去世了。我的父母尽力帮助她……我的母亲更是拼命地想让她好起来。”

“You’re so quick to jump to your parents’ defence.”

“你总是那么快就站出来维护你的父母。”

“That’s because I’m a parent.”

“那是因为我是一位家长。”

“I think it’s because you’re defending yourself against your own pain in your relationship with your parents. You had nightmares …”

“我觉得这是因为你在用这种方式来保护自己，逃避与父母关系中带来的痛苦。你做了噩梦……”

“Everybody would have nightmares if they drank all the iced tea I did …”

“如果大家都喝了我喝的那么多冰茶，他们肯定会做噩梦……”

“Nightmares are about our deepest anxieties. A kid is afraid of monsters under the bed. You turn the light on and you show him that there are no monsters, and the next minute he is afraid of the monster again. What is he actually afraid of? He’s afraid of not being protected, about not being connected enough. Maybe there’s something monster-ish in the parent … maybe the parent is angry, so the kid is really scared. The kid has all this fear, so his mind will create the image of a monster.”

“噩梦源于我们内心深处的焦虑。一个孩子害怕床底下有怪物。你打开灯，让他知道根本没有怪物，但下一秒他又开始害怕了。他到底在害怕什么？他害怕得不到保护，害怕与家人缺乏足够的联结。也许父母身上有某种类似怪物的特质……也许父母很生气，所以孩子才会如此恐惧。孩子内心充满恐惧，于是他的脑海中就浮现出了怪物的形象。”

“The nightmares I had were about my father. I detested him. Not too long ago, I was talking with my brother, who was very much browbeaten by my father. He became an aeronautical engineer in spite of all of it; although he himself has been a lifelong alcoholic, he’s a functional one, and actually excels in his field. Not long ago he said, ‘You know, Betty, I always admired you when we were kids because you weren’t afraid to stand up to Dad.’ That isn’t true—I was petrified of Daddy, but I would offer some resistance. To my brother, in his mind, I was a freedom fighter because he would never say a single word to my father. My father called him a sissy because he just studied all the time.”

“我做的噩梦都是关于我父亲的。我恨他。不久前，我和我哥哥聊天，他从小就被我父亲欺负得很厉害。尽管如此，他还是成为了一名航空工程师；虽然他自己也是个酗酒者，但他还能正常工作，而且在专业领域非常出色。不久前，他说：‘贝蒂，你知道吗，我们小时候我一直很佩服你，因为你敢于反抗爸爸。’其实不是这样的——我当时非常害怕爸爸，但我会反抗。在我哥哥看来，我是个自由斗士，因为他从来不敢跟爸爸说一句话。我父亲骂他娘娘腔，因为他整天埋头苦读。”

“Another reason you had nightmares about him is that you couldn’t talk to your mom about any of these feelings.”

“你做噩梦梦到他的另一个原因是，你无法和妈妈谈论这些感受。”

“What was I going to tell Mom—‘I hate Daddy and I don’t know what in the world you’re doing with him’?”

“我该怎么跟妈妈说——‘我恨爸爸，我不知道你到底在对他做什么’？”

“No, just ‘Mom, I hate Daddy.’”

“不，就说‘妈妈，我恨爸爸’。”

“It wouldn’t have washed. The Bible says you honour your mother and father.”

“这肯定不行。《圣经》上说要孝敬父母。”

“I’m not blaming the mother because she is in this relationship—she has her own history. She can’t very well fight and upset the applecart. But for the child, the bigger wound is the experience with the mother. You come from a mother’s body and you relate to the mother. The mother is the universe for us. It’s the universe that lets us down. When the father comes along as an abusive, threatening figure, the universe protects us or the universe doesn’t protect us.

“我不是在责怪母亲，因为她身处这段关系中——她也有自己的过往。她不可能反抗，更不可能破坏现状。但对孩子来说，更大的创伤来自与母亲的经历。你来自母亲的身体，你与母亲有着情感上的联系。母亲是我们的一切。正是这整个宇宙让我们失望。当父亲以虐待、威胁的形象出现时，宇宙要么保护我们，要么不保护我们。”

“Now, I’m not saying it’s the mother’s fault. It has to do with the position of women in society and the relationships people get into. I’m talking only about the child’s experience. The child doesn’t know it, since you can’t miss what you’re not familiar with, but the child is actually experiencing abandonment by the mom. When you say ‘that wouldn’t have washed,’ what you’re really saying is that your mother had no way of hearing your root feelings. We don’t tend to think of that as wounding, but it is a deeper wound than anything else.

“我并不是说这是母亲的错。这和女性在社会中的地位以及人们建立的人际关系有关。我仅仅谈论孩子的感受。孩子自己可能意识不到，因为你不可能错过自己不熟悉的事物，但孩子实际上正在经历被母亲抛弃的感觉。当你觉得‘那样做行不通’时，你真正想表达的是，你的母亲根本无法理解你内心深处的感受。我们通常不会把这看作是一种伤害，但它造成的伤害比其他任何伤害都更深。”

“There’s a wonderful feminist book by Dorothy Dinnerstein, The Mermaid and the Minotaur . It discusses how the exclusive role that women have in early childraising distorts child development. When the woman is married to an immature man, she is also a mother to her husband, so she hasn’t got the openness and the energy for her kids. So your real rival for your mother’s affection wasn’t your sister, it was your dad.”

“多萝西·丁纳斯坦写了一本很棒的女性主义著作，叫《美人鱼与弥诺陶》。书中探讨了女性在早期育儿中扮演的专属角色如何扭曲了儿童发展。当女性嫁给一个不成熟的男人时，她同时也是丈夫的母亲，因此她没有足够的开放心态和精力去关爱自己的孩子。所以，你真正争夺母亲宠爱的对手不是你的姐妹，而是你的父亲。”

“It’s so odd because all three of us before my sister died were talking one day about my father. The animosity that I feel for my father is nothing compared with what my sister and brother felt. They both hated my father so much. We were talking about my father, and my mother came into the room and she said, ‘You know, when you kids talk about your father, I’ve always felt angry with you, because your father was a good man.’ She also said, ‘I don’t think I paid enough attention to any of you. If I had it to do over again, I would pay more attention to all of you and less to Daddy.’”

“这事儿真奇怪，我姐姐去世前有一天，我们三个还在聊起我父亲。我对父亲的怨恨跟我姐姐和弟弟的怨恨比起来简直不值一提。他们俩都恨透了我父亲。我们正聊着父亲，我母亲走进房间，说道：‘你们这些孩子，每次谈起父亲，我都觉得很生气，因为你们的父亲是个好人。’她还说：‘我觉得我以前对你们的关注不够。如果可以重来，我会多关注你们，少关注爸爸。’”

“Perhaps. But she may not realize that he got the attention that he demanded. Had he had less, he would have made her suffer for it.”

“或许吧。但她可能没意识到，他得到了他想要的关注。如果他得到的关注少一些，他就会让她为此受苦。”

It was Barbara Ellen and her aunt who died of an overdose and her alcoholic uncle and her brave mother, Betty, and all Betty’s children who, to one degree or another, suffered for the demanding immaturity of Betty’s father and for the lack of true assertiveness by her mother. And these parents, too, were suffering and carrying the burden of generations. There is no one to blame, but there are generations on generations who had lived to bear a part in the genesis of Barbara Ellen’s breast cancer.

是芭芭拉·艾伦和她因吸毒过量而去世的姑姑，还有她酗酒的叔叔、勇敢的母亲贝蒂，以及贝蒂的所有孩子，他们都或多或少地承受着贝蒂父亲的苛求和不成熟，以及母亲缺乏真正主见所带来的痛苦。而这些父母，也同样承受着世世代代的折磨。没有人应该为此受到责备，但芭芭拉·艾伦罹患乳腺癌的几代人，都曾为此付出过代价。

7
7
Stress, Hormones, Repression and Cancer
压力、激素、压抑与癌症

T HE LARGE MAJORITY OF LUNG CANCERS are caused by carcinogens and tumour promoters ingested via cigarette smoking,” says the twelfth edition of Harrison’s Principles of Internal Medicine . The statement is scientifically incorrect, despite the truth it contains.

《哈里森内科学原理》第十二版指出：“绝大多数肺癌是由吸烟摄入的致癌物和肿瘤促进剂引起的。”尽管这句话包含一些事实，但从科学角度来看，它并不正确。

Smoking no more causes cancer of the lung than being thrown into deep water causes drowning. Fatal as immersion in deep water can be to the unprotected non-swimmer, for someone who swims well or is equipped with a life jacket, it poses little risk. A combination of factors is necessary to cause drowning. It is the same with lung cancer.

吸烟导致肺癌的概率并不比被扔进深水区导致溺水的概率高。对于没有防护措施且不会游泳的人来说，落入深水区可能是致命的，但对于游泳健将或穿着救生衣的人来说，风险很小。溺水需要多种因素共同作用才会导致死亡。肺癌也是如此。

Smoking vastly increases the risk of cancer, not only of the lung but also of the bladder, the throat and other organs. But logic alone tells that us it cannot, by itself, cause any of these malignancies. If A causes B, then every time A is present, B should follow. If B does not follow A consistently, then A cannot, by itself, be the cause of B—even if, in most cases, it might be a major and perhaps necessary contributing factor. If smoking caused lung cancer, every smoker would develop the disease.

吸烟会大幅增加患癌风险，不仅是肺癌，还包括膀胱癌、咽喉癌和其他器官的癌症。但仅凭逻辑就能告诉我们，吸烟本身并不会导致任何一种恶性肿瘤。如果A导致B，那么只要A存在，B就应该随之出现。如果B并非总是跟随A出现，那么A本身就不可能是B的病因——即使在大多数情况下，A可能是一个重要的甚至必要的促成因素。如果吸烟会导致肺癌，那么每个吸烟者都会患上这种疾病。

Several decades ago, David Kissen, a British chest surgeon, reported that patients with lung cancer were frequently characterized by a tendency to “bottle up” emotions. 1 In a number of studies, Kissen supported his clinical impressions that people with lung cancer “have poor and restricted outlets for the expression of emotion, as compared with non-malignancy lung patients and normal controls.” 2 The risk of lung cancer, Kissen found, was five times higher in men who lacked the ability to express emotion effectively. Especially intriguing was that those lung cancer patients who smoked but did not inhale exhibited even greater repression of emotion than those who did . Kissen’s observations implied that emotional repression works synergistically with smoking in the causation of lung cancer. The more severe the repression, the less the smoke damage required to result in cancer.

几十年前，英国胸外科医生大卫·基森（David Kissen）报告称，肺癌患者常常表现出一种“压抑”情绪的倾向。在多项研究中，基森证实了他的临床印象，即与非恶性肺癌患者和正常对照组相比，肺癌患者“表达情绪的途径较少且受限”。基森发现，缺乏有效表达情绪能力的男性患肺癌的风险是其他人的五倍。尤其引人注目的是，那些吸烟但不吸入烟雾的肺癌患者，其情绪压抑程度甚至高于吸入烟雾的患者。基森的观察结果表明，情绪压抑与吸烟在肺癌的发生发展中存在协同作用。情绪压抑越严重，导致癌症所需的吸烟损害就越小。

Kissen’s insights were confirmed in spectacular fashion by a prospective study German, Dutch and Serbian researchers conducted over a ten-year period in Cvrenka, in the former Yugoslavia. The purpose of the study was to investigate the relationship of psychosocial risk factors to mortality. Cvrenka, an industrial town of about fourteen thousand inhabitants, was chosen partly because it was known to have a high mortality rate and partly because its stable population base permitted easier follow-up.

基森的洞见得到了德国、荷兰和塞尔维亚研究人员在原南斯拉夫的茨夫伦卡开展的一项为期十年的前瞻性研究的有力证实。该研究旨在调查社会心理风险因素与死亡率之间的关系。茨夫伦卡是一座拥有约14000名居民的工业城镇，之所以选择这里，部分原因是该镇已知死亡率较高，部分原因是其稳定的人口基数便于后续追踪研究。

Nearly 10 per cent of the town’s inhabitants were selected, about one thousand men and four hundred women. Each was interviewed in 1965–66, with a 109-item questionnaire that delineated such risk factors as adverse life events, a sense of long-lasting hopelessness and a hyper-rational, non-emotional coping style. Physical parameters like cholesterol levels, weight, blood pressure and smoking history were also recorded. People with already diagnosed disease were excluded from the research project.

该镇近10%的居民被选中，约1000名男性和400名女性。在1965年至1966年间，每位受访者都接受了访谈，访谈采用了一份包含109个问题的问卷，问卷内容涵盖了诸如不良生活事件、长期绝望感以及过度理性、缺乏情感的应对方式等风险因素。受访者的生理参数，例如胆固醇水平、体重、血压和吸烟史，也被记录在案。已确诊疾病的患者被排除在研究项目之外。

By 1976, ten years later, over six hundred of the study participants had died of cancer, heart disease, stroke or other causes. The single greatest risk factor for death—and especially for cancer death—was what the researchers called rationality and anti-emotionality, or R/A. The eleven questions identifying R/A measured a single trait: the repression of anger. “Indeed cancer incidence was some 40 times higher in those who answered positively to 10 or 11 of the questions for R/A than in the remaining subjects , who answered positively to about 3 questions on average…. We found that smokers had no incidence of lung cancer unless they also had R/A scores of 10 or 11, suggesting that any effect of smoking on the lung is essentially limited to a ‘susceptible minority.’” 3

到1976年，也就是十年后，超过六百名研究参与者死于癌症、心脏病、中风或其他原因。导致死亡（尤其是癌症死亡）的最大风险因素是研究人员称之为理性与反情绪性（R/A）的特质。用于识别R/A的11个问题衡量的是一种单一特征：压抑愤怒。“事实上，在R/A相关问题中回答10或11个肯定的人中，癌症发病率比其余受试者高出约40倍，而其余受试者平均只回答了约3个肯定问题……我们发现，吸烟者只有在R/A得分达到10或11分时才会患肺癌，这表明吸烟对肺部的任何影响基本上都仅限于‘易感人群’。”

These findings do not absolve tobacco products or cigarette manufacturers of responsibility in the prevalence of lung cancer—on the contrary. All the thirty-eight people in the Cvrenka study who died of lung cancer had been smokers. The results indicated that for lung cancer to occur, tobacco alone is not enough: emotional repression must somehow potentiate the effects of smoke damage on the body. But how?

这些发现并非免除烟草制品或卷烟制造商在肺癌高发中所应承担的责任——恰恰相反。在Cvrenka的研究中，所有38名死于肺癌的人都是吸烟者。结果表明，仅靠吸烟不足以导致肺癌：情绪压抑必然会以某种方式加剧吸烟对身体的损害。但这究竟是如何发生的呢？

Psychological influences make a decisive biological contribution to the onset of malignant disease through the interconnections linking the components of the body’s stress apparatus: the nerves, the hormonal glands, the immune system and the brain centres where emotions are perceived and processed.

心理因素通过连接身体压力机制各组成部分（神经、激素腺体、免疫系统以及感知和处理情绪的大脑中心）的相互联系，对恶性疾病的发生起到决定性的生物学作用。

Biologic and psychological activity are not independent; each represents the functioning of a super-system whose components can no longer be thought of as separate or autonomous mechanisms. The past quarter century of scientific inquiry has supplanted the traditional Western medical view of a split between body and mind with a truer, more unitary perspective. Candace Pert, a leading American researcher, has written that “the conceptual division between the sciences of immunology, endocrinology, and psychology/neuroscience is a historical artifact.” 4 Psychoneuroimmunology —or, more comprehensively and accurately, psychoneuroimmunoendocrinology —is the name of the discipline that studies the interrelated functions of the organs and glands that regulate our behaviour and physiological balance.

生物活动和心理活动并非彼此独立；它们各自代表着一个超系统的运作，该系统的各个组成部分不再能被视为分离或自主的机制。过去25年的科学探索已经用一种更真实、更统一的视角取代了传统的西方医学中身心二元对立的观点。美国著名研究员坎迪斯·珀特（Candace Pert）曾写道：“免疫学、内分泌学和心理学/神经科学之间的概念划分是一种历史遗留问题。” 4 心理神经免疫学——或者更全面、更准确地说，心理神经免疫内分泌学——是研究调节我们行为和生理平衡的器官和腺体之间相互关联的功能的学科。

The brain, nervous system, immune organs and immune cells and the endocrine glands are joined together through several pathways. As more research is done, more links are likely to be discovered. The combined task of this psychoneuroimmunoendocrine (PNI) * system is to ensure the development, survival and reproduction of each organism. The interconnections among the components of the PNI system enable it to recognize potential threats from within or without, and to respond with behaviours and biochemical changes coordinated to maximize safety at minimal cost.

大脑、神经系统、免疫器官和免疫细胞以及内分泌腺通过多条通路相互连接。随着研究的深入，预计会发现更多关联。这一心理神经免疫内分泌（PNI）系统的共同任务是确保每个生物体的发育、生存和繁殖。PNI系统各组成部分之间的相互联系使其能够识别来自内部或外部的潜在威胁，并通过协调一致的行为和生化变化做出反应，从而以最小的代价最大限度地保障安全。

The various parts of the PNI super-system are wired together by nervous system connections, some of them only recently identified. For example, the immune centres—previously thought of as acted on only by hormones—are extensively supplied with nerves. The so-called primary immune organs are the bone marrow and the thymus gland, located in the upper chest in front of the heart. Immune cells maturing in the bone marrow or in the thymus travel to the secondary lymph organs, including the spleen and the lymph glands. Fibres issuing from the central nervous system supply both primary and secondary lymph organs, allowing instant communication from the brain to the immune system. The hormone-producing endocrine glands are also directly wired to the central nervous system. Thus the brain can “talk” directly to the thyroid and adrenal glands, or to the testes and ovaries and other organs.

神经系统（PNI）的各个组成部分通过神经系统连接相互关联，其中一些连接是近期才被发现的。例如，免疫中心——此前人们认为它们只受激素作用——实际上分布着大量的神经。所谓的初级免疫器官是骨髓和胸腺，胸腺位于上胸部，心脏前方。在骨髓或胸腺中成熟的免疫细胞会迁移到次级淋巴器官，包括脾脏和淋巴结。来自中枢神经系统的神经纤维支配着初级和次级淋巴器官，使得大脑能够与免疫系统进行即时通讯。分泌激素的内分泌腺也直接与中枢神经系统相连。因此，大脑可以直接与甲状腺和肾上腺，或者与睾丸、卵巢和其他器官“对话”。

In turn, the hormones from the endocrine glands and substances produced by the immune cells directly affect brain activity. Chemicals from all these sources attach to receptors on the surfaces of brain cells, thereby influencing the organism’s behaviour. We have all had the experience described in medical language as “sickness behaviour,” which illustrates the action of immune products on the brain. A group of chemicals called cytokines, secreted by immune cells, can induce the feelings that prompt us to call in sick to our workplace—fever, loss of appetite, fatigue and increased need for sleep. Distressing as they are, such rapid adaptations are designed to conserve energy, helping us to overcome illness. Inappropriate secretion of the same substances, however, would interfere with normal functioning—for example, by causing excessive fatigue or chronic fatigue.

反过来，内分泌腺分泌的激素和免疫细胞产生的物质会直接影响大脑活动。所有这些来源的化学物质都会与脑细胞表面的受体结合，从而影响机体的行为。我们都经历过医学上所说的“疾病行为”，这正体现了免疫产物对大脑的作用。免疫细胞分泌的一类被称为细胞因子的化学物质，会诱发我们因病请假的症状——发烧、食欲不振、疲劳和睡眠需求增加。尽管这些症状令人不适，但这种快速的适应机制旨在保存能量，帮助我们战胜疾病。然而，如果这些物质分泌不当，就会干扰正常的生理功能——例如，导致过度疲劳或慢性疲劳。

It is astonishing to learn that lymph cells and other white blood cells are capable of manufacturing nearly all the hormones and messenger substances produced in the brain and nervous system. Even endorphins, the body’s intrinsic morphine-like mood-altering chemicals and painkillers, can be secreted by lymphocytes. And these immune cells also have on their surfaces receptors for the hormones and other molecules originating in the brain.

令人惊讶的是，淋巴细胞和其他白细胞几乎能够制造大脑和神经系统产生的所有激素和信使物质。甚至内啡肽——人体自身产生的类似吗啡的、能够改变情绪和止痛的化学物质——也能由淋巴细胞分泌。而且，这些免疫细胞表面还存在着能够识别源自大脑的激素和其他分子的受体。

In short, in addition to the unifying network of nerve fibres that wire together the various components of the PNI super-system, there is also constant biochemical cross-talk among them. The myriad products they can each send to or receive from the others enable them all to speak and understand the same molecular language and to respond, each in its own way, to the same signals. The PNI system is like a giant switchboard, always alight with coordinated messages coming in from all directions and going out to all directions at the same time. It follows, too, that whatever short-term or chronic stimulus acts on any one part of the PNI system, it has the potential to affect the other parts as well.

简而言之，除了将周围神经系统（PNI）各个组成部分连接起来的神经纤维网络之外，它们之间还存在着持续不断的生化信息交流。它们彼此之间能够发送或接收的无数种产物，使它们能够使用同一种分子语言进行交流和理解，并以各自的方式对相同的信号做出反应。PNI系统就像一个巨大的交换机，始终在各个方向同时接收和发送协调一致的信息。因此，作用于PNI系统任何一部分的短期或长期刺激，都有可能影响到其他部分。

What makes possible the versatile interactive functions of the PNI system? A microscopic look would reveal numerous receptor sites on the surface of each cell to which the common molecular messengers can bind. As Candace Pert reports, a typical nerve cell, or neuron, may have millions of receptors on its surface: “If you were to assign a different color to each of the receptors that scientists have identified, the average cell surface would appear as a multicolored mosaic of at least seventy different hues—50,000 of one type of receptor, 10,000 of another, 100,000 of a third, and so forth.” 5

是什么使得PNI系统能够实现如此多样的交互功能？显微镜观察会发现，每个细胞表面都存在大量受体位点，常见的分子信使可以与其结合。正如坎迪斯·珀特（Candace Pert）所报道的那样，一个典型的神经细胞（神经元）表面可能拥有数百万个受体：“如果给科学家已识别的每种受体都赋予一种不同的颜色，那么平均而言，细胞表面看起来就像一幅至少由七十种不同色调组成的彩色马赛克——五万个一种受体，一万个另一种，十万个第三种，以此类推。”

The messenger molecules and most of the hormones are made of amino acids, the basic building blocks of protein. They are called peptides, the technical name for longer chains of amino acids. None of these chemicals are restricted to any one area or organ of the body. An eminent neuroscientist has suggested the term “information substances” to describe the entire group, because they each carry information from one cell or one organ to another. There are multiple potential interactions between information substances emanating from each part of the PNI system and cell types in each other part.

信使分子和大多数激素都由氨基酸构成，氨基酸是蛋白质的基本组成单元。它们被称为肽，肽是较长氨基酸链的专业术语。这些化学物质并不局限于身体的任何特定区域或器官。一位杰出的神经科学家提出用“信息物质”一词来描述整个群体，因为它们各自负责将信息从一个细胞或器官传递到另一个细胞或器官。来自周围神经系统各个部分的信息物质与系统中其他部分的各种细胞类型之间存在多种潜在的相互作用。

The hub of the PNI system is the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal nexus: the HPA axis. It is through the activation of the HPA axis that both psychological and physical stimuli set in motion the body’s responses to threat. Psychological stimuli are first evaluated in the emotional centres known as the limbic system, which includes parts of the cerebral cortex and also deeper brain structures. If the brain interprets the incoming information as threatening, the hypothalamus will induce the pituitary to secrete an adrenocorticotropic hormone. ACTH, in turn, causes the cortex of the adrenal gland to secrete cortisol into the circulation.

神经系统的核心是下丘脑-垂体-肾上腺轴（HPA轴）。心理和生理刺激通过激活HPA轴，启动身体对威胁的反应。心理刺激首先在被称为边缘系统的情绪中枢进行评估，边缘系统包括部分大脑皮层以及更深层的脑结构。如果大脑将接收到的信息解读为威胁，下丘脑会诱导垂体分泌促肾上腺皮质激素（ACTH）。ACTH反过来会促使肾上腺皮质分泌皮质醇进入血液循环。

Simultaneously with this hormonal cascade, the hypothalamus sends messages via the sympathetic nervous system—the flight-or-fight part of the nervous system—to another part of the adrenal, the medulla. The adrenal medulla manufactures and secretes the flight-fight hormone, adrenalin, which immediately stimulates the cardiovascular and nervous systems.

在这一激素级联反应的同时，下丘脑通过交感神经系统（即神经系统中负责“战斗或逃跑”反应的部分）向肾上腺髓质发送信号。肾上腺髓质制造并分泌“战斗或逃跑”激素——肾上腺素，这种激素会立即刺激心血管系统和神经系统。

The same influences that the organism is most likely to interpret as emotionally stressful are, not surprisingly, also the most powerful psychic triggers for the HPA axis: “Psychological factors such as uncertainty, conflict, lack of control, and lack of information are considered the most stressful stimuli and strongly activate the HPA axis. Sense of control and consummatory behaviour result in immediate suppression of HPA activity.” 6

不出所料，那些最容易被机体解读为情绪压力源的因素，也是下丘脑-垂体-肾上腺轴（HPA轴）最强烈的心理触发因素：“不确定性、冲突、失控感和信息匮乏等心理因素被认为是压力最大的刺激因素，能够强烈激活HPA轴。控制感和满足感则会导致HPA轴活动立即受到抑制。”

Consummatory behaviour—from the Latin consummare , “to complete”—is behaviour that removes the danger or relieves the tension caused by it. We recall that stress-inducing stimuli are not always objective external threats like predators or potential physical disasters but also include internal perceptions that something we consider essential is lacking. This is why lack of control, lack of information—and, as we will see, unsatisfied emotional needs (e.g., lack of love), trigger the HPA axis. Consummation of such needs abolishes the stress response.

满足行为——源自拉丁语 consummare，意为“完成”——是指消除危险或缓解危险所引发的紧张情绪的行为。我们知道，引发压力的刺激并非总是客观的外部威胁，例如捕食者或潜在的自然灾害，也包括我们认为必不可少的某些东西缺失的内在感知。这就是为什么缺乏控制感、缺乏信息，以及我们将看到的未被满足的情感需求（例如，缺乏爱）会激活下丘脑-垂体-肾上腺轴（HPA轴）。满足这些需求可以消除压力反应。

Given the biochemical and neurological cross-influences within the PNI system, we can readily understand how emotions are able to interact with hormones, immune defences and the nervous system. In cancer causation, disturbed hormonal activity and impaired immune defences both play a role. Lung cancer is a prime example.

鉴于PNI系统内部的生化和神经学交叉影响，我们很容易理解情绪如何与激素、免疫防御和神经系统相互作用。在癌症的发生发展中，激素活动紊乱和免疫防御受损都发挥着作用。肺癌就是一个典型的例子。

The mechanistic view holds that cancer results from damage to the DNA of a cell by some noxious substance—for example, tobacco-breakdown products. This perspective is valid as far it goes but cannot explain why some smokers develop cancers while others do not, even if the amount and type of tobacco they inhale are exactly the same. The unanswered questions are, Why are the cells of some individuals more susceptible than those of others? Why does DNA repair occur in some people but not in others? Why do the immune system and other defences keep cancer at bay in some people but not in others? What accounts for vast differences in cure or disease progression from one person to the next, even when the identical cancer is diagnosed at exactly the same stage and even when all other factors—age, gender, income, general health—are exactly matched?

机械论观点认为，癌症是由某些有害物质（例如烟草分解产物）对细胞DNA造成的损伤引起的。这种观点在一定程度上是成立的，但它无法解释为什么有些吸烟者会患癌，而另一些吸烟者却不会，即使他们吸入的烟草种类和数量完全相同。未解之谜是：为什么有些人的细胞比其他人的细胞更容易受到损伤？为什么有些人的DNA能够修复，而有些人的DNA却不能？为什么有些人的免疫系统和其他防御机制能够抑制癌症，而有些人的免疫系统和其他防御机制却不能？即使确诊的癌症分期完全相同，即使所有其他因素（年龄、性别、收入、总体健康状况）都完全相同，为什么不同患者的治愈率或疾病进展却存在如此巨大的差异？

Genetic variations may explain these issues in some cancers, although, as we have seen with breast cancer, in the majority of people heredity does not play a role in cancer causation. Lung cancer, specifically, is not a genetically transmitted disease, nor is the damage to genes in lung cancer due to heredity.

基因变异或许可以解释某些癌症的这些问题，但正如我们在乳腺癌中所看到的，在大多数人中，遗传并不影响癌症的发生。具体而言，肺癌并非遗传性疾病，肺癌中的基因损伤也不是由遗传造成的。

The development of any malignancy progresses through several stages, the first of which is initiation , the process by which a normal cell becomes transformed into an abnormal one. Cancer may be seen as a disease of cell replication. The normal processes of cell division and cell death are somehow subverted. A cell that should give rise to healthy offspring escapes from control and divides into malformed facsimiles that replicate themselves without regard to the biological needs of the organism. With millions of cells dying or being formed in the body every day, natural accident would, by itself, lead to a great number of spontaneous abnormal transformations. “It’s a fact that every one of us has a number of tiny cancerous tumours growing in our bodies at every moment,” writes Candace Pert.

任何恶性肿瘤的发展都经历几个阶段，第一阶段是起始阶段，即正常细胞转化为异常细胞的过程。癌症可以被视为一种细胞复制疾病。正常的细胞分裂和死亡过程在某种程度上被破坏。原本应该产生健康后代的细胞摆脱了控制，分裂成畸形的复制品，这些复制品不顾机体的生物学需求而自我复制。由于每天都有数百万个细胞在体内死亡或形成，自然界的偶然事件本身就会导致大量的自发性异常转化。“事实上，我们每个人体内每时每刻都有许多微小的癌性肿瘤在生长，”坎迪斯·珀特写道。

Tobacco smoke has a directly damaging effect on the genetic material of lung cells. It has been estimated that for the initiation of cancer, lung cells have to acquire as many as ten separate lesions or points of damage on their DNA. Yet, no matter where in the body, such genomic damage “seldom leads to tumour formation. This is principally due to the fact that most primary lesions are transient and are readily eliminated by DNA repair or cell death.” 7 In other words, DNA repairs itself or the cell dies without replicating its damaged genetic material—which, no doubt, accounts for the fact that most smokers do not develop clinical lung cancer. Where cancer does arise, either DNA repair or the normal process of cell death must have failed. In a 1999 review of psychological effects on lung cancer, researchers from the Ohio State University College of Medicine wrote: “Faulty DNA repair is associated with an increased incidence of cancer. Stress may alter these DNA repair mechanisms; for example, in one study, lymphocytes from psychiatric inpatients with higher depressive symptoms demonstrated impairment in their ability to repair cellular DNA damaged by exposure to X-irradiation [X-rays].” 8 Impaired DNA repair has also been documented in studies of stressed laboratory animals.

烟草烟雾会对肺细胞的遗传物质造成直接损害。据估计，肺细胞发生癌症需要DNA上出现多达十个独立的损伤点。然而，无论这种基因组损伤发生在身体的哪个部位，“很少会导致肿瘤形成。这主要是因为大多数原发性损伤是短暂的，很容易被DNA修复或细胞死亡清除。” 7 换句话说，DNA会自我修复，或者细胞会在未复制受损遗传物质的情况下死亡——这无疑解释了为什么大多数吸烟者不会发展成临床肺癌。如果癌症确实发生，则一定是DNA修复或正常的细胞死亡过程失败了。 1999 年，俄亥俄州立大学医学院的研究人员在一篇关于心理因素对肺癌影响的综述中写道：“DNA 修复缺陷与癌症发病率增加有关。压力可能会改变这些 DNA 修复机制；例如，在一项研究中，抑郁症状较重的精神科住院患者的淋巴细胞修复 X 射线照射造成的细胞 DNA 损伤的能力受损。” 8 在对受压实验动物的研究中也记录了 DNA 修复受损的情况。

Apoptosis is the scientific term for the physiologically regulated death necessary for the maintenance of healthy tissues. Apoptosis ensures normal tissue turnover, culling older cells with weakened genetic material, leaving room for their healthy and vigorous offspring. “Dysregulated apoptosis contributes to many pathologies, including tumour production, autoimmune and immunodeficiency diseases, and neurodegenerative disorders.” 9

细胞凋亡是生理性细胞死亡的科学术语，这种死亡对于维持健康组织至关重要。细胞凋亡确保正常的组织更新，清除遗传物质衰弱的衰老细胞，为健康强壮的后代细胞腾出空间。“细胞凋亡失调会导致多种疾病，包括肿瘤发生、自身免疫性疾病和免疫缺陷疾病以及神经退行性疾病。”

Steroid hormones released through the activity of the HPA axis help regulate apoptosis in a number of ways. Habitual repression of emotion leaves a person in a situation of chronic stress, and chronic stress creates an unnatural biochemical milieu in the body. Perpetually abnormal steroid hormone levels can interfere with normal programmed cell death. Also participating in cell death are natural killer cells. Depression—a mental state in which repression of anger dominates emotional functioning—interacts with cigarette smoking to lower the activity of NK cells. 10

下丘脑-垂体-肾上腺轴（HPA轴）活动释放的类固醇激素以多种方式帮助调节细胞凋亡。习惯性压抑情绪会使人处于慢性应激状态，而慢性应激会在体内造成不自然的生化环境。持续异常的类固醇激素水平会干扰正常的程序性细胞死亡。自然杀伤细胞（NK细胞）也参与细胞死亡。抑郁症——一种以压抑愤怒主导情绪功能的精神状态——与吸烟相互作用，会降低NK细胞的活性。

In short, for cancer causation it is not enough that DNA damage occur: also necessary are failure of DNA repair and/or an impairment of regulated cell death. Stress and the repression of emotion can negatively affect both of those processes. The findings of the Cvrenka investigators and of the British surgeon David Kissen make physiological sense when we consider the first stage of malignant transformation, that of initiation.

简而言之，癌症的发生并非仅仅因为发生了DNA损伤：DNA修复失败和/或细胞死亡调控受损也是必要条件。压力和情绪压抑会对这两个过程都产生负面影响。当我们考虑恶性转化的第一阶段，即起始阶段时，Cvrenka研究者和英国外科医生David Kissen的发现就具有生理学意义。

A two-part article published in the Canadian Medical Association Journal in 1996 reviewed the role of the PNI system in health and disease. “In healthy people,” noted the authors, “neuroimmune mechanisms provide host defence against infection, injury, cancer, and control immune and inflammatory reactions, which pre-empt disease.” 11 Disease, in other words, is not a simple result of some external attack but develops in a vulnerable host in whom the internal environment has become disordered.

1996年发表于《加拿大医学会杂志》的一篇分为两部分的文章回顾了周围神经免疫系统在健康和疾病中的作用。作者指出：“在健康人群中，神经免疫机制能够防御感染、损伤和癌症，并控制免疫和炎症反应，从而预防疾病的发生。”换句话说，疾病并非仅仅是外部攻击的结果，而是发生在内部环境紊乱的脆弱宿主身上。

Subsequent phases of cancerous change are promotion and progression . Having escaped the normal regulatory mechanisms that should have prevented their survival, the newly malignant cells continue to divide, leading to the formation of a tumour. At this stage, tumour growth can be inhibited or supported by the body’s internal environment. The PNI super-system comes into play. Acting chiefly through hormonal regulation by the HPA axis, it creates a milieu in the body tissues that is either receptive or hostile to the growth and spread of cancer.

癌变的后续阶段是促进期和进展期。这些新生的恶性细胞逃脱了原本应该阻止其存活的正常调控机制，持续分裂，最终形成肿瘤。在这个阶段，肿瘤的生长可能受到机体内部环境的抑制或促进。神经系统（PNI）发挥着重要作用。它主要通过下丘脑-垂体-肾上腺轴（HPA轴）的激素调节发挥作用，在体内组织中创造一种有利于或不利于癌细胞生长和扩散的微环境。

“The chronic psychological status of the individual may play an important role either in facilitating tumour promotion or in dampening or accentuating the impacts of environmental stress,” Dr. Marc E. Lippman, head of the breast cancer section, Medicine Branch, National Cancer Institute, Bethesda, Maryland, has written. “The human endocrine system provides one critical mediator of interaction between psyche and tumor…. It seems inescapable that psychic factors which can evoke endocrine changes will have effects on actual tumour biology.” 12

“个体的慢性心理状态可能在促进肿瘤发展或减弱/增强环境压力影响方面发挥重要作用，”美国国家癌症研究所医学部乳腺癌科主任马克·E·利普曼博士（Marc E. Lippman）写道。“人类内分泌系统是心理与肿瘤相互作用的关键介质之一……能够引发内分泌变化的心理因素必然会对肿瘤生物学产生影响。”

The effect of hormones on the growth and spread of cancer is twofold. First, many tumours are directly hormone dependent, or they arise in organs intimately involved in hormonal interactions, such as the ovaries or the testes. Hormone-dependent cancer cells bear on their membranes receptors for various hormones capable of promoting cell growth. One example of a hormone-dependent cancer is that of the breast. It is generally understood that many breast cancers are estrogen dependent, this being the rationale for the use of the estrogen-blocking drug tamoxifen. Less well known is that some breast cancers have receptors for a broad array of other “information substances,” including androgens (male sex hormones), progestins, prolactin, insulin, vitamin D and several more—all of them secreted by the HPA axis or regulated by it.

激素对癌症生长和扩散的影响体现在两个方面。首先，许多肿瘤直接依赖于激素，或者起源于与激素相互作用密切相关的器官，例如卵巢或睾丸。激素依赖性癌细胞的细胞膜上存在多种激素受体，这些激素能够促进细胞生长。乳腺癌就是一个激素依赖性癌症的例子。人们普遍认为许多乳腺癌依赖于雌激素，这也是使用雌激素阻断药物他莫昔芬的理论依据。然而，鲜为人知的是，一些乳腺癌还存在多种其他“信息物质”的受体，包括雄激素（男性性激素）、孕激素、催乳素、胰岛素、维生素D等等——所有这些激素都由下丘脑-垂体-肾上腺轴（HPA轴）分泌或受其调控。

Stress is a powerful modulator of hormonal function, as seen in both human experience and animal studies. In one experiment, researchers manipulated the dominance relationships in groups of female monkeys. Established dominance patterns were broken up. Some previously dominant animals were forced into subordination, while subordinate ones were enabled to achieve dominant status.

压力是激素功能的强效调节因素，这在人类经验和动物研究中均有体现。在一项实验中，研究人员操纵了雌性猴群中的等级关系。他们打破了原有的等级格局，一些原本处于优势地位的动物被迫降为从属，而原本处于从属地位的动物则被赋予了晋升为优势地位的机会。

Social subordination caused hormonal dysfunctions of the HPA axis and of the ovaries. “Females that were currently dominant secreted less cortisol than those who were currently subordinate.” Dominant female monkeys had normal menstruations and higher concentrations of progesterone prior to ovulation. Subordinates ovulated less often and more frequently had impaired menstrual cycles.

社会地位低下导致下丘脑-垂体-肾上腺轴（HPA轴）和卵巢的激素功能紊乱。“目前处于优势地位的雌性分泌的皮质醇少于目前处于劣势地位的雌性。” 优势雌性月经正常，排卵前孕酮浓度较高。劣势雌性排卵较少，且月经周期紊乱的情况更为常见。

When the experimental situation was altered so that previously dominant monkeys became subordinate, their reproductive function was almost immediately suppressed and their cortisol production went up. The reverse was the case in monkeys previously subordinate but newly made dominant. 13

当实验情境改变，原本处于优势地位的猴子变为从属地位时，它们的生殖功能几乎立即受到抑制，皮质醇分泌量上升。而原本处于从属地位但新近成为优势地位的猴子，情况则相反。

Cancers of the female gynecological organs such as the ovaries and the uterus are also hormone related. Ovarian malignancy is only the seventh most common cancer in women, but it is the fourth leading cause of cancer deaths. Of all cancers, it carries the highest tumour-to-death ratio: that is, it has the poorest prognosis. In 1999, twenty-six hundred Canadian women were diagnosed with ovarian cancer. In the same year, fifteen hundred died of it. In the U.S. about twenty thousand women are diagnosed annually; nearly two-thirds of them will succumb to the disease. Although early treatment is highly effective, by the time most cases are diagnosed, the cancer has advanced beyond the ability of current treatment to cure it.

女性妇科器官（如卵巢和子宫）的癌症也与激素相关。卵巢癌虽然仅是女性第七大常见癌症，却是第四大癌症死亡原因。在所有癌症中，它的肿瘤死亡率最高，也就是说，预后最差。1999年，加拿大有2600名女性被诊断出患有卵巢癌，同年有1500人死于该病。在美国，每年约有2万名女性被诊断出患有卵巢癌，其中近三分之二的人最终会死于该病。尽管早期治疗非常有效，但大多数病例确诊时，癌症已发展到晚期，超出了现有治疗的治愈范围。

As yet there are no effective screening tests to identify the initial stages of this disease. Ultrasounds and a blood test, called CA-125, are useful in monitoring treatment, but neither is reliable as a tool to find the cancer before it causes symptoms or before it spreads beyond its site of origin. Darlene, an insurance broker, was diagnosed during the course of an infertility workup. “They did a laparoscopy to look at my ovaries,” she says, “and that’s how they found the cancer. So instead of a child, I ended up with an oophorectomy.”

目前尚无有效的筛查方法可以识别这种疾病的早期阶段。超声波检查和一种名为CA-125的血液检测有助于监测治疗情况，但两者都无法可靠地在癌症出现症状或扩散到原发部位以外之前发现它。达琳是一名保险经纪人，她在进行不孕症检查时被确诊患有这种疾病。“他们做了腹腔镜检查来检查我的卵巢，”她说，“就是这样发现了癌症。所以，我最终没能拥有一个孩子，而是做了卵巢切除手术。”

Since infertility is one of the known risk indicators for ovarian cancer, hormonal factors are obviously important. Unfortunately, the picture is confusing. Early menses and late menopause increase the risk of developing ovarian cancer, while pregnancies and the birth control pill decrease it. This pattern would suggest that the more women ovulate, the more susceptible they become to the disease. On the other hand, infertility—when no ovulation takes place—also adds to the risk. Evidently the hormonal influences here are subtle and complicated. What we do know about the hormones of female reproduction is that they are exquisitively sensitive to women’s psychological states and to the stresses in their lives. Hormonal function may also be related to certain character traits, as a study at the University of Pittsburgh in 2001 concluded.

由于不孕是卵巢癌的已知风险因素之一，激素因素的重要性不言而喻。然而，实际情况却令人困惑。初潮提前和绝经延迟会增加患卵巢癌的风险，而怀孕和服用避孕药则会降低风险。这种模式似乎表明，女性排卵越多，患卵巢癌的风险就越高。另一方面，不孕——即没有排卵——也会增加患病风险。显然，激素的影响微妙而复杂。我们目前已知的是，女性生殖激素对女性的心理状态和生活压力极其敏感。正如匹兹堡大学2001年的一项研究得出的结论，激素功能也可能与某些性格特征相关。

Researchers at the Pittsburgh School of Medicine compared the psychological characterisitics of women with chronically missed periods—amenorrhea—with women whose menstruation was normal. They were particularly interested in a group with functional hypothalamic amenorrhea (FHA), that is, the group of women who had no identifiable disease or condition to account for the lack of normal ovulation. The study found that “the women with FHA reported more dysfunctional attitudes, particularly those associated with need for approval. [They] were more likely … to endorse attitudes that are prevalent among persons vulnerable to depression, such as perfectionistic standards and concern about the judgment of others. 14

匹兹堡医学院的研究人员比较了长期闭经（月经不调）女性和月经正常的女性的心理特征。他们尤其关注功能性下丘脑性闭经（FHA）组，即没有可识别的疾病或状况导致排卵障碍的女性群体。研究发现，“患有FHA的女性表现出更多功能失调的态度，尤其是那些与寻求认可相关的态度。她们更容易……认同那些在易患抑郁症的人群中普遍存在的态度，例如完美主义标准和对他人评价的过度关注。”

A major finding of the Pittsburgh researchers was the discovery of subtly but significantly disturbed eating habits in non-menstruating women. Troubled eating patterns are inextricably linked with unresolved childhood issues, as we will see, for example, in the case of the comedienne Gilda Radner who died of ovarian cancer. The stresses that create the problems with self-nurture are also stresses that predispose to ill health. The authors of the Pittsburgh study write that “women with FHA report more concerns about dieting and weight, fear of weight gain, and tendencies to engage in binge eating.”

匹兹堡研究人员的一项重要发现是，他们发现非月经期女性的饮食习惯存在细微但显著的紊乱。不良的饮食模式与未解决的童年问题密不可分，例如，我们将在死于卵巢癌的喜剧演员吉尔达·拉德纳的案例中看到这一点。导致自我关爱问题的压力，也是导致健康问题的压力源。匹兹堡研究的作者写道：“患有功能性食欲不振（FHA）的女性更关注节食和体重，害怕体重增加，并且有暴饮暴食的倾向。”

Eating patterns are directly connected with emotional issues arising both from childhood and from current stresses. The patterns of how we eat or don’t eat, and how much we eat, are strongly related to the levels of stress we experience and to the coping responses we have developed in face of life’s vicissitudes. In turn, dietary habits intimately affect the functioning of the hormones that influence the female reproductive tract. Anorexics, for example, will often stop menstruating.

饮食习惯与童年时期和当前压力造成的心理问题直接相关。我们的饮食方式（包括进食或不进食）以及进食量，都与我们所承受的压力水平以及我们为应对人生变迁而发展出的应对机制密切相关。反过来，饮食习惯又会深刻影响女性生殖系统相关激素的功能。例如，厌食症患者常常会出现月经停止的情况。

Jerilynn Prior, a Vancouver endocrinologist with a special interest in women’s health issues, found that subtle hormonal disruptions can occur even among women who report regular periods and no symptoms. She wrote in the Canadian Journal of Diagnosis: “Approximately one-third of regular, asymptomatic menstrual cycles of healthy women will have disturbances of ovulation that, based on biologic principles, could lead to significant health risks.” 15

温哥华内分泌学家杰里琳·普赖尔（Jerilynn Prior）尤其关注女性健康问题，她发现即使是月经规律且无任何症状的女性，也可能出现轻微的激素紊乱。她在《加拿大诊断杂志》（Canadian Journal of Diagnosis）上撰文指出：“大约三分之一健康女性规律且无症状的月经周期会出现排卵障碍，根据生物学原理，这可能导致严重的健康风险。”

The commonest cause of failed ovulation in Dr. Prior’s study was insufficient stimulation of the ovaries by the hypothalamus and pituitary due to “an imbalance or incoordination in the signals sent from the hypothalamus and pituitary gland to the ovarian follicle.” These disturbances, wrote Dr. Prior, “are caused by adaptions related to life cycle, changes in weight, psychosocial stresses, excessive exercise, or illness.”

普赖尔博士的研究表明，排卵失败最常见的原因是下丘脑和垂体对卵巢的刺激不足，这是由于“下丘脑和垂体向卵泡发送的信号失衡或不协调”造成的。普赖尔博士写道，这些紊乱“是由与生命周期相关的适应性变化、体重变化、社会心理压力、过度运动或疾病引起的”。

Malignancies of the hematological (blood-cell producing) system such as leukemia and lymphoma are also hormone dependent, being profoundly affected by cortisol produced in the adrenal gland. Adrenal corticoid hormones inhibit the division and spread of leukemia and lymphoma cells. Thus, hematological malignancies may, in part, result when blood and lymph cells escape from normal inhibition owing to a chronically unbalanced HPA system. The available research points to emotional stress as a significant dynamic in the lives of adults with these diseases.

血液系统恶性肿瘤，例如白血病和淋巴瘤，也与激素密切相关，深受肾上腺分泌的皮质醇的影响。肾上腺皮质激素能够抑制白血病和淋巴瘤细胞的分裂和扩散。因此，血液系统恶性肿瘤的发生，部分原因可能是由于下丘脑-垂体-肾上腺轴（HPA轴）长期失衡，导致血液和淋巴细胞摆脱了正常的抑制。现有研究表明，情绪压力是影响成年患者生活的重要因素。

At the University of Rochester, a fifteen-year study of people who developed lymphoma or leukemia reportedly found that these malignancies were “apt to occur in a setting of emotional loss or separation which in turn brought about feelings of anxiety, sadness, anger or hopelessness.” 16

据报道，罗切斯特大学一项针对淋巴瘤或白血病患者的长达十五年的研究发现，这些恶性肿瘤“往往发生在经历情感失落或分离的情况下，而这反过来又会引发焦虑、悲伤、愤怒或绝望等情绪。” 16

Synthetic analogues of the stress hormone cortisol are important components of the treatment of leukemia and lymphoma. Interestingly, the amount of cortisol-like hormone needed to block the replication of leukemic cells is only a little higher than what should normally be functionally available in the body. In the case of leukemia, episodes of acute stress in which the cortisol levels temporarily rise are sometimes enough to induce a remission. Such is thought to have happened during the illness of the composer Béla Bartók.

皮质醇这种应激激素的合成类似物是治疗白血病和淋巴瘤的重要组成部分。有趣的是，抑制白血病细胞复制所需的皮质醇样激素量仅比体内正常功能性水平略高。对于白血病患者而言，急性应激导致皮质醇水平暂时升高，有时足以诱发病情缓解。据信，作曲家贝拉·巴托克患病期间就出现了这种情况。

We need to recall here that the temporary elevation of cortisol that occurs in episodes of acute stress is healthy and necessary. Not healthy are the chronically elevated cortisol levels in chronically stressed persons.

我们需要在此强调，急性应激期间皮质醇的暂时性升高是健康且必要的。而长期处于应激状态的人皮质醇水平持续升高则不健康。

Bartók, in exile from his native Hungary and stricken with leukemia, was commissioned by the conductor of the Boston Symphony Orchestra, Serge Koussevitsky, to write a new piece. The composer went into spontanous remission, which lasted until the work was completed. Quite likely, HPA-triggered cortisol and several other elements of the PNI system contributed to this famous remission, which made possible the creation of Bartók’s Concerto for Orchestra , a classic of twentieth-century music.

巴托克流亡海外，身患白血病，被迫离开故土匈牙利。波士顿交响乐团指挥谢尔盖·库塞维茨基委托他创作一部新作品。创作过程中，巴托克的病情意外缓解，直至作品完成。很可能，下丘脑-垂体-肾上腺轴（HPA轴）触发的皮质醇分泌以及副交感神经系统（PNI系统）的其他一些因素促成了这一著名的病情缓解，最终使得巴托克创作出《管弦乐协奏曲》——这部二十世纪音乐经典之作。

Apart from their direct effects on hormone-dependent malignancies, hormones regulated by the stress-sensitive HPA axis and by limbic areas of the brain act on other tissues in the body to influence the development of cancers. Chief among these hormone-sensitive tissues is the immune system.

除了对激素依赖性恶性肿瘤的直接影响外，由应激敏感的下丘脑-垂体-肾上腺轴（HPA轴）和大脑边缘系统调节的激素还会作用于体内其他组织，从而影响癌症的发生发展。在这些对激素敏感的组织中，免疫系统最为重要。

It is customary to conceive of cancer as an invader against whom the body—like a country under foreign attack—must wage war. Such a view, while perhaps comforting in its simplicity, is a distortion of reality. First, even when there is an external carcinogen like tobacco, the cancer itself is partially an outcome of internal processes gone wrong. And, of course, for most cancers there is no such identified carcinogen. Second, it is the internal environment, locally and throughout the entire organism, that plays the major role in deciding whether the malignancy will flourish or be eliminated. The malignant transformation of normal cells, in other words, is a process determined by many factors that have at least as much to do with the biopsychosocial state of the organism as with the type of cancer itself.

人们通常将癌症视为一种入侵者，人体就像遭受外敌入侵的国家一样，必须与之作战。这种观点虽然简单明了，或许令人感到安慰，但却歪曲了现实。首先，即使存在像烟草这样的外部致癌物，癌症本身也部分是内部过程失衡的结果。当然，大多数癌症并没有已知的致癌物。其次，决定恶性肿瘤能否发展或被清除的关键因素是机体内部环境，包括局部环境和整个机体的环境。换句话说，正常细胞的恶性转化是一个受多种因素影响的过程，这些因素与机体的生物心理社会状态的关系至少与癌症类型本身的关系一样密切。

Once a cancer reaches the stage where its cell surfaces display molecules different from the normal body proteins, it ought to be destroyed by immune responses of many different kinds. T-cells should attack it with noxious chemicals; antibodies should be formed against it; specialized blood cells should chew it up. Under conditions of chronic stress, the immune system may become either too confused to recognize the mutated cell clones that form the cancer or too debilitated to mount an effective attack against them.

一旦癌细胞发展到其细胞表面表达与正常人体蛋白质不同的分子，就应该被多种免疫反应摧毁。T细胞会释放有害化学物质攻击癌细胞；人体会产生抗体来对抗癌细胞；特化的血细胞会将其吞噬。但在慢性应激状态下，免疫系统可能变得混乱，无法识别构成癌细胞的突变细胞克隆，或者过于虚弱，无法对其发起有效的攻击。

Also implicated in the growth and development of tumours are a large number of locally produced chemicals, some secreted by the cancer cells themselves. Such chemicals include growth factors, inhibitory substances and messenger molecules of many kinds. A complicated balance among them will tilt the process toward either tumour suppression or tumour growth. Suffice it to say here that this intricate biochemical cascade is profoundly influenced by the PNI system, particularly through hormones and other information substances.

肿瘤的生长和发展还与大量局部产生的化学物质有关，其中一些是由癌细胞自身分泌的。这些化学物质包括生长因子、抑制性物质和多种信使分子。它们之间复杂的平衡将决定肿瘤的生长或抑制。值得一提的是，这种复杂的生化级联反应深受神经心理系统（PNI）的影响，特别是通过激素和其他信息物质。

Finally, emotional states are of great potential significance in the prevention or encouragement of cancer metastasis, the movement of malignant cells from the original tumour site to other areas of the body.

最后，情绪状态在预防或促进癌症转移（即恶性细胞从原发肿瘤部位转移到身体其他部位）方面具有巨大的潜在意义。

In popular mythology, cancer has to be “caught early” before it has a chance to spread. The biological reality is quite different: by the time a tumour becomes detectable, spread has, in many cases, already occurred. “A high proportion of early cancers have already thrown off occult metastases by the time the primary tumour is diagnosed,” the British oncologist Basil Stoll has pointed out. 17 However, most metastases either die or lie dormant for a long time.

在民间传说中，癌症必须在扩散之前“早期发现”。但生物学事实却截然不同：当肿瘤被发现时，很多情况下癌细胞已经扩散。“相当一部分早期癌症在原发肿瘤确诊时就已经发生了隐匿性转移，”英国肿瘤学家巴兹尔·斯托尔指出。然而，大多数转移灶要么死亡，要么长期处于休眠状态。

Doubling time—the amount of time needed for a tumour mass to double in size—varies from one cancer type to another, and there are great variations within individual cancer types. For a tumour to become clinically noticeable, even on an easily accessible body tissue like the skin or the breast, it has to become about half a gram in size, comprising about five hundred million cells. A single cell with a malignant mutation would have to double about thirty times to reach such dimensions. 18 In breast cancer, doubling time has been calculated to range from a few days to one and one-half years, with an average of about four months. “If a tumour cell were to grow constantly at the last rate, it would take about eight years to become clinically evident, and some sources suggest an even longer doubling time with a time span of about 15–20 years to become clinically evident.” 19

肿瘤倍增时间——即肿瘤体积翻倍所需的时间——因癌症类型而异，即使是同一种癌症，倍增时间也存在很大差异。即使在皮肤或乳房等易于触及的组织中，肿瘤也需要长到约半克重（约五亿个细胞）才能在临床上被察觉。一个携带恶性突变的细胞需要增殖约三十次才能达到这样的大小。在乳腺癌中，肿瘤倍增时间的计算范围从几天到一年半不等，平均约为四个月。“如果肿瘤细胞以上述速度持续生长，大约需要八年时间才能在临床上显现出来，一些资料显示，肿瘤倍增时间甚至更长，需要大约15-20年才能在临床上显现出来。”

In the real life of a tumour, there is probably no steady doubling rate. Rather, there are broad fluctuations in growth rate depending on what is happening in the life of the host. We recall the history of Michelle, whose breast lump, which had been present for seven years, changed dramatically after a period of acute stress.

在肿瘤的真实生长过程中，可能并不存在稳定的倍增速度。相反，其生长速度会根据宿主的生活状况而出现大幅波动。我们不妨回顾一下米歇尔的案例，她乳房中的肿块已经存在了七年，但在经历一段急性应激期后发生了显著变化。

Since breast cancers have the potential to metastasize by the time they are a little over half a millimetre in diameter, “if a tumor is going to metastasize, in general it will already have done so by the time [it] is clinically detectable.” 20 Microscopic spread of malignant cells seems to happen in many cases of breast cancer without ever causing clinical problems. In other cases, the metastatic deposit may lie dormant in distant tissues for years and then, unexpectedly, declare itself in the form of symptoms. The same dynamic operates with prostate cancer, which is why spread has already occurred in 40 per cent of prostate malignancies by the time the diagnosis is made. In fact, in a striking similarity with prostate cancer, autopsy studies on women indicate that as many as 25 to 30 per cent of all women have microscopic breast malignancies, “far in excess of the number ever actually manifested.” 21

由于乳腺癌在直径略大于半毫米时就可能发生转移，“如果肿瘤要发生转移，通常情况下，在临床上可检测到时就已经发生了。” 20 在许多乳腺癌病例中，恶性细胞的微观扩散似乎从未引起任何临床症状。在其他情况下，转移灶可能在远处组织中潜伏多年，然后突然以症状的形式表现出来。前列腺癌也存在同样的动态，这就是为什么在确诊时，40%的前列腺癌已经发生扩散。事实上，与前列腺癌惊人地相似，对女性的尸检研究表明，高达25%至30%的女性患有微观乳腺恶性肿瘤，“远远超过实际出现症状的数量。” 21

The issue, therefore, is not simply the prevention of spread, but why and under what conditions in some people already existing dormant deposits convert into clinical cancer. Tumour dormancy is affected by many hormonal and immunological influences, all of them functions of the PNI system and all of them highly susceptible to life stresses.

因此，问题的关键不仅在于如何阻止癌细胞扩散，还在于探究为何以及在何种条件下，某些人体内已存在的休眠病灶会转化为临床癌症。肿瘤休眠受多种激素和免疫因素的影响，这些因素均属于神经心理系统（PNI）的功能范畴，且极易受到生活压力的影响。

There are dramatic fluctuations in tumour growth rates from one patient to the next. Also evident is a high degree of inconsistency in the appearance of metastatic disease and of survival times among patients who, clinically, are diagnosed with exactly the same type of cancer at the same stage of severity. For example, there are “many cases where incompletely excised breast cancers never recur, or where secondary deposits lie dormant in the host tissues for up to 30 years before finally manifesting.” 22 Such individual differences, it would seem, are due not to the autonomous behaviour of the malignancy but to factors in the body’s internal environment that inhibit the growth of cancer or, conversely, encourage it. That internal milieu is profoundly affected by the stressors acting on people’s lives and also by the highly variable ways in which individuals cope with stress.

肿瘤生长速度在不同患者之间存在显著差异。同样显而易见的是，即使临床上诊断为同一种癌症且处于相同严重程度阶段的患者，其转移性疾病的出现和生存时间也存在高度不一致性。例如，“许多乳腺癌切除不彻底的病例从未复发，或者继发性转移灶在宿主组织中潜伏长达30年才最终显现出来。” 22 这种个体差异似乎并非源于恶性肿瘤的自主行为，而是由于人体内部环境中的某些因素抑制或促进癌症生长。这种内部环境深受人们生活中各种压力源的影响，也受到个体应对压力方式差异的深刻影响。

In numerous studies of cancer, the most consistently identified risk factor is the inability to express emotion, particularly the feelings associated with anger. The repression of anger is not an abstract emotional trait that mysteriously leads to disease. It is a major risk factor because it increases physiological stress on the organism. It does not act alone but in conjunction with other risk factors that are likely to accompany it, such as hopelessness and lack of social support. The person who does not feel or express “negative” emotion will be isolated even if surrounded by friends, because his real self is not seen. The sense of hopelessness follows from the chronic inability to be true to oneself on the deepest level. And hopelessness leads to helplessness, since nothing one can do is perceived as making any difference.

在众多癌症研究中，最常被提及的风险因素是无法表达情绪，尤其是与愤怒相关的情绪。压抑愤怒并非一种神秘地导致疾病的抽象情绪特征，而是一个重要的风险因素，因为它会增加机体的生理压力。它并非单独发挥作用，而是与其他可能伴随的风险因素（例如绝望感和缺乏社会支持）共同作用。即使身处朋友环绕之中，无法感受或表达“负面”情绪的人也会感到孤立，因为他们真实的自我不被看见。绝望感源于长期无法在最深层次上忠于自我。而绝望感又会导致无助感，因为人们会觉得无论自己做什么都无济于事。

One study dealt with healthy women who had no symptoms, only an abnormal Pap smear on a routine physical examination. Without any knowledge of the results of the Pap smear, the researchers “were able to predict with almost 75 per cent accuracy those individuals who had early cancer, simply by utilizing a questionnaire which differentiated between various emotional states. They found that cancer was most apt to occur in those women with a ‘helplessness-prone personality,’ or some sense of helpless frustration which could not be resolved in the preceding six months.” 23

一项研究针对的是健康女性，她们没有任何症状，只是在一次例行体检中发现宫颈涂片异常。研究人员在完全不了解宫颈涂片结果的情况下，“仅通过一份区分不同情绪状态的问卷，就能以近75%的准确率预测哪些人会患上早期癌症。他们发现，癌症最容易发生在那些具有‘易受助感’人格，或在过去六个月中一直存在无法解决的无助挫败感的女性身上。”

The researchers in Cvrenka had also predicted who among their nearly fourteen hundred subjects would likely develop cancer and die of it, based on the psychological characteristics of rationality/anti-emotionality (repressed anger) and a long-lasting sense of hopelessness. When they checked the death records ten years later, they found they had been right in 78 per cent of cases. “It seems to us,” they commented, “that the importance of psychosomatic risk factors is likely to have been grossly underestimated in many studies.”

茨夫伦卡的研究人员还根据理性/反情绪化（压抑的愤怒）和长期存在的绝望感等心理特征，预测了他们近1400名受试者中哪些人可能患上癌症并死于癌症。十年后，当他们查看死亡记录时，发现他们的预测在78%的病例中是正确的。“我们认为，”他们评论道，“许多研究可能严重低估了心身风险因素的重要性。”

The influence of psychological risk factors is poignantly illustrated in the life history of Gilda Radner. Radner’s maternal aunt and two cousins died of ovarian cancer, and her mother was successfully treated for breast cancer. Gilda faced a genetic risk, but was she absolutely fated to die of ovarian cancer? There is no reason to think so.

吉尔达·拉德纳的人生经历生动地展现了心理风险因素的影响。拉德纳的姨妈和两位表妹都死于卵巢癌，而她的母亲则成功治愈了乳腺癌。吉尔达虽然面临遗传风险，但她注定会死于卵巢癌吗？没有理由这样认为。

For most women who develop ovarian cancer, heredity does not figure heavily among the risk factors. For a few, it is highly significant. About 8 per cent of women with ovarian cancer carry one of the genetic mutations known to increase risk. In fact, these are the same BRCA genes implicated in breast cancer. Depending on which strand of DNA is involved, those with the mutation in one gene could have a 63 per cent risk of developing cancer by age seventy. Those women whose mutation is in the other gene have a 27 per cent risk of ovarian cancer by age seventy-five. 24 For women without the mutation but who have a first-degree relative—mother, sister or daughter—with ovarian cancer, the risk is about 5 per cent. Here again, we see that genes by themselves do not tell the whole story. Even in these high-risk categories, not everyone is ordained to develop cancer.

对于大多数罹患卵巢癌的女性而言，遗传并非主要风险因素。但对于少数人来说，遗传却至关重要。约8%的卵巢癌患者携带已知会增加患病风险的基因突变。事实上，这些突变与乳腺癌相关的BRCA基因相同。根据突变发生在哪条DNA链上，携带其中一个基因突变的女性在70岁之前罹患卵巢癌的风险可能高达63%。而携带另一个基因突变的女性在75岁之前罹患卵巢癌的风险则为27%。对于未携带突变但一级亲属（母亲、姐妹或女儿）患有卵巢癌的女性，其患病风险约为5%。由此可见，基因本身并不能说明全部问题。即使在这些高风险人群中，也并非每个人都注定会罹患癌症。

Gilda Radner sparkled with manic energy and a zest for experience, but she carried the psychological burdens of a highly stressful and self-negating life. The eating disorder she suffered from likely affected her hormonal balance. She was also infertile, due probably to the type of hypothalamic-pituitary dysfunction discussed earlier in this chapter.

吉尔达·拉德纳精力充沛，对体验充满热情，但她也背负着高压且自我否定的生活带来的心理重负。她所患的饮食失调症很可能影响了她的激素平衡。她也不孕，这很可能是由于本章前面讨论过的下丘脑-垂体功能障碍所致。

The slim star of Saturday Night Live was bulimic. By her own description, she had been an “unhappy, fat and mediocre” child. She characterized her childhood as a “nightmare.” “My brother and I ate ourselves into little balloon children,” she wrote in her memoir. “We looked like no-neck monsters. My parents sent me to summer camp every year and every year I was scapegoated…. In the ‘princess game’ there would be controlling girls and pretty girls. The controlling girls would make the pretty girl the princess, and the controlling girls would be the advisors to the princess. The fat girl would be the servant or something, and that would be me.” 25

这位《周六夜现场》的苗条女星曾患有暴食症。据她自己描述，她小时候是个“不快乐、肥胖、平庸”的孩子。她把自己的童年形容为“噩梦”。她在回忆录中写道：“我和哥哥把自己吃得像小气球一样，看起来像没有脖子的怪物。父母每年都送我去夏令营，而我每年都成了替罪羊……在‘公主游戏’里，会有控制欲强的女孩和漂亮的女孩。控制欲强的女孩会让漂亮的女孩当公主，而控制欲强的女孩会成为公主的顾问。胖女孩会扮演仆人之类的角色，而那个角色就是我。”

Gilda’s relationship with her mother appears to have been intensely negative, and apparently marked by competition for her father’s attention. Gilda maintained that her father had been “the love of my life.” His death of brain cancer, when she was twelve, was an irreparable loss.

吉尔达与母亲的关系似乎非常糟糕，而且显然两人都在争夺父亲的关注。吉尔达一直认为父亲是“我一生的挚爱”。父亲在她十二岁时因脑癌去世，这对她来说是无法弥补的损失。

All her adult life, Gilda, out of sheer desperation, promiscuously sought male love and acceptance. “To a great extent my life has been controlled by the men I loved,” she wrote. She attempted to make herself into whatever woman she thought the man in her life preferred.

吉尔达一生都出于极度的绝望，滥交，寻求男性的爱与认可。“在很大程度上，我的生活被我爱的男人所掌控，”她写道。她试图把自己变成她认为男人喜欢的任何女人。

Gilda found it impossible to speak her emotional truth to her mother, Henrietta, or to say no to her directly. When already a star and a closet bulimic, she would attempt to allay her mother’s anxieties about what she ate by concocting detailed fabrications of imaginary meals. Henrietta did not learn about her daughter’s bulimia while Gilda was alive.

吉尔达发现自己根本无法向母亲亨丽埃塔倾诉内心的真实感受，也无法直接拒绝她。即便已是明星，且患有隐性暴食症，她也会编造出各种奇特的膳食，试图以此来减轻母亲对她饮食的担忧。亨丽埃塔在吉尔达生前并不知道女儿患有暴食症。

Using comedy, Gilda could control her environment. Comedy filled a crucial childhood need. It was a way of endearing herself to her father and her sole means of reaching her mother, “a way of getting to her when nothing worked.” She became a “natural” comic. The price was the obliteration of her own feelings.

吉尔达利用喜剧来掌控周围的环境。喜剧满足了她童年时期至关重要的需求。它既是她博得父亲喜爱的方式，也是她与母亲沟通的唯一途径，“当其他方法都无效时，这是她唯一能与母亲沟通的方式”。她天生就是个喜剧演员。但代价是她自身情感的消磨殆尽。

Gilda was a self-confessed workaholic who, she would write, “let stress and pressure run my precious life.” On a youthful trip to Paris, she threw herself in front of traffic in a dramatic suicidal gesture that could easily have killed her. “At least someone cares about me,” she said to the friend who pulled her to safety.

吉尔达自称是个工作狂，她曾写道：“我让压力和焦虑掌控了我宝贵的生命。”年轻时去巴黎旅行，她曾做出过一次戏剧性的自杀举动，纵身跃入车流之中，险些丧命。“至少有人关心我，”她对把她拉到安全地方的朋友说道。

Even after her symptoms of ovarian cancer began to cause physical distress, including bowel blockage, Radner was more concerned with satisfying others than with her own needs. She sought and received advice from sundry sources. Her dilemma? “Suddenly I began to wonder how to please so many people. Do I take magnesium citrate? What about the coffee enema? Do I do both? Do I do the abdominal massage or the colonic? Do I tell the doctors about each other? East meets West in Gilda’s body: Western medicine down my throat, Eastern medicine up my butt.”

即使卵巢癌的症状开始给她带来身体上的痛苦，包括肠梗阻，拉德纳仍然更关心如何取悦他人，而不是自己的需求。她向各种各样的人寻求建议。她的困境是？“我突然开始琢磨如何才能让这么多人满意。我该服用柠檬酸镁吗？咖啡灌肠呢？两者都做吗？我该做腹部按摩还是结肠灌洗？我该告诉医生们彼此的情况吗？东西方医学在吉尔达的身体里交融：西药灌进我的喉咙，东方医学灌进我的肛门。”

When it seemed she had been successfully treated, Gilda became a poster girl for ovarian cancer, featured on the cover of Life magazine. She was an inspiration to many, but the recovery was short-lived. Still attached to roles she had developed as a child, she berated herself for having “let down” others by developing terminal illness. “I had become a spokeswoman for The Wellness Community, and a symbol of getting well. I had been a model cancer patient completely active in my own therapy. Now I felt like a living example that didn’t work. I’m just a fraud, * I thought.”

当吉尔达的治疗似乎取得成功时，她成为了卵巢癌的代言人，登上了《生活》杂志的封面。她激励了许多人，但康复却很短暂。她仍然执着于童年时期扮演的角色，因为罹患绝症而自责不已，觉得自己“辜负”了他人。“我曾是健康社区的代言人，是康复的象征。我曾是一位积极参与自身治疗的模范癌症患者。现在我觉得自己成了一个失败的活生生的例子。我当时想，我只是个骗子。”

Only close to her death did Gilda finally learn that she could not be mother to the world. “I couldn’t do everything I wanted to do. I couldn’t keep calling all the cancer patients I knew, and I couldn’t try to help heal all the women with ovarian cancer, and I couldn’t read every letter I received because it was ripping me apart…. I couldn’t cry all those tears for everybody else, I had to take care of myself…. It is important to realize that you have to take care of yourself because you can’t take care of anybody else until you do.”

直到临终前，吉尔达才终于明白，她无法成为全世界的母亲。“我无法做所有我想做的事。我无法继续给所有认识的癌症患者打电话，我无法尽力帮助所有患有卵巢癌的女性康复，我也无法阅读收到的每一封信，因为它们让我心如刀绞……我无法为所有人流泪，我必须照顾好自己……重要的是要明白，你必须照顾好自己，因为只有照顾好自己，你才能照顾好别人。”

* The acronym PNI more commonly refers to the science of psychoneuroimmunoendocrinology. For convenience reasons I use it here to describe the physiological system that science studies: it is tedious for both writer and reader to keep spelling out the word psychoneuroimmunoendocrine.

* PNI这个缩写通常指的是心理神经免疫内分泌学。为了方便起见，我在这里用它来描述这门科学研究的生理系统：对于作者和读者来说，反复拼写“心理神经免疫内分泌”这个词都很繁琐。

* Radner’s italics .

* 拉德纳的斜体字。

8
8
Something Good Comes Out of This
这其中必有好事发生

E D WAS DIAGNOSED AFTER his general practicioner found a small nodule during a routine rectal exam. “I went for a biopsy,” he reports, “and they did six hits on the prostate. They found an irregularity in one hit. Prostate cancer. Since then I’ve looked at all the options, and it was all either slash, burn or poison. I’ve spoken with a lot of men who have had their prostate removed, and some who have had radiation. It’s been pretty lousy for most of them.”

ED是在一次例行直肠检查中被全科医生发现一个小结节后确诊的。“我去做了活检，”他回忆说，“他们对前列腺进行了六次穿刺。其中一次穿刺发现了异常。确诊为前列腺癌。从那以后，我了解了所有治疗方案，无非就是手术、放疗或化疗。我和很多做过前列腺切除手术的男性交流过，也和一些做过放疗的男性聊过。对他们大多数人来说，情况都很糟糕。”

“You haven’t had any medical treatment?” I ask Ed.

“你没有接受过任何治疗吗？”我问埃德。

“I’ve been to a naturopath, and I am doing hypnotherapy, and I’ve been doing a lot of looking at myself and how I’ve lived my life.”

“我去看过自然疗法医生，也接受过催眠疗法，而且我一直在反思自己以及我的人生轨迹。”

Ed’s colourful phrase, “slash, burn or poison” refers to the three major types of treatment currently offered for prostate cancer: surgery, radiation and chemotherapy. Although some patients come through such treatments without harm, others suffer unpleasant consequences such as urinary incontinence and impotence. A review of over a hundred thousand prostatectomy cases published in 1999 concluded that “complications and re-admission after prostatectomy are substantially more common than previously recognized.” 1

埃德生动地描述了“刀割、烧灼或毒杀”这句比喻，指的是目前前列腺癌的三种主要治疗方法：手术、放疗和化疗。虽然有些患者能够安然度过治疗期，但另一些患者却会遭受尿失禁和阳痿等不良后果。1999年发表的一项对超过十万例前列腺切除术病例的回顾性研究得出结论：“前列腺切除术后的并发症和再次入院率远高于之前的认知。”

Those risks might be acceptable if the treatments available cured disease or saved lives, but the evidence is ambivalent at best. The loud public campaigns urging men to undergo screening tests for prostate cancer by means of the rectal digital exam or the prostate specific antigen (PSA) blood tests have no proven scientific basis. “I think it’s important for people to realize that once we find their prostate cancer, we still have no evidence that treatment works,” Timothy Wilt, associate professor of medicine at the Minneapolis Veterans Affairs Medical Center, told The New York Times. 2 “And that’s really the whole crux of the screening issue: If treatment doesn’t work, why are we using the PSA to look for tumors?”

如果现有疗法能够治愈疾病或挽救生命，那么这些风险或许可以接受，但现有证据充其量只能说是模棱两可。目前，公众大力宣传通过直肠指检或前列腺特异性抗原 (PSA) 血液检测进行前列腺癌筛查，但这些做法并没有科学依据。“我认为人们必须意识到，即使我们发现了前列腺癌，我们仍然没有证据表明治疗有效，”明尼阿波利斯退伍军人事务医疗中心医学副教授蒂莫西·威尔特 (Timothy Wilt) 告诉《纽约时报》。“而这正是筛查问题的关键所在：如果治疗无效，我们为什么要用 PSA 来寻找肿瘤呢？”

Supporters of aggressive medical approaches ought to be disheartened by statistics gathered by Dr. Otis Brawley, a medical oncologist and epidemiologist at the U.S. National Cancer Institute. In places where screening is widely practiced, the incidence of diagnosed prostate cancer goes up, and the number of men being treated increases, but the death rate from prostatic malignancy remains unchanged. 3 If anything, prostate cancer mortality rates were slightly higher in the intensely screened areas. Also disturbing are findings published in The Journal of the National Cancer Institute , that men aggressively treated for prostate cancer had a higher chance of dying of other cancers than men who did not receive any medical intervention. 4

支持积极治疗方案的人士应该对美国国家癌症研究所的肿瘤内科医生兼流行病学家奥蒂斯·布劳利博士收集的统计数据感到失望。在筛查广泛开展的地区，前列腺癌的诊断率上升，接受治疗的男性人数也增加，但前列腺癌的死亡率却保持不变。 3 更糟糕的是，在筛查力度较大的地区，前列腺癌的死亡率甚至略高。此外，发表在《美国国家癌症研究所杂志》上的研究结果也令人担忧：接受积极治疗的前列腺癌患者死于其他癌症的风险高于未接受任何医疗干预的男性。 4

Although some prostate cancer probably should receive treatment, at this point it is not known exactly who would benefit from intervention. Most prostate cancers are very slow to develop, so much so that the man is likely to die before the malignancy triggers any health problems, if it ever would. In others cases, the cancer is so aggressive that by the time of diagnosis, treatment makes no difference. Since there is no reliable way of deciding when treatment works, what are people who “survive” their prostate cancer really surviving—their treatment or their disease? In the case of prostate malignancy, medicine as it is commonly practised simply does not apply the usual scientific standards.

虽然某些前列腺癌患者可能需要治疗，但目前尚不清楚哪些患者能够从干预中获益。大多数前列腺癌发展缓慢，以至于患者很可能在恶性肿瘤引发任何健康问题之前就去世了（即便最终会引发问题）。在另一些情况下，癌症的侵袭性极强，以至于确诊时治疗已无济于事。由于目前尚无可靠的方法来判断治疗是否有效，那么那些“幸存”的前列腺癌患者究竟是在战胜什么——是战胜了治疗本身，还是战胜了疾病？就前列腺癌而言，目前的医学实践并未遵循通常的科学标准。

Public opinion is based on the common-sense view that the sooner a condition is discovered, the more likely doctors will be able to cure it. Convinced that medical intervention saved their lives, celebrities like Gen. Norman Schwarzkopf, the golfer Arnold Palmer or the Canadian federal cabinet minister Allan Rock—all diagnosed with prostate cancer after screening tests—act as persuasive advocates of early diagnosis. Men need to let science, not the latest public figure endorsing PSA testing, help them make a decision about prostate cancer screening and treatment, Dr. Otis Brawley told The Journal of the American Medical Association. 5

公众舆论基于一种常识性的观点，即疾病发现得越早，医生治愈的可能性就越大。像诺曼·施瓦茨科普夫将军、高尔夫球手阿诺德·帕尔默和加拿大联邦内阁部长艾伦·洛克这样的名人——他们都在筛查后被诊断出患有前列腺癌——深信医疗干预挽救了他们的生命，因此他们成为了早期诊断的有力倡导者。奥蒂斯·布劳利医生告诉《美国医学会杂志》，男性应该让科学，而不是最新一位支持PSA检测的公众人物，来帮助他们决定是否进行前列腺癌筛查和治疗。

Despite scientific confusion, bias toward treatment is powerful. Few doctors are willing to let nature take its course in the face of potential disease, even if the value of intervention is questionable. And men, even if well informed, may choose to “do something” rather than tolerate the anxiety of inaction. But patients always deserve to be told what is known about prostate cancer—and, just as important, all that remains unknown.

尽管科学界对此仍存在争议，但治疗倾向依然根深蒂固。面对潜在的疾病，即使干预的价值值得怀疑，也很少有医生愿意顺其自然。而男性，即便充分了解相关信息，也可能选择“采取行动”，而不是忍受不作为带来的焦虑。但患者始终有权了解关于前列腺癌的已知信息——以及同样重要的，所有未知的信息。

Prostate cancer was the first human malignancy to be linked with hormonal influences. Just as cancer of the breast may improve in women who have their ovaries removed, so castration leads to a shrinking of prostate tumours, due to diminished levels of androgens, or male hormones. Orchidectomy, the surgical removal of the testicles, remains part of the treatment arsenal, as does the adminstration of powerful medications blocking the effects of the male hormones. Such “chemical castration” is the first-line treatment now offered men with metastatic prostate cancer.

前列腺癌是首个被发现与激素影响相关的恶性肿瘤。正如切除卵巢的女性乳腺癌病情可能有所改善一样，阉割也会因雄激素（即男性激素）水平降低而导致前列腺肿瘤缩小。睾丸切除术（即手术切除睾丸）以及使用强效药物阻断男性激素的作用，仍然是治疗手段之一。这种“化学阉割”是目前转移性前列腺癌患者的一线治疗方案。

Given the strong connection between hormone levels and emotions, it is striking how completely medical research and medical practice have ignored psychological influences on the causation of prostate cancer and have eschewed more holistic approaches to its treatment. There has been virtually no investigation of personality or stress factors in prostate malignancy. Textbooks ignore the subject.

鉴于激素水平与情绪之间存在密切联系，令人惊讶的是，医学研究和临床实践竟然完全忽视了心理因素对前列腺癌病因的影响，并且回避了更全面的治疗方法。几乎没有针对前列腺癌中人格或压力因素的研究。教科书也对此避而不谈。

The neglect of potential links between stress, emotions and prostate cancer is all the less justifiable given what is already known. By their thirties, many men will have some cancerous cells in their prostate, and by their eighties, the majority are found to have them. By the age of fifty, a man has a 42 per cent chance of developing prostate cancer. Yet relatively few men at any age will progress to the point of overt clinical disease. In other words, the presence of cancerous prostate cells is not unusual even in younger men, and it becomes the norm as men get older. Only in a minority does it progress to the formation of a tumour that causes symptoms or threatens life. It is worth asking how stress may promote the development of malignant disease. What personality patterns or life circumstances may interfere with the body’s defence mechanisms, allowing the already-present cancer cells to proliferate?

鉴于已知的事实，忽视压力、情绪与前列腺癌之间潜在的联系就更令人难以接受了。许多男性在三十多岁时前列腺中就会出现癌细胞，到了八十多岁，大多数男性都会被发现患有前列腺癌。五十岁时，男性患前列腺癌的概率高达42%。然而，无论哪个年龄段，只有极少数男性会发展到出现明显临床症状的阶段。换句话说，即使在年轻男性中，前列腺中存在癌细胞也并不罕见，而且随着年龄的增长，这种情况会越来越普遍。只有少数人会发展成肿瘤，引起症状或危及生命。值得探讨的是，压力是如何促进恶性肿瘤发展的？哪些人格模式或生活环境会干扰身体的防御机制，从而使已存在的癌细胞得以增殖？

As I arrived to interview Ed, a wiry man with a body and face of someone years younger than his age of forty-four, he turned to his wife, Jean, who was just leaving to go shopping. “It’s a pain in the ass,” he said, “but I have to go and look at so-and-so’s truck for him. It’s not starting.”

我到达采访埃德时，他身材精瘦，看起来比实际年龄44岁年轻得多。他转向正要出门购物的妻子琼，说道：“真麻烦，我得去帮某某看看他的卡车，它发动不了了。”

“Let me ask you something right away,” I begin.

“我先问你个问题，”我开口道。

“Sure.”

“当然。”

“You’re saying that looking at this guy’s truck is a pain in the ass. Now that’s an interesting metaphor, anatomically, when used by somebody who has cancer of the prostate. How easy has it been in your life to say no to things that were actually more of a pain in the ass than a benefit to you?”

“你是说看着这家伙的卡车很烦人。这比喻真有意思，从解剖学角度来说，尤其对于一个患有前列腺癌的人来说。你这辈子拒绝过那些实际上弊大于利的事情吗？”

“I really don’t say no. I try to help people all the time.”

“我真的很少说‘不’。我总是尽力帮助别人。”

“Even if it’s a pain?”

“即使很麻烦？”

“Yeah. Even if it’s not the greatest time for me, or I should be doing other things that are more important for me. I like to help people out.”

“是啊。即使现在对我来说不是最佳时机，或者我应该去做其他更重要的事情，我也喜欢帮助别人。”

“What happens if you don’t?”

“如果你不这样做会怎样？”

“I feel bad about it. Guilty.”

“我为此感到难过，很内疚。”

Ed, leader of a country music band, used to do cocaine, mescaline and marijuana, “two or three joints a day, my whole youth. A problem for me ever since my childhood has been alcohol.” Ed tells me about his first adult relationship, which lasted ten years. He lived with an older woman whose two children he helped to bring up, drinking daily to suppress his unhappiness. That relationship came to an end when his partner had an affair.

乡村乐队主唱艾德曾吸食可卡因、麦司卡林和大麻，“我整个青春期每天都要抽两三根大麻烟。从孩提时代起，酗酒就一直是我的问题。”艾德跟我讲起他成年后的第一段感情，持续了十年。他和一个年纪较大的女人同居，帮她抚养两个孩子，每天都借酒消愁。这段感情最终以伴侣出轨而告终。

“I threw in the towel. I said, I don’t want to put up with this. I never screwed around, even though I felt like it. From that day on, I quit drinking for a year and a half, started jogging and doing what I wanted to do. I had this free feeling, like this huge weight was off my chest. I could do anything I wanted to and I felt so good about myself.”

“我彻底放弃了。我说，我不想再忍受下去了。我从来不会胡闹，即使我内心很想这么做。从那天起，我戒酒一年半，开始慢跑，做我想做的事情。我感觉无比自由，就像压在心头的一块巨石卸了下来。我可以做任何我想做的事情，我感觉自己棒极了。”

“How much are you drinking these days?”

你最近喝多少酒？

“Maybe about four beer a day. Every day.”

“大概每天四瓶啤酒。每天都喝。”

“What does it do for you?”

它对你有什么好处？

“Jean and I got hooked up, and her problems become my problems, and it just gets heavier and heavier and heavier, and then I start with alcohol again.”

“我和珍妮纠缠不清，她的问题就变成了我的问题，而且问题越来越严重，越来越严重，然后我又开始酗酒了。”

“So in some ways you are not happy in this marriage.”

“所以从某种程度上来说，你在这段婚姻中并不幸福。”

“I guess the biggest thing is the control factor. I’ve allowed Jean to take control of this marriage, because of her multiple sclerosis and because she came from such an abusive marriage. * She was dictated to, told what clothes to wear and all that kind of stuff. What in turn it’s done is made me cower in this marriage.”

“我想最大的问题在于控制。我让琼掌控了这段婚姻，因为她患有多发性硬化症，也因为她来自一段充满虐待的婚姻。她总是被人指使，被告知该穿什么衣服等等。结果就是，我在这段婚姻中变得畏缩不前。”

“So you see yourself as being controlled. How do you feel about that?”

“所以你觉得自己被控制了。对此你有什么感受？”

“I’m resentful.”

“我感到愤恨。”

“And how do you deal with it?”

“那你如何应对呢？”

“I hide it.”

“我把它藏起来了。”

“You don’t tell her that you don’t like it?”

“你不告诉她你不喜欢吗？”

“No. I don’t.”

“不，我没有。”

“What does that remind you of?”

“这让你想起了什么？”

“My childhood? Exactly.”

“我的童年？没错。”

Although Ed had told me previously that he had had a “very great upbringing,” it soon became evident that he had felt controlled by his parents and full of guilt if he failed to meet their expectations. He recalled he had received what he called “deserved spankings,” which, on further inquiry, turned out to have been beatings with a belt administered by his father, from about age eight on. “He believed that that was the best way of doing things.”

虽然埃德之前告诉我他“成长在一个非常好的家庭”，但很快我就发现，他其实一直被父母控制，如果达不到他们的期望，就会感到非常内疚。他回忆说，他经常挨打，他称之为“罪有应得的打屁股”，但进一步询问后才知道，那其实是他父亲从八岁左右就开始用皮带抽打他。“他认为那才是最好的管教方式。”

“What do you believe?”

你相信什么？
