“Well, now, I don’t think that was the best thing he could do, but you really don’t have much choice when you’re a young child. I wanted to be a good person. When you’re a child looking at your father, you don’t know what he’s supposed to be, because you want your dad to be perfect, and you want to be a perfect child.”

“嗯，现在想想，我觉得那不是他能做的最好的事，但小孩子其实没多少选择。我当时想做一个好人。小时候看着父亲，你不知道他应该是什么样的人，因为你希望父亲完美，你也想成为一个完美的孩子。”

One of the puzzling features of prostate malignancy is that while testosterone—the hormone people have been led to believe is responsible for male aggression—seems to promote its growth, this cancer is most typically a disease of older men. Yet the body’s production of testosterone declines with aging. Nor have men with prostate cancer been shown to have higher than average blood levels of testosterone. As with estrogen receptors in breast cancer, it appears the sensitivity of tumour cells to normal concentrations of testosterone must have been altered.

前列腺癌的一个令人费解的特点是，尽管睾酮——人们一直认为这种激素与男性攻击性有关——似乎会促进其生长，但这种癌症却最常见于老年男性。然而，人体自身产生的睾酮会随着年龄的增长而下降。也没有证据表明前列腺癌患者的血液睾酮水平高于平均水平。与乳腺癌中的雌激素受体类似，肿瘤细胞对正常浓度睾酮的敏感性似乎发生了改变。

Like hormone secretion by the adrenal glands and the ovaries, the synthesis of testosterone by the testicles is under the complex feedback control of the hypothalamic-pituitary system in the brain. That network, highly reactive to stress and emotions, sends a cascade of biological substances into circulation. Emotional factors can directly influence male sex-hormone functioning for good or ill—just as the female hormone estrogen from the ovaries, or adrenalin, cortisol and other hormones from the adrenal glands, are affected by psychic events. It so happens that in a small series of patients, surgical removal of the brain’s pituitary gland did show positive results in the treatment of prostate cancer. 6

与肾上腺和卵巢分泌激素一样，睾丸合成睾酮也受到大脑下丘脑-垂体系统的复杂反馈控制。该系统对压力和情绪高度敏感，会释放一系列生物物质进入血液循环。情绪因素可以直接影响男性性激素的功能，产生积极或消极的影响——正如卵巢分泌的雌激素或肾上腺分泌的肾上腺素、皮质醇和其他激素会受到心理事件的影响一样。恰巧，在一小部分患者中，手术切除大脑垂体确实在治疗前列腺癌方面取得了积极成果。

Testosterone gets a bad rap. If one wishes to compliment a woman’s self-confidence or assertiveness, one will assert that she “has balls.” A Canadian columnist wrote in praise of Margaret Thatcher, the iron-willed—or merciless, depending on one’s vantage point—former British prime minister, that she had “10 times more testosterone than the men.” Meanwhile, male destructiveness and hostile aggression are frequently blamed on testosterone. In actual fact, high levels of the hormone are more an effect than a cause.

睾酮素常常被妖魔化。如果有人想称赞一位女性的自信或果断，就会说她“很有胆量”。一位加拿大专栏作家在赞扬意志坚定——或者说冷酷无情（取决于视角）——的英国前首相玛格丽特·撒切尔时写道，她的睾酮水平是男性的十倍。与此同时，男性的破坏性和敌对攻击性也常常被归咎于睾酮素。但事实上，高水平的睾酮素更多的是一种结果，而非原因。

Victory or defeat was shown to alter not only the hormonal balance but even the brain cells in a species of fish, the African cichlid. “In defeat, the fish’s hypothalamic cells shrink with consequent declines in reproductive hormones and shrinkage of the testes.” If the situation is manipulated to permit defeated fish to become dominant, there is a dramatic growth of the cells in the hypothalamus that produce a gonadotropin-releasing hormone (GRH), which stimulates the pituitary to produce hormones that act on the testes. The testes, in turn, will now increase in size, and the fish’s sperm counts will improve. “Most importantly, this research has clearly demonstrated … that it is the behavioural changes [i.e., the attainment of dominant status] that lead to the subsequent physiologic changes.” 7

研究表明，胜负不仅会改变一种名为非洲慈鲷的鱼类的激素平衡，甚至还会影响其脑细胞。“失败时，鱼的下丘脑细胞会萎缩，导致生殖激素水平下降，睾丸萎缩。”如果人为干预，使失败的鱼获得优势地位，下丘脑中产生促性腺激素释放激素（GRH）的细胞就会显著增多，GRH会刺激垂体产生作用于睾丸的激素。反过来，睾丸体积会增大，鱼的精子数量也会增加。“最重要的是，这项研究清楚地表明……正是行为上的改变（即获得优势地位）导致了随后的生理变化。”

As highly evolved creatures, we may like to believe that our gonadal functioning is not as readily susceptible to life’s ups and downs as that of the lowly African cichlid. In fact, human hormone levels, like those in our African fish, may follow rather than precede changes in dominance relationships. Prof. James Dabbs, a social psychologist at Georgia State University in Atlanta, has researched the interaction of testosterone and behaviour. According to a report in The New York Times , after reviewing his nearly forty studies he has concluded that while testosterone does increase libido, “there is no proof it causes aggression.” On the other hand, there is proof that emotional states can rapidly alter testosterone production: “Dr. Dabbs tested fans before and immediately after the 1994 World Cup of soccer final between Italy and Brazil. In what Dr. Dabbs considers proof of the axiom ‘basking in reflected glory,’ testosterone levels swelled among the victorious Brazilians and sank among the dejected Italians.” 8 Not surprisingly, then, gonadal function is affected by psychological states in both men and women. In depressed men, the secretion of testosterone and other hormones connected with sexual functioning were found to be significantly diminished. 9 A hormone-dependent malignancy like that of the prostate may be highly susceptible to biochemical influences related to stress and emotional states.

作为高度进化的生物，我们或许会认为，我们的性腺功能不像低等的非洲慈鲷那样容易受到生活起伏的影响。事实上，人类的激素水平，就像非洲鱼一样，可能并非先于而非后于等级关系的变化。亚特兰大佐治亚州立大学的社会心理学家詹姆斯·达布斯教授研究了睾酮与行为之间的相互作用。据《纽约时报》报道，在回顾了他近四十项研究后，他得出结论：虽然睾酮确实会提高性欲，“但没有证据表明它会导致攻击性”。另一方面，有证据表明情绪状态会迅速改变睾酮分泌：“达布斯博士在1994年意大利和巴西世界杯足球决赛前后对球迷进行了测试。达布斯博士认为这证明了‘沾沾自喜’的道理，获胜的巴西球迷睾酮水平升高，而沮丧的意大利球迷睾酮水平下降。” 8 因此，毫不奇怪，男性和女性的性腺功能都会受到心理状态的影响。在抑郁的男性中，睾酮和其他与性功能相关的激素分泌显著减少。 9 像前列腺癌这样的激素依赖性恶性肿瘤可能极易受到与压力和情绪状态相关的生化因素的影响。

Cancer of the prostate is the second commonest malignancy of men. Only cancer of the lung occurs more frequently. Calculations vary, but in the United States in 1996 as many as 317,000 new cases were estimated, and about 41,000 deaths. 10 About 20,000 new cases are diagnosed in Canada each year.

前列腺癌是男性第二大常见恶性肿瘤，仅次于肺癌。虽然各国统计数字不尽相同，但据估计，1996年美国新增前列腺癌病例高达31.7万例，死亡人数约4.1万。加拿大每年约有2万例新增前列腺癌病例。

Environmental factors must be significant. Japanese men migrating to Hawaii and the continental United States were found to have a higher incidence of the disease than those natives of the country who stayed in Japan: over two and a half times as great. Yet on autopsies of men without clinical disease, similar rates of inactive malignant cells were found regardless of geography. 11 The question, then, is, Why do these inactive cells develop into cancerous tumours in one environment but not in another? There are highly suggestive epidemiological findings to indicate that stress crucially influences who will and who will not suffer illness and death from prostate cancer.

环境因素必然起着重要作用。研究发现，移居夏威夷和美国本土的日本男性患前列腺癌的几率比留在日本的日本男性高出两倍半以上。然而，对未患临床疾病的男性进行尸检后发现，无论地理位置如何，体内非活性恶性细胞的比例都相似。那么，问题来了：为什么这些非活性细胞在一种环境下会发展成癌性肿瘤，而在另一种环境下却不会？流行病学研究结果强烈提示，压力对前列腺癌的发病率和死亡率有着至关重要的影响。

Family history increases the risk for prostate cancer, but it is not a major factor in most instances. No specific cancer-inducing environmental agents have been identified comparable to, say, cigarettes and lung cancer. Saturated fats may play a role. Given the wide geographic variation, so may genetic influences. The disease is most prevalent in the Scandinavian countries, least in Asia. The single racial/ethnic group at highest risk in the world are African Americans, among whom prostate cancer is twice as common as among the U.S. white population.

家族史会增加患前列腺癌的风险，但在大多数情况下并非主要因素。目前尚未发现像香烟与肺癌那样特定的致癌环境因素。饱和脂肪可能起到一定作用。鉴于其广泛的地域差异，遗传因素也可能有所影响。该疾病在斯堪的纳维亚国家最为常见，在亚洲最少见。全球患病风险最高的种族/族裔群体是非裔美国人，其前列腺癌发病率是美国白人的两倍。

“African-American men have a poorer survival rate than whites for all stages of prostate cancer when the cancer is diagnosed at younger ages.” 12 One could ascribe this higher death rate to the reduced access to medical care generally available to lower-middle-class and working-class people in the U.S. health system. However, the racial differences in prostate malignancy cut across class lines. In any case, greater access to medical care has not so far been shown to have any positive effect on survival. We could possibly attempt to explain the difference in death rates by referring to genetic factors, except that American blacks experience prostate cancer at a sixfold rate compared with black men in Nigeria. Here, too, the presence of clinically “silent” prostate cancer cells is the same in the two groups. 13

“非裔美国男性在年轻时确诊前列腺癌，其各阶段的生存率均低于白人。” 12 人们可能会将较高的死亡率归因于美国医疗体系中中下层阶级和工人阶级普遍缺乏医疗服务。然而，前列腺癌的种族差异并非仅限于特定阶层。无论如何，迄今为止，尚未有证据表明，获得更便捷的医疗服务对生存率有任何积极影响。我们或许可以尝试用遗传因素来解释死亡率的差异，但需要注意的是，美国黑人患前列腺癌的概率是尼日利亚黑人的六倍。此外，两组人群中临床上“无症状”的前列腺癌细胞数量相同。 13

Now, if environmental factors such as caloric intake were responsible for the development of the disease, one would not expect much difference in the death rate between American whites and blacks. As it stands, only about 10 per cent of the black/white variation in cancer rate has been estimated to be due to the intake of saturated fats. 14 If, on the other hand, genetic influences were decisive, disease rates between blacks in the U.S. and Nigeria ought to be much closer than they are.

如果环境因素（例如热量摄入）是导致疾病发展的原因，那么美国白人和黑人的死亡率就不会有太大差异。事实上，据估计，黑人和白人癌症发病率差异中只有约10%是由饱和脂肪摄入造成的。另一方面，如果遗传因素起决定性作用，那么美国黑人和尼日利亚黑人的疾病发病率应该比现在的情况要接近得多。

The historical, social and economic position of black people in U.S. society has undermined cohesion in black communities and black families and has imposed greater psychological stress on African Americans than their Caucasian fellow citizens or that blacks in Africa find themselves under. There is a parallel here in the higher occurrence of elevated blood pressure among American blacks. Hypertension is a condition clearly related to stress. In an analogous example, the rates of an autoimmune disease, rheumatoid arthritis, suffered by blacks in South Africa under apartheid increased as they migrated to the city from their native villages, even if in strict financial terms they may have gained by the move. The major factor would seem to be the psychological pressures of living in an environment where official racism directly and overtly deprived people of autonomy and dignity, while it uprooted people from their traditional family and social supports.

美国黑人在美国社会中的历史、社会和经济地位削弱了黑人社区和家庭的凝聚力，并给他们带来了比白人同胞或非洲黑人更大的心理压力。美国黑人高血压发病率较高就体现了这一点。高血压显然是一种与压力相关的疾病。类似地，在种族隔离时期的南非，黑人从家乡迁往城市后，患上自身免疫性疾病——类风湿性关节炎——的几率反而上升，即使从严格的经济角度来看，他们可能因此受益。主要因素似乎是生活在官方种族主义直接且公开地剥夺人们自主权和尊严，并将他们从传统家庭和社会支持中剥离出来的环境中所带来的心理压力。

A finding consistent with what we have seen elsewhere in relationship to disease and emotional isolation is that men who are currently married, compared with men who are divorced or widowed, are less likely to be diagnosed with prostate cancer. 15 While I was not able to find in the literature any other investigation specific to prostate cancer and psychological factors, one study did look at men who had greater dependency needs than a comparable group—that is, men who were less able to experience themselves as individuated, self-reliant adults. This study concluded that dependent men were more likely to develop a number of diseases, including prostate and other cancers. 16

一项与我们在其他研究中观察到的疾病与情感孤立之间关系一致的发现是，与离异或丧偶的男性相比，目前已婚的男性患前列腺癌的可能性较低。 15 虽然我未能查阅文献找到其他专门针对前列腺癌和心理因素的研究，但有一项研究考察了依赖性更强的男性群体——即那些更难将自己视为独立自主的成年人的男性。该研究得出结论，依赖性强的男性更容易患上多种疾病，包括前列腺癌和其他癌症。 16

What would be the practical implications if a holistic perspective gained more research support and was incorporated into the medical view of prostate cancer? First, the promotion of anxiety-producing examinations and tests would cease, at least until we had definite proof of their usefulness. In June 1999 the U.S. Postal Service planned to issue a stamp urging “annual checkups and tests” for cancer of the prostate. the New England Journal of Medicine warned against such foolishness, pointing out that the message was “inconsistent with current scientific evidence and thinking within the medical community.” 17 Second, we would not subject tens of thousands of men to invasive and potentially harmful surgery and other equally unproven interventions without fully informing them of the uncertainty that shrouds the treatment of prostate cancer.

如果整体观获得更多研究支持并被纳入前列腺癌的医学认知，将会带来哪些实际影响？首先，至少在确凿证明其有效性之前，推广那些令人焦虑的检查和测试将会停止。1999年6月，美国邮政局计划发行一枚邮票，敦促人们“每年进行前列腺癌检查和测试”。《新英格兰医学杂志》警告这种做法是愚蠢的，指出这一信息“与当前的科学证据和医学界的共识不符”。其次，在未充分告知数万名男性前列腺癌治疗存在诸多不确定性的情况下，我们不会让他们接受侵入性且可能有害的手术和其他同样未经证实的干预措施。

A holistic approach that places the person at the centre, rather than the blood test or the pathology report, takes into account an individual life history. It encourages people to examine carefully each of the stresses they face, both those in their environment and those generated internally. In this scenario the diagnosis of prostate cancer could serve as a wake-up call rather than simply a threat. In addition to whatever treatment they may choose to receive or not receive, men who are encouraged to respond reflectively, taking into account every aspect of their lives, probably increase their chances of survival.

以人为本的整体方法，而非仅仅关注血液检测或病理报告，会充分考虑个人的生活经历。它鼓励人们仔细审视自身面临的每一种压力，包括环境压力和内在压力。在这种情况下，前列腺癌的诊断可能不仅仅是一种威胁，而更像是一记警钟。无论他们选择接受或不接受何种治疗，鼓励男性进行反思，全面考虑生活的方方面面，都可能提高他们的生存几率。

A transformation appears to have affected Rudy Giuliani, diagnosed with prostate cancer in April 2000, in the midst of his Senate race against Hillary Clinton. The former mayor of New York City has been described as a driven man, “a robo-mayor immune to fatigue, fear, or self-doubt,” who “lived and breathed the work ethic.” 18 He completely identified with his role, slept only four hours a day and worked most of the other twenty. It was said of him that he could not abide being away from the centre of the action. He had to have a hand in everything, needing to be in control, “barking orders like a general.” He had failed to show compassion to suffering individuals and groups and had displayed emotional tightness to an extreme degree. After his diagnosis, he made a remarkable public confession. Referring to his cancer, he said:

2000年4月，在与希拉里·克林顿竞选参议员期间，鲁迪·朱利安尼被诊断出患有前列腺癌，这似乎改变了他的人生轨迹。这位前纽约市长被形容为一个充满干劲的人，“一个不知疲倦、恐惧或自我怀疑的机器人市长”，他“将工作视为生命”。他完全认同自己的角色，每天只睡四个小时，其余二十个小时几乎都在工作。据说他无法忍受离开中心。他必须事事亲力亲为，需要掌控一切，“像将军一样发号施令”。他未能对受苦的个人和群体表现出同情心，并且表现出极度的情感紧绷。确诊后，他发表了一番令人震惊的公开忏悔。谈到他的癌症，他说：

It makes you figure out what you’re all about and what’s really important to you and what should be important to you—you know, where the core of you really exists. And I guess because I’ve been in public life for so long and politics, I used to think the core of me was in politics…. It isn’t.

它让你弄清楚自己的本质是什么，什么对你来说真正重要，什么对你来说应该重要——你知道，你的灵魂核心究竟在哪里。我想，因为我长期从事公共生活和政治活动，我曾经以为我的灵魂核心在政治中……但事实并非如此。

There is something good that comes out of this. A lot of good things come out of it. I think I understand myself a lot better. I think I understand what’s important to me better. Maybe I’m not completely there yet. I would be foolish to think that I was in a few weeks. But I think I’m heading in that direction.

这件事确实带来了一些好处，很多好处。我觉得我更了解自己了，也更明白什么对我来说才是最重要的。也许我还没完全做到，几周后就认为自己做到了，那未免太天真了。但我认为我正朝着那个方向前进。

In contrast to prostate cancer, another hormone-related cancer of the male genital tract—that of the testicle—has been a success story of medical and surgical oncology. Whereas this rare disease used to be the third leading cause of cancer death among young men, it is no longer even in the top five. The cure rate with early diagnosis is now over 90 per cent. As the remarkable story of the quadruple Tour de France champion, Lance Armstrong, demonstrates, even men with advanced metastatic disease have hope of full recovery with a judicious combination of surgery, radiation or chemotherapy—and determination.

与前列腺癌不同，另一种男性生殖道激素相关癌症——睾丸癌——在内科和外科肿瘤学领域取得了巨大成功。这种罕见疾病曾经是年轻男性癌症死亡的第三大原因，如今甚至已跌出前五。早期诊断的治愈率现已超过90%。四届环法自行车赛冠军兰斯·阿姆斯特朗的传奇故事就证明了这一点：即使是晚期转移性睾丸癌患者，只要合理结合手术、放疗或化疗，再加上坚定的意志，也依然有希望完全康复。

When I was working in palliative care, an oncologist at the British Columbia Cancer Agency asked me to speak with Francis, a thirty-six-year-old with cancer of the testicle—not because he needed palliation, but because he didn’t. Although the tumour had spread to his abdomen by the time Francis was diagnosed, with appropriate treatment he still had a better than fifty-fifty chance of a complete cure. The problem was that he was refusing all medical intervention. The oncologist hoped that my counselling skills might help to reverse his patient’s negative attitude.

我在临终关怀科工作时，卑诗省癌症中心的一位肿瘤科医生请我与弗朗西斯谈谈。弗朗西斯36岁，患有睾丸癌——并非因为他需要临终关怀，而是因为他拒绝接受任何治疗。虽然弗朗西斯确诊时肿瘤已经扩散到腹部，但如果接受适当的治疗，他仍然有超过一半的治愈几率。问题在于他拒绝接受任何医疗干预。这位肿瘤科医生希望我的咨询技巧能够帮助他扭转这种消极态度。

The medical statistics promising cure—or, at least, prolonged life—did not interest Francis. He based his refusal on religious grounds, arguing that since God sent him this disease, it would be impious of him to resist it. He said he was not afraid of treatment—he simply felt it was wrong to even consider it. I tried to approach his obstinate denial of life from every angle that came to mind. Was it some childhood guilt that he felt merited punishment? It was evident that personally Francis was isolated in life, with no family or close ones. Was he depressed? Was this a form of medical suicide?

那些预示着治愈——或者至少延长寿命——的医学统计数据并没有引起弗朗西斯的兴趣。他以宗教为由拒绝治疗，认为既然上帝让他得了这种病，那么他若抗拒便是亵渎神明。他说他并不害怕治疗——他只是觉得连考虑治疗都是错误的。我尝试从我能想到的所有角度来分析他这种顽固的否定生命的态度。他是否因为童年的某种罪孽而感到应该受到惩罚？很明显，弗朗西斯在生活中很孤独，没有家人或亲近的人。他是否患有抑郁症？这是否是一种医学自杀？

I asked, non-believer as I was, whether perhaps it was blasphemous in him to claim to know God’s will. If God, indeed, had sent him the cancer, could He not have intended it as a challenge for Francis to overcome and learn from? Further, if God was the source of the illness, was He not finally also the source of the medical knowledge that made a cure highly probable?

我当时并不信教，便问他，声称自己知道上帝的旨意，这是否是一种亵渎神明的行为？如果上帝真的让他患上了癌症，难道祂不也是想借此挑战弗朗西斯，让他从中学习吗？此外，如果上帝是疾病的根源，那么祂最终不也是医学知识的源泉吗？正是这些医学知识使得治愈的可能性大大增加。

I asked all these questions, but mostly I just listened to Francis. What I heard was the voice of a very confused and lonely man who was adamant in his refusal to save his life. He stuck firmly to what he felt were unshakeable religious principles, despite the express disagreement about his ideas from the elders of his church. They told him that his interpretation of their denomination’s teaching was wayward and unjustified. They offered to support him through treatment and convalescence, all to no avail.

我问了这些问题，但大部分时间我只是听着弗朗西斯倾诉。我听到的是一个极度困惑和孤独的男人的声音，他固执地拒绝接受治疗。尽管教会的长老们明确反对他的观点，他仍然坚持自己认为不可动摇的宗教原则。他们告诉他，他对教派教义的解读是离经叛道、毫无根据的。他们提出要资助他接受治疗和康复，但这一切都无济于事。

Francis is one of three or four men I have ever seen with cancer of the testicle. Although the incidence of this malignancy is rising, in the United States there are only about six thousand new cases each year, in Canada about one-tenth that number. There have been no studies of the emotional or personal histories of the men who develop it, only of the psychological consequences. There are remarkable similarities between what little I did learn of Francis’s life, the published autobiography of Lance Armstrong and the experiences of Roy, a young man I knew well, whom I interviewed for this chapter.

弗朗西斯是我见过的三四个睾丸癌患者之一。虽然这种恶性肿瘤的发病率正在上升，但在美国每年新增病例仅约六千例，加拿大则约为其十分之一。目前尚无研究探讨罹患此病的男性的情感或个人经历，仅有关于其心理后果的研究。我从对弗朗西斯生平的了解中，发现他的经历与兰斯·阿姆斯特朗的自传以及我熟识的年轻人罗伊的经历有着惊人的相似之处。为了撰写本章，我采访了罗伊。

Armstrong first noticed a slight swelling of his testicle in the winter of 1996 and began to feel uncharacteristically short of breath next spring. His nipples felt sore, and he had to drop out of the 1997 Tour de France owing to a cough and low-back pain. “Athletes, especially cyclists, are in the business of denial,” Lance Armstrong writes. 19 It wasn’t until September, when he coughed blood and his testicle became painfully enlarged, that he finally sought medical attention. By then the cancer had spread to his lungs and brain.

阿姆斯特朗在1996年冬天首次注意到睾丸轻微肿胀，并在第二年春天开始感到异常呼吸困难。他的乳头疼痛，并因咳嗽和腰痛不得不退出1997年的环法自行车赛。“运动员，尤其是自行车运动员，总是习惯于否认现实，”兰斯·阿姆斯特朗写道。直到9月份，他咳血且睾丸疼痛难忍时，他才最终就医。那时，癌细胞已经扩散到他的肺部和脑部。

When it comes to cancer of the testicle, it is not only cyclists who are in the business of denial. Thirty-year-old Roy first felt the swelling in his left testicle in mid-2000 but put off going to his family doctor for another eight months. In the meantime, he told no one. “I was a little embarrassed and secondly I was afraid of getting bad news,” he says. According to a British study, such reluctance to get help is not untypical with this disease: “Delayed diagnosis is common, but is more often due to delay in seeking medical advice than to delay in the correct diagnosis being made by the physician…. The maximum period of delay between symptoms and orchidectomy was three years, with a … mean delay of 3.9 months.” 20

说到睾丸癌，并非只有骑行者才会否认病情。30岁的罗伊在2000年中期首次感觉到左侧睾丸肿胀，但他却拖了八个月才去看家庭医生。在此期间，他没有告诉任何人。“我有点尴尬，其次，我害怕听到坏消息，”他说。根据一项英国研究，这种不愿就医的情况在睾丸癌患者中并不少见：“诊断延迟很常见，但这更多是由于患者延迟就医，而不是医生未能做出正确诊断……从出现症状到进行睾丸切除术的最长延迟时间为三年，平均延迟时间为3.9个月。”

It may be that young men are simply loath to accept that there is anything wrong with them, particularly with their sexual organs. But logic would suggest the opposite: if masculinity were the issue, young men would likely run for help as soon as they noticed an abnormality with their testes—just as they do, for example, when they notice their hair thinning owing to familial baldness. Certainly when we look at Roy’s life and at the autobiography of Lance Armstrong, we see deeper motives for the denial of their disease.

或许年轻男性只是不愿承认自己身体出了问题，尤其是性器官方面的问题。但逻辑却恰恰相反：如果男子气概真的成了问题，那么年轻男性一旦发现睾丸异常，就应该立即寻求帮助——就像他们发现头发稀疏（例如，由于家族遗传性脱发）时一样。当然，当我们审视罗伊的人生经历以及兰斯·阿姆斯特朗的自传时，会发现他们否认疾病背后有着更深层次的动机。

I have known Roy and his family since he was eight. I was their doctor for twenty years, until I left my practice in 2000. I discovered that Roy had been treated for testicular cancer when I dropped in for a quick visit to my old office a few months ago. By happenstance it was the same afternoon Roy was there for a checkup. By then I had already read Lance Armstrong’s book, It’s Not about the Bike: My Journey Back to Life. The parallels in the lives of Roy and Lance were eerie. Perhaps the similarities in their response to disease were more than coincidental.

我从罗伊八岁起就认识他和他的家人。我曾是他们的医生二十年，直到2000年离开诊所。几个月前，我顺道回老诊所看看，才知道罗伊曾接受过睾丸癌的治疗。巧合的是，那天下午罗伊也来诊所复诊。那时我已经读过兰斯·阿姆斯特朗的自传《这不是关于自行车：我的重生之旅》。罗伊和兰斯的人生经历有着惊人的相似之处。或许，他们面对疾病的反应如此相似，绝非巧合。

Long before his cancer, Armstrong had developed a pattern of emotional repression. One of his close friends described him as “kind of like an iceberg. There’s a peak, but there is so much more below the surface.”

早在患癌之前，阿姆斯特朗就养成了压抑情绪的习惯。他的一位密友形容他“就像一座冰山。表面之下隐藏着巨大的水面，但水面之下还有更多的东西。”

Armstrong never knew his biological father, whom he contemptuously dismisses as his “DNA donor.” His mother, Linda Mooneyham, the daughter of divorced parents, was seventeen and abandoned when she gave birth to Lance, her first son. Linda’s father, an alcoholic Vietnam veteran, gave up drinking, to his credit, the day his grandson was born.

阿姆斯特朗从未见过他的生父，他轻蔑地称其为自己的“DNA捐赠者”。他的母亲琳达·穆尼汉姆父母离异，17岁时生下长子兰斯后便被遗弃。琳达的父亲是一位酗酒的越战老兵，值得称赞的是，他在孙子出生的那天戒了酒。

Linda was a spirited and independent-minded young woman but, given her circumstances, also a very needy one, hardly an adult. As Lance was to write, “In a way, we grew up together.” When Lance was three, Linda remarried. The stepfather, Terry Armstrong, is described by Lance as “a small man with a large mustache and a habit of acting more successful than he really was.” He professed Christian principles but, despite them, beat Lance regularly: “The paddle was his preferred method of discipline. If I came home late, out would come the paddle. Whack. If I smarted off, I got the paddle. Whack. It didn’t hurt just physically, but also emotionally. So I didn’t like Terry Armstrong. I thought he was an angry testosterone geek, and as a result, my early impression of organized religion was that it was for hypocrites.”

琳达是个活泼独立、个性鲜明的年轻女子，但鉴于她的境遇，她也十分需要关爱，几乎算不上一个成年人。正如兰斯后来写道：“某种程度上，我们是一起长大的。”兰斯三岁时，琳达再婚了。继父特里·阿姆斯特朗被兰斯描述为“个子矮小，留着浓密的胡子，总是装出一副比实际更成功的样子”。他自称信奉基督教，但实际上却经常殴打兰斯：“他最喜欢的管教方式就是用木板打我。如果我回家晚了，木板就会拿出来。啪！如果我顶嘴，也会挨打。啪！这不仅让我身体疼痛，也让我精神崩溃。所以我不喜欢特里·阿姆斯特朗。我觉得他是个脾气暴躁、充满雄性荷尔蒙的怪胎，因此，我对宗教的最初印象就是：那是伪君子才会信的。”

As the adolescent Lance was to learn, his stepfather also engaged in extramarital affairs. “I could have dealt with Terry Armstrong’s paddle. But there was something else I couldn’t deal with,” writes Lance, referring to his stepfather’s infidelities. The marriage broke up.

正如少年兰斯后来所了解到的，他的继父也有婚外情。“我可以应付特里·阿姆斯特朗的鞭打，但有些事我无法忍受，”兰斯写道，他指的是继父的不忠。这段婚姻最终破裂了。

Roy is also the first-born, the child of an ill-tempered and violent man who used to beat his wife and his son. “I remember one thing that my dad did. He tied my wrists and tied my ankles and put me out in the backyard. I don’t remember how long he left me out there, but what really bothered me was the that guy who lived upstairs was looking out the window at me and laughing at me. How the fuck can you do that to a kid? Obviously it bothers me to this day.”

罗伊是家里的老大，他的父亲脾气暴躁，经常殴打妻子和儿子。“我记得我爸做过一件事。他绑住我的手腕和脚踝，把我扔到后院。我不记得他把我扔了多久，但真正让我耿耿于怀的是，住在楼上的那个人从窗户里看着我，嘲笑我。他怎么能对一个孩子做出这种事？直到今天，这件事仍然让我耿耿于怀。”

“Was your mom around?”

你妈妈当时在家吗？

“I think my mom was at work.” Roy looked upon his mother as his ally. Very early he took on the role of defending her against her husband’s violence.

“我想我妈妈去上班了。”罗伊把母亲视为自己的盟友。他很早就承担起保护母亲免受丈夫暴力侵害的责任。

Lance Armstrong’s mother was also unable to protect her son from being beaten. It is inevitable that a child in that situation would have deep hurt around that failure—and anger not only at the abusive stepfather but also at the mother who could not keep him safe. Lance seems unaware of any such feelings—and that is the source, I believe, of his propensity to deny and ignore his pain. “If it was a suffer-fest,” Lance writes about his teenage attraction to endurance sports, “I was good at it.”

兰斯·阿姆斯特朗的母亲也未能保护儿子免受殴打。在这种情况下，一个孩子必然会因这种失败而深感痛苦——不仅对虐待他的继父感到愤怒，也对未能保护他的母亲感到愤怒。兰斯似乎没有意识到这些感受——我认为，这正是他倾向于否认和忽视痛苦的根源。“如果那是一场痛苦的盛宴，”兰斯在谈到他青少年时期对耐力运动的迷恋时写道，“我做得很好。”

As indicated in the passage quoted above, he had greater difficulty enduring his mother’s betrayal by her husband than his own harsh treatment.

如上文引述的段落所示，他更难以忍受母亲被丈夫背叛，而不是自己遭受的苛待。

The child of an unhappy mother will try to take care of her by suppressing his distress so as not to burden her further. His role is to be self-sufficient and not “needy”—recall my reflexive suppression of a limp after minor knee surgery. When twenty-five-year-old Lance was given his cancer diagnosis, he was quite unable to tell his mother directly. “I wasn’t strong enough to break it to my mother that I was sick,” he writes. He accepted the offer of a close friend to inform her on his behalf.

一个不快乐的母亲的孩子会努力照顾她，压抑自己的痛苦，以免加重她的负担。他的角色是自立自强，而不是“依赖”母亲——想想我做完膝盖小手术后下意识地掩饰跛行的样子。25岁的兰斯被确诊患癌时，他根本无法直接告诉母亲。“我没有足够的勇气告诉妈妈我生病了，”他写道。他接受了一位好友的帮助，由这位好友代他告知母亲。

Linda rose to the challenge with great strength, love and courage, supporting Lance through the nightmare of a highly uncertain prognosis, the bewildering difficulties of making the appropriate treatment decisions and the travails of brain surgery and chemotherapy. Her son’s automatic reflex to protect her was rooted not in their adult realities but in the childhood experiences that had programmed his coping style.

琳达以无比的坚强、爱和勇气迎接挑战，陪伴兰斯度过了预后极度不确定的噩梦、艰难的治疗决策过程以及脑部手术和化疗的痛苦。儿子保护她的本能并非源于他们成年后的现实，而是根植于童年经历中形成的应对方式。

The result of Roy’s childhood relationship with his parents, he says, was that “in the past I’ve always seemed to put other people’s happiness before my own. My self-esteem was very low, so I thought socially that if I made others happy, then they would accept me. I’d try to satisfy them, doing what I thought they would want me to do.”

罗伊说，他童年时期与父母的关系导致他“过去总是把别人的幸福放在自己的幸福之前。我的自尊心很低，所以我在社交上认为，如果我让别人开心，他们就会接受我。我会努力取悦他们，做我认为他们希望我做的事。”

“How would you do that?”

“你会怎么做？”

“By not being honest with myself or others. Always going along with what they wanted to do, or not being honest with them if they said something that hurt. I would just let that go.

“因为我对自己和别人都不诚实。总是顺从他们想做的事，或者如果他们说了什么伤人的话，我也不坦诚相告。我只会选择忍气吞声。”

“A few years ago I had a business with two partners. As far as I was concerned, we were all equal, but it seemed like the way they were running the show, it was all them. They were in charge. My opinion didn’t matter. Things like that hurt, but I just suppressed it and kept it in and didn’t say anything. I didn’t know how to deal with it.”

“几年前我和两个合伙人合伙做生意。在我看来，我们都是平等的，但感觉他们掌控一切，一切都由他们说了算。他们说了算，我的意见根本不重要。这种事让我很受伤，但我只能压抑住情绪，什么也没说。我不知道该怎么处理。”

The crucial difference, I believe, between Lance Armstrong and Roy on the one hand, and Francis on the other, is that the first two had had enough love in their lives to hold on to the part of themselves that allowed for the development of a fighting spirit. Unlike Francis, they also both received powerful caring and support from family and friends when they were diagnosed.

我认为，兰斯·阿姆斯特朗和罗伊与弗朗西斯之间最关键的区别在于，前两位在生活中都拥有足够的爱，从而保留了内心深处那份孕育不屈不挠精神的品质。与弗朗西斯不同的是，他们在确诊后也都得到了家人和朋友的悉心照料和鼎力支持。

I strongly suspect that repression plays a role in the onset of testicular malignancy. It would be worthwhile for someone to undertake a study in which men with the disease were carefully interviewed about how they experienced their lives emotionally. One aspect deserving attention would be the patients’ level of closeness to and identification with their mothers. There is—I don’t believe coincidentally—an uncanny resemblance in looks between Lance’s mother, and his wife, Kik. In a photograph of the three of them in Armstrong’s riveting memoir, one can hardly tell the two women apart.

我强烈怀疑压抑在睾丸恶性肿瘤的发生中扮演着重要角色。值得开展一项研究，对患有这种疾病的男性进行细致的访谈，了解他们的情感体验。其中一个值得关注的方面是患者与母亲的亲密程度和认同感。兰斯的母亲和他的妻子基克长相惊人地相似——我相信这绝非巧合。在阿姆斯特朗引人入胜的回忆录中，有一张他们三人的合影，几乎难以分辨出这两位女性。

One of the lessons Roy spontaneously drew from his experience of cancer was to refuse to orient his behaviour any longer to pleasing others without considering the cost to himself. “Whatever I do now, it is definitely not to please anyone else,” he says. “What is going to make me happy? Is this what I want to do? I’ve tried it the other way in the past, and it didn’t work out for me.”

罗伊从抗癌经历中自然而然地领悟到的一条人生真谛是：不再为了取悦他人而不顾自身利益。“我现在做任何事，绝对不是为了取悦任何人，”他说，“什么才能让我快乐？这是我真正想做的吗？我以前试过反其道而行之，结果并不理想。”

Francis was admitted to palliative care, in the end. The cancer eventually spread to his liver, causing a painful distension of that organ. He died quite soon, sooner than we doctors had anticipated.

弗朗西斯最终被送进了临终关怀病房。癌细胞最终扩散到了他的肝脏，导致肝脏剧烈肿胀，疼痛难忍。他去世得很快，比我们医生预想的要早。

* Jean has MS. For her story, see chapter 18, “The Power of Negative Thinking.”

* 吉恩患有多发性硬化症。关于她的故事，请参阅第 18 章“消极思考的力量”。

9
9
Is There a “Cancer Personality”?
是否存在“巨蟹座性格”？

I T WAS LATE AUTUMN OF 1990 when Jimmy married Linda. The wedding took place in the chapel of Vancouver Hospital’s palliative care unit, five days before he died of the skin cancer that had invaded his spine. The bride was eight months pregnant. Except for his father, all Jimmy’s family had gathered to witness the ceremony and to be with him in his final weeks. A month and a day after I pronounced Jimmy’s death, I attended the birth of their daughter, Estelle, just as I had helped deliver Linda’s two older children from her first marriage.

那是1990年深秋，吉米和琳达结婚了。婚礼在温哥华医院临终关怀病房的教堂举行，五天后，吉米因皮肤癌扩散至脊柱而去世。新娘当时已怀孕八个月。除了吉米的父亲，他所有的家人都聚集在一起见证婚礼，并陪伴他走完人生的最后几周。在我宣布吉米去世一个月零一天后，我见证了他们女儿埃斯特尔的出生，就像我曾帮助琳达接生她与前夫所生的两个孩子一样。

Jimmy wasn’t much for doctors. Although he and Linda had been together five years, I had met him only that summer when he visited the office with persistent back pain. It turned out to be the sign of spinal metastases from a skin cancer that had been excised from his leg some years before. The original condition, malignant melanoma, is a life-endangering tumour of melanocytes, the pigmented cells in the skin. A deadly disease with a ready tendency to spread to other organs, melanoma often strikes people in the prime of life.

吉米不太喜欢看医生。虽然他和琳达已经在一起五年了，但我直到那年夏天才认识他，当时他因为持续的背痛来诊所就诊。结果发现，这是几年前从他腿上切除的皮肤癌转移到脊柱的征兆。他最初患的病是恶性黑色素瘤，这是一种危及生命的黑色素细胞肿瘤，黑色素细胞是皮肤中的色素细胞。黑色素瘤是一种极易扩散到其他器官的致命疾病，而且常常侵袭正值壮年的人群。

I did not get to know Jimmy very well, but from our first meeting he impressed me as extraordinarily likeable. He was thirty-one years old, polite and friendly, with sandy-coloured light brown hair, blue eyes, a complexion sprinkled with freckles and a broad, Irish, open-faced look about him.

我跟吉米并不算很熟，但从第一次见面起，他就给我留下了非常讨人喜欢的印象。他三十一岁，彬彬有礼，待人友善，有着沙棕色的头发、蓝色的眼睛，脸上点缀着雀斑，一副宽阔、开朗的爱尔兰面孔。

The exposure of fair-skinned individuals to ultraviolet radiation is the major physical risk factor for malignant melanoma. People of Celtic origin appear to be especially vulnerable, particularly if, like Jimmy, they have light-coloured hair, freckles and blue or grey eyes. Dark-skinned ethnic groups are at little risk for skin cancer—in Hawaii, skin cancer is forty-five times less common among non-Caucasians than in Caucasians. 1 Local dermatologists conduct a “sunscreen patrol” on the beaches of Vancouver in the summertime as a public service, warning sunbathers of the danger they are courting. It is unfortunate that repression is not as easily remediable a problem as inadequate sunscreen. Malignant melanoma has been the subject of some of the most persuasive research evidence linking repression and the development of cancer.

皮肤白皙的人暴露于紫外线辐射是恶性黑色素瘤的主要生理风险因素。凯尔特人似乎尤其容易患上这种疾病，特别是像吉米那样拥有浅色头发、雀斑和蓝灰色眼睛的人。肤色较深的族群患皮肤癌的风险很低——在夏威夷，非白种人患皮肤癌的概率比白种人低45倍。当地皮肤科医生在夏季会在温哥华的海滩上进行“防晒霜巡逻”，作为一项公共服务，提醒日光浴者注意他们正在面临的危险。令人遗憾的是，压抑情绪不像防晒霜使用不足那样容易解决。恶性黑色素瘤一直是研究压抑情绪与癌症发展之间联系的最有力证据之一。

Jimmy’s condition deteriorated very quickly, and the chemotherapy and radiation made him feel worse. “I’ve had enough,” he finally said. “This is crazy. I’m dying, and I don’t need to be dying as sick as I am.” Soon after that, his legs became paralyzed, triggering his admission to palliative care. Death followed within a few weeks. Until I left my practice two years ago, Linda and her children remained my patients. When I called her recently, she agreed to be interviewed for this book, as did Donna, Jimmy’s older sister.

吉米的病情迅速恶化，化疗和放疗让他感觉更加难受。“我受够了，”他终于说道，“这太疯狂了。我要死了，我不应该病得这么重。”不久之后，他的双腿瘫痪，不得不接受临终关怀。几周后，他便去世了。直到两年前我离开诊所，琳达和她的孩子们一直是我的病人。最近我打电话给她时，她同意接受本书的采访，吉米的姐姐唐娜也同意了。

I asked Linda to describe her late husband’s personality. “Jimmy was easygoing, laid-back and relaxed. He loved to be around people. I had to think when you asked me about what kind of stresses there were in his life. He wasn’t a very stressed out kind of person. Now, he was a drinker. He had to drink pretty much every day. That’s why I wouldn’t marry him all those years, because of the drinking. He had beer every day—at least four or more.”

我请琳达描述一下她已故丈夫的性格。“吉米性格随和，不拘小节，很放松。他喜欢和人待在一起。你问我他生活中有什么压力的时候，我得好好想想。他不是那种容易焦虑的人。不过，他确实爱喝酒。他几乎每天都要喝。这就是为什么我那么多年都不愿意嫁给他，就是因为他爱喝酒。他每天都要喝啤酒——至少四瓶，甚至更多。”

“Did it change him at all?”

“这件事对他有任何改变吗？”

“Only if he had a lot more than that…. Then he became this very big, lovable bear who wanted to tell everybody how much he loved them. When he drank, he just wanted to hug people. Guys, too, like they were his big brothers. He needed to say to a guy, ‘You’re my buddy,’ and then he would cry.

“如果他喝得更多就好了……那样他就会变成一只非常庞大、非常可爱的熊，想要告诉所有人他有多爱他们。他喝醉的时候，就只想拥抱别人。也拥抱男人，就像拥抱他的亲兄弟一样。他需要对某个男人说，‘你是我的好兄弟’，然后他就会哭。”

“He wasn’t a violent man, he wasn’t angry or frustrated. He was sad. He had a lot of sadness in him, and I don’t know why.

“他不是一个暴力的人，他不生气也不沮丧。他很悲伤。他内心充满了悲伤，我不知道为什么。”

“There’s only one thing I can think of, some secret that he had about his father that he didn’t want to tell me. He couldn’t talk about it. He did not talk about his emotions. He did not share anything, really.”

“我只能想到一件事，那就是他藏着一些关于他父亲的秘密，他不想告诉我。他无法谈论这件事。他从不谈论自己的情绪。他真的什么都不跟我分享。”

“What kind of a childhood had he had?”

“他拥有怎样的童年？”

“He grew up in Halifax. He always said he was a happy kid. His parents stayed together. Both his parents were alcoholics—the father, from what I understand, drank a lot for a long time. I think the mother started when Jimmy was a teenager.”

“他是在哈利法克斯长大的。他总是说自己是个快乐的孩子。他的父母一直在一起。他的父母都是酒鬼——据我所知，他父亲长期酗酒。我想他母亲是在吉米十几岁的时候开始酗酒的。”

As I found out later from Jimmy’s sister, Donna, his senior by two years, their father had been a heavy drinker throughout their childhood. Donna and I had two conversations. “I felt very comfortable with my childhood,” she told me at first. “My younger siblings have a different perspective … but I believe we had a very good upbringing. Very happy household …

后来我从吉米的姐姐唐娜（比他大两岁）那里得知，他们的父亲在他们整个童年时期都酗酒。我和唐娜谈过两次。“我对我的童年很满意，”她一开始告诉我，“我的弟弟妹妹们有不同的看法……但我相信我们成长在一个非常好的家庭。一个非常幸福的家庭……”

“Jimmy was a real little boy, a happy kid. We’d play all the time. We’d go out into the backyard and have water fights—you know, those little spray guns. I just see him as a kid with a real happy face.”

“吉米是个非常可爱的小男孩，一个快乐的孩子。我们总是一起玩。我们会到后院去打水仗——你知道，就是那种小喷水枪。我脑海里总是浮现出他那张快乐笑脸的形象。”

“How do you recall your parents?”

你对你的父母有什么印象？

“My father was the nicest, friendliest man around. He was a very funny man. He was always joking around with us, play-fighting with us, tickling. He used to mimic, used to talk like Donald Duck. People would come over and say, ‘Get your father to talk like a duck.’

“我父亲是周围最和蔼可亲的人。他非常幽默，总是和我们开玩笑、打闹、挠我们痒痒。他以前常常模仿唐老鸭，说话也像唐老鸭。人们会过来跟他说：‘让你爸爸也像鸭子一样说话。’”

“He was a comical person, but you had to listen to him. We’d joke around with him, but when Dad spoke, the ground shook…. When he was annoyed or angry, when enough was enough—that was it. If he told us to do something, you did it.”

“他是个很幽默的人，但你不得不听他的话。我们会跟他开玩笑，但爸爸一开口，就感觉天都要塌下来了……他要是生气了，要是觉得够了——那就完了。他让我们做什么，你就得做什么。”

“Why?”

“为什么？”

“Because if not, you’d be punished and yelled at.”

“因为如果不这样做，你会受到惩罚和责骂。”

Donna married and moved to a different town when she was nineteen. Jimmy stayed with his parents until the age of twenty-two. On what was to have been a brief trip to Vancouver, ostensibly to see a friend, he called to tell his parents he would not be back. He did not return, except for a rare visit.

唐娜十九岁结婚后搬到了另一个城镇。吉米一直和父母住在一起，直到二十二岁。他原本计划去温哥华短暂旅行，表面上是去看望朋友，却打电话告诉父母他不会回来了。除了偶尔回来看看，他再也没有回来过。

“He just called and said he wasn’t coming home. He left a letter in his top drawer, explaining it.”

“他打电话来说他不回家了。他在最上面的抽屉里留了一封信，解释了原因。”

“He escaped.”

他逃脱了。

“He did. And the reason why, I remember him saying to my parents, ‘Hey, I couldn’t tell you, because I didn’t want to hurt you…’”

“他确实这么做了。我记得他跟我父母解释说：‘嘿，我不能告诉你们，因为我不想伤害你们……’”

“So Jimmy had the feeling that it would hurt his parents for him to be an independent person.”

“所以吉米觉得，如果他成为一个独立的人，会让他父母伤心。”

“All of us were made to feel that way. For our mother, her children were her world. They were her everything. She tried to do the best she could, but she was very attached to us—even to my detriment but especially to Jimmy’s. In retrospect, I realize we were far too attached, to an unhealthy degree. I think at some point you have to let your children go. I think emotionally, she didn’t let go. I felt obligated, and many times Jimmy did, too. Normally your parents would try to understand and accept your separateness as you got older.”

“我们都被灌输了这种感觉。对母亲来说，孩子们就是她的全世界，是她的一切。她尽力做到最好，但她对我们太过依恋——甚至对我造成了伤害，尤其对吉米更是如此。现在回想起来，我意识到我们之间的依恋太深了，已经到了不健康的程度。我觉得在某个阶段，你必须放手让孩子独立。我觉得在情感上，她没有放手。我感到自己有义务这样做，很多时候吉米也有这种感觉。通常情况下，父母会在孩子长大后尝试理解并接受他们的独立性。”

“Jimmy’s escape to the West Coast physically doesn’t mean that he liberated himself internally.”

“吉米逃往西海岸并不意味着他获得了内心的解脱。”

“Of course he didn’t, no. He felt terrible. He felt very, very bad. He did it, but he also had to live with the feelings.”

“他当然没有，绝对没有。他感觉糟透了。他感觉非常非常糟糕。他做了这件事，但他也必须承受这种感觉。”

According to Donna, Jimmy found the burden of his parents’ emotional pain unbearable even at the end of his life. “Just before the Labour Day weekend, my brother phoned me. He told me what was going on with the melanoma, but he said, ‘You know, Donna, I can’t phone Mom and Dad, because emotionally I can’t handle it. Could you do it for me?’ I said sure, I’ll do it. So he said, ‘Just make sure that they don’t call me all upset and crying and everything, because I couldn’t take it.’”

据唐娜说，吉米即使在生命的最后阶段，也无法承受父母的情感痛苦。“就在劳动节长周末前，我哥哥给我打了个电话。他告诉我黑色素瘤的情况，但他说：‘唐娜，你知道吗，我没法给爸妈打电话，因为我情绪上承受不了。你能帮我打吗？’我说当然可以。然后他说：‘你只要确保他们别打电话给我，别哭哭啼啼的，因为我受不了。’”

I suggested to Donna that perhaps what she had recalled as Jimmy’s childhood “real happy face” might not have been a genuine face at all. At least in part, it could have been a coping mechanism Jimmy adopted in reaction to his parents’ anxieties and anger. It was a way of avoiding the painful impact of their emotions on himself. Soothing his parents’ feelings was accomplished by negating his own.

我向唐娜暗示，她记忆中吉米童年时那“真正快乐的表情”或许并非发自内心。至少在某种程度上，那可能是吉米为了应对父母的焦虑和愤怒而采取的一种应对机制。这是一种逃避父母情绪对自身造成痛苦影响的方式。他通过压抑自己的情绪来安抚父母。

Donna called me back a few days later. Our conversation had brought to the forefront many memories. She needed to talk.

几天后，唐娜给我回了电话。我们的谈话勾起了她许多回忆。她需要倾诉。

“After you and I spoke, I just went on about my day. I went to bed at night. About four o’clock in the morning I woke up. It was just incredible how many things came out and just kept going through my mind.

“你我谈话之后，我就继续过我的日子。晚上我上床睡觉了。大约凌晨四点我醒了。真是难以置信，那么多事情涌上心头，一直在我的脑海里盘旋。”

“You had mentioned Linda saying that Jimmy had a lot of sadness in him, maybe to do with his dad. I knew Jimmy really, really well, and yes, there was a lot of sadness. I can go way back to the beginning, remembering when he was little. The only time I can recall my dad doing anything with my brother was a little bit of roughhousing on the carpet in the living room. And I see a bunch of smiles and laughs. But other than that, there was never any participation in Jimmy’s life. Never went to the hockey games. Never played with him.

“你之前提到琳达说吉米内心很悲伤，可能跟他爸爸有关。我非常了解吉米，是的，他的确很悲伤。我可以追溯到他小时候。我唯一记得爸爸和弟弟一起玩耍的场景，就是在客厅的地毯上打闹。我看到了很多笑容和笑声。但除此之外，爸爸从未参与过吉米的生活。他从未去看过他的冰球比赛，也从未和他一起玩过。”

“The crazy thing is that our father always said that he loved us, but he could be so hurtful. I have a brother who is quite heavy, and he’d ridicule him in front of people. He’d say some terrible things to him. And to Jimmy, too.

“最不可思议的是，我们的父亲总是说他爱我们，但他有时却伤人很深。我有个弟弟很胖，他经常当着别人的面嘲笑他，说一些很伤人的话。他对吉米也是一样。”

“I was never angry with my father—I’ve always covered up for him, maybe knowingly, maybe in an unknowing way. That night, all of a sudden, I got so angry. I started to think of Jimmy and all the things that happened as he was growing up and throughout his life. I kept thinking of all the times my father raised his voice. If he was trying to fix something and he didn’t have the right tools, or the screws fell on the floor, or if something didn’t happen exactly the way it was supposed to happen, he would scream and yell, and we were scared. We just fled. All of a sudden I remembered his voice and the screaming and the yelling, and I thought, This is not how you should live. This is not what we should have experienced.

“我从未生过父亲的气——我总是替他掩饰，也许是有意为之，也许是无意的。那天晚上，我突然怒火中烧。我开始想起吉米，想起他成长过程中发生的一切，想起他一生中经历的一切。我不断想起父亲大声吼叫的那些时刻。如果他想修理什么东西，却没有合适的工具，或者螺丝掉在地上，或者事情没有按他预想的那样发展，他就会大吼大叫，我们吓坏了。我们只能逃走。突然间，我想起了他的声音，想起了他的吼叫，我想，你不应该这样生活。我们不应该经历这些。”

“Even at the end … My father came out to see Jimmy—they drove from Halifax. Actually, my sister and her husband did all the driving; my father drank all the way. They arrived a couple of weeks before Jimmy had to go into palliative care. My father walked into the apartment and sat there sipping his beer, not wanting even to go into the bedroom to see his son, to see Jim.

“即使到了最后……我父亲还是来看望吉米——他们从哈利法克斯开车过来。实际上，是我姐姐和姐夫开车；我父亲一路都在喝酒。他们在吉米需要接受临终关怀的前几周到达。我父亲走进公寓，坐在那里啜饮着啤酒，甚至都不想进卧室去看望他的儿子，去看望吉米。”

“We were trying to cover up. We didn’t want Jimmy to realize that his father couldn’t face seeing him—was afraid to see what he was going to look like. Finally, Dad built up enough courage and went into the room, and asked, ‘Jimmy, can I get you anything? Is there something that you want?’

“我们当时想掩盖真相。我们不想让吉米意识到他父亲不敢面对他——害怕看到他现在的样子。最后，爸爸鼓起勇气走进房间，问道：‘吉米，你需要什么吗？你想要什么吗？’”

“My father came out, went to the fridge, and all of a sudden he said, ‘How come there’s no apple juice here? I don’t believe this!’ And he started ranting and raving at all of us in the apartment. We were stunned. Got his coat on and stomped off to the store and came back with apple juice for Jimmy.

“我父亲出来后，走到冰箱前，突然说道：‘怎么没有苹果汁了？我简直不敢相信！’然后他开始对着公寓里的我们所有人大吼大叫。我们都惊呆了。他穿上外套，气冲冲地跑到商店，回来给吉米买了苹果汁。”

“Then my father went home, and that was it. He never saw Jimmy in the hospital. He went back to Halifax and never saw him again. And the funny thing is, well … you know Linda was pregnant with Estelle and they got married five days before Jimmy died.

“然后我父亲就回家了，事情就这么结束了。他再也没在医院见过吉米。他回到了哈利法克斯，之后就再也没见过他。更可笑的是，你知道，琳达当时怀着埃斯特尔，他们在吉米去世前五天结婚了。”

“He was semi-comatose that day.”

“那天他处于半昏迷状态。”

“Yes, he was drowsy. We’d had to increase his pain medication rapidly.”

“是的，他当时昏昏欲睡。我们不得不迅速增加他的止痛药剂量。”

“Well, one of the things I keep remembering is this…. After the wedding, he was weak, but he held his hand up and said, ‘Look, look, just like Dad’s ring.’ And his wedding band was identical to my father’s. It’s funny, those were the words that came out of Jimmy’s mouth. Just like Dad’s ring .”

“嗯，我一直记得这件事……婚礼后，他身体很虚弱，但他举起手说：‘你看，你看，跟爸爸的戒指一模一样。’他的结婚戒指和我父亲的完全一样。真有意思，这些话竟然是吉米说的。跟爸爸的戒指一模一样。”

Jimmy’s mode of emotional coping has been extensively documented among melanoma patients. An elegant study in 1984 measured the physiological responses to stressful stimuli of three groups: melanoma patients, people with heart disease and a control cohort with no medical illness. Each person was connected to a dermograph, a device that recorded the body’s electrical reactions in the skin as the subject looked at a series of slides designed to elicit psychological distress. The slides displayed statements of an insulting, unpleasant or depressing nature, such as “You’re ugly,” or “You have only yourself to blame.” As their physiological responses were being registered, the participants were asked to record their subjective awareness of how calm or disturbed they felt on reading each statement. The researchers thus secured a printout of the actual level of distress experienced by the nervous system of each subject and simultaneously a report of the subjects’ conscious perception of emotional stress.

吉米的这种情绪应对方式在黑色素瘤患者中已被广泛记录。1984 年一项精妙的研究测量了三组人群对压力刺激的生理反应：黑色素瘤患者、心脏病患者和无疾病的对照组。每位受试者都连接到一台皮肤电图仪，该仪器可以记录受试者观看一系列旨在引发心理痛苦的幻灯片时皮肤的电反应。这些幻灯片上展示了一些侮辱性、令人不快或令人沮丧的语句，例如“你真丑”或“你只能怪你自己”。在记录生理反应的同时，研究人员要求参与者记录阅读每条语句后主观感受到的平静或不安程度。由此，研究人员获得了每位受试者神经系统实际承受的痛苦程度的打印报告，以及受试者对情绪压力的主观感知报告。

The physiological responses of the three groups were identical, but the melanoma group proved most likely to deny any awareness of being anxious or of being upset by the messages on the slides. “This study found that patients with malignant melanoma displayed coping reactions and tendencies that could be described as indicating ‘repressiveness.’ These reactions were significantly different from patients with cardiovascular disease, who could be said to manifest the opposite pattern of coping.” 2

三组受试者的生理反应相同，但黑色素瘤组最倾向于否认自己因幻灯片上的信息而感到焦虑或不安。“这项研究发现，恶性黑色素瘤患者表现出的应对反应和倾向可以被描述为‘压抑性’。这些反应与心血管疾病患者显著不同，后者表现出的应对模式则恰恰相反。”

The melanoma group was the most repressed among the three groups; the cardiac patients appeared to be the least inhibited. (It is not, as it may seem, that the reactivity of the cardiac patients is healthy. In between repression and hyper-reactiveness is a healthy median.) This study demonstrated that people can experience emotional stresses with measurable physical effects on their systems—while managing to sequester their feelings in a place completely beyond conscious awareness.

在三个组别中，黑色素瘤患者的情绪最为压抑；心脏病患者的情绪似乎最为外向。（但心脏病患者的反应过度并非如表面看起来那样健康。介于压抑和过度反应之间存在一个健康的中间状态。）这项研究表明，人们在经历情绪压力并对其身体系统产生可测量的生理影响的同时，还能将自己的感受完全隐藏在意识之外。

It was in relationship to melanoma that the notion of a “Type C” personality was first proposed, a combination of character traits more likely to be found in those who develop cancer than in people who remain free of it. Type A individuals are seen as “angry, tense, fast, aggressive, in control”—and more prone to heart disease. Type B represents the balanced, moderate human being who can feel and express emotion without being driven and without losing himself in uncontrolled emotional outbreaks. Type C personalities have been described as “extremely cooperative, patient, passive, lacking assertiveness and accepting…. The Type C individual may resemble Type B, since both may appear easygoing and pleasant, but … while the Type B easily expresses anger, fear, sadness and other emotions, the Type C individual, in our view, suppresses or represses ‘negative’ emotions, particularly anger, while struggling to maintain a strong and happy facade.” 3

“C型人格”的概念最初是在黑色素瘤的研究中提出的，指的是那些更容易患上癌症而非未患癌症的人所具有的性格特征组合。A型人格被认为是“愤怒、紧张、急躁、好斗、控制欲强”，并且更容易患心脏病。B型人格代表着平衡、温和的人，他们能够感受和表达情感，而不会被情绪所驱使，也不会陷入无法控制的情绪爆发中。C型人格被描述为“极其合作、耐心、被动、缺乏自信且包容……C型人格可能与B型人格相似，因为两者都可能看起来随和友善，但是……虽然B型人格很容易表达愤怒、恐惧、悲伤和其他情绪，但我们认为，C型人格会压抑或抑制‘负面’情绪，尤其是愤怒，同时努力维持坚强快乐的外表。”

Could it be disease itself that changes someone’s personality, affecting his coping style in a way that may not reflect how he had functioned in life before the onset of illness? Jimmy’s story, related by his wife and sister, illustrates that repression, “niceness” and lack of aggression are lifelong patterns, having their origins in early childhood. As the researchers who studied physiological stress responses in melanoma patients noted, “When people are diagnosed with a disease—whether cancer or cardiovascular—they do not precipitously change their usual ways of coping with stress or suddenly develop new patterns…. Under stress, people usually mobilize their existing resources and defences.”

疾病本身是否会改变一个人的性格，影响其应对方式，使其与患病前的生活状态截然不同？吉米的故事（由他的妻子和妹妹讲述）表明，压抑、“和善”和缺乏攻击性是终身的模式，其根源可追溯到童年早期。正如研究黑色素瘤患者生理应激反应的研究人员所指出的那样，“当人们被诊断出患有某种疾病——无论是癌症还是心血管疾病——他们不会突然改变以往应对压力的方式，也不会突然形成新的模式……在压力下，人们通常会调动现有的资源和防御机制。”

How do psychological stresses translate into malignant skin lesions? Hormonal factors likely account for the fact that the number of melanoma tumours is increasing in bodily sites not exposed to sunlight. Researchers have suggested that hormones may be overstimulating the pigment-producing cells. 4

心理压力如何转化为恶性皮肤病变？激素因素可能是导致黑色素瘤在未暴露于阳光的身体部位数量增加的原因。研究人员认为，激素可能过度刺激色素细胞。

The Type C personality traits associated with melanoma have been found in studies of many other cancers as well. In 1991 researchers in Melbourne, Australia, investigated whether any personality traits were a risk factor in cancer of the colon or the rectum. Over six hundred people, newly diagnosed, were compared with a matched group of controls. Cancer patients, to a statistically significant degree, were more likely to demonstrate the following traits: “the elements of denial and repression of anger and of other negative emotions … the external appearance of a ‘nice’ or ‘good’ person, a suppression of reactions which may offend others, and the avoidance of conflict…. The risk of colorectal cancer with respect to this model was independent of the previously found risk factors of diet, beer intake, and family history.” 5 Self-reported childhood or adult unhappiness was also more common among the bowel cancer cases. We have already noted similar traits among patients with breast cancer, melanoma, prostate cancer, leukemias and lymphomas, and lung cancer.

与黑色素瘤相关的C型人格特质在许多其他癌症的研究中也有发现。1991年，澳大利亚墨尔本的研究人员调查了是否存在某些人格特质是结肠癌或直肠癌的风险因素。他们将600多名新确诊的患者与一组匹配的对照组进行了比较。结果显示，癌症患者在统计学上显著更倾向于表现出以下特质：“否认和压抑愤怒及其他负面情绪……外表表现得‘和善’或‘好’，抑制可能冒犯他人的反应，以及回避冲突……根据这一模型，结直肠癌的风险与先前发现的饮食、啤酒摄入量和家族史等风险因素无关。” 5 自我报告的童年或成年时期的不快乐在肠癌患者中也更为常见。我们此前已在乳腺癌、黑色素瘤、前列腺癌、白血病和淋巴瘤以及肺癌患者中观察到类似的特质。

In 1946 researchers at Johns Hopkins University began a long-term prospective study to establish whether there are psychobiological characteristics in young people that could help predict susceptibility to future disease states. In the course of the subsequent eighteen years, 1,130 white male students enrolled in medical school underwent psychological testing. They were questioned regarding their emotional coping styles and childhood relationships with parents. Biological data—pulse, blood pressure, weight and cholesterol levels—were also recorded, as were habits such as smoking, coffee drinking and alcohol intake. At study’s end, nearly all the subjects had graduated and most were doctors, their ages ranging from thirty to over sixty. At this point, their health status was reviewed; the majority were healthy, but in about equal numbers some had developed heart disease, high blood pressure, mental illness, cancer or had committed suicide.

1946年，约翰·霍普金斯大学的研究人员启动了一项长期的前瞻性研究，旨在探究年轻人是否存在某些心理生物学特征，能够预测其未来患病的风险。在随后的18年中，1130名就读医学院的白人男性学生接受了心理测试。研究人员询问了他们的情绪应对方式以及童年时期与父母的关系。此外，研究人员还记录了他们的生理数据，包括脉搏、血压、体重和胆固醇水平，以及吸烟、喝咖啡和饮酒等习惯。研究结束时，几乎所有受试者都已毕业，其中大多数人成为了医生，年龄从30岁到60多岁不等。此时，研究人员对他们的健康状况进行了评估；大多数人都很健康，但也有相当数量的人患上了心脏病、高血压、精神疾病、癌症或自杀身亡。

When the researchers conceived of the project, they had not expected to find that cancer would be associated with any pre-existing psychological factors. However, their data showed just such a connection. There were striking similarities between those who had been diagnosed with cancer and the suicide group: “Our results appear to agree with findings that cancer patients ‘tend to deny and repress conflictual impulses and emotions to a higher degree than do other people.’” 6

研究人员在构思这个项目时，并未预料到癌症会与任何既有的心理因素相关。然而，他们的数据恰恰显示了这种关联。癌症患者和自杀人群之间存在着惊人的相似之处：“我们的研究结果似乎与癌症患者‘比其他人更倾向于否认和压抑冲突的冲动和情绪’的发现相符。”

The researchers found that both for the healthy majority and for each disease category there was a distinctive set of psychological traits. The lowest scores for depression, anxiety and anger had been originally recorded for the medical students who later developed cancer. They had also reported being the most distant from their parents. Of all the groups, the cancer subjects were the least able to express emotion. Does that mean there is a “cancer personality”? The answer is neither a simple yes nor a no.

研究人员发现，无论是在健康的大多数人中，还是在每种疾病类别中，都存在一套独特的心理特征。最初记录的抑郁、焦虑和愤怒得分最低的群体是后来患上癌症的医学生。他们也表示与父母的关系最为疏远。在所有群体中，癌症患者表达情感的能力最弱。这是否意味着存在一种“癌症人格”？答案既非简单的“是”，也非简单的“否”。

Melanoma illustrates the futility of simplistic reductions to a single origin. Fair skin alone cannot be the cause of this cancer, since not everyone with fair skin will develop melanoma. Ultraviolet damage to the skin by itself cannot be sufficient, since only a minority of light-complexioned persons who suffer sunburns will end up with skin cancer. Emotional repression by itself also cannot account for all cases of malignant melanoma, since not all people who are emotionally repressed will develop either melanoma or any other cancer. A combination of these three circumstances is potentially lethal.

黑色素瘤表明，简单地归因于单一原因的做法是徒劳的。肤色白皙本身并非黑色素瘤的病因，因为并非所有肤色白皙的人都会患上黑色素瘤。紫外线对皮肤的损伤本身也不足以解释黑色素瘤的发生，因为只有少数肤色较浅的人在晒伤后会发展成皮肤癌。情绪压抑本身也无法解释所有恶性黑色素瘤病例，因为并非所有情绪压抑的人都会患上黑色素瘤或其他癌症。这三种因素的综合作用才可能导致致命的后果。

While we cannot say that any personality type causes cancer, certain personality features definitely increase the risk because they are more likely to generate physiological stress. Repression, the inability to say no and a lack of awareness of one’s anger make it much more likely that a person will find herself in situations where her emotions are unexpressed, her needs are ignored and her gentleness is exploited. Those situations are stress inducing, whether or not the person is conscious of being stressed. Repeated and multiplied over the years, they have the potential of harming homeostasis and the immune system. It is stress—not personality per se—that undermines a body’s physiological balance and immune defences, predisposing to disease or reducing the resistance to it.

虽然我们不能断言某种人格类型会导致癌症，但某些人格特征确实会增加患癌风险，因为它们更容易产生生理压力。压抑、无法拒绝他人以及缺乏对自身愤怒的觉察，会使人更容易陷入情绪无法表达、需求被忽视、温柔被利用的境地。无论当事人是否意识到压力，这些境地都会引发压力。随着时间的推移，这些压力不断累积，最终可能损害体内平衡和免疫系统。正是压力——而非人格本身——破坏了身体的生理平衡和免疫防御，使人更容易患病或降低抵抗力。

Physiological stress, then, is the link between personality traits and disease. Certain traits—otherwise known as coping styles—magnify the risk for illness by increasing the likelihood of chronic stress. Common to them all is a diminished capacity for emotional communication. Emotional experiences are translated into potentially damaging biological events when human beings are prevented from learning how to express their feelings effectively. That learning occurs—or fails to occur—during childhood.

因此，生理压力是人格特质与疾病之间的联系。某些特质——也称为应对方式——会增加慢性压力的可能性，从而加剧患病风险。这些特质的共同之处在于情感沟通能力的下降。当人们无法学习如何有效地表达自己的感受时，情感体验就会转化为潜在的有害生理事件。这种学习——或者说未能学习——发生在童年时期。

The way people grow up shapes their relationship with their own bodies and psyches. The emotional contexts of childhood interact with inborn temperament to give rise to personality traits. Much of what we call personality is not a fixed set of traits, only coping mechanisms a person acquired in childhood. There is an important distinction between an inherent characteristic , rooted in an individual without regard to his environment, and a response to the environment , a pattern of behaviours developed to ensure survival.

人的成长经历塑造了他们与自身身体和心理的关系。童年的情感环境与先天气质相互作用，最终形成人格特质。我们通常所说的人格，很多时候并非一套固定不变的特质，而只是个体在童年时期习得的应对机制。内在特质（根植于个体自身，不受环境影响）与对环境的反应（为确保生存而发展出的行为模式）之间存在着重要的区别。

What we see as indelible traits may be no more than habitual defensive techniques, unconsciously adopted. People often identify with these habituated patterns, believing them to be an indispensable part of the self. They may even harbour self-loathing for certain traits—for example, when a person describes herself as “a control freak.” In reality, there is no innate human inclination to be controlling. What there is in a “controlling” personality is deep anxiety. The infant and child who perceives that his needs are unmet may develop an obsessive coping style, anxious about each detail. When such a person fears that he is unable to control events, he experiences great stress. Unconsciously he believes that only by controlling every aspect of his life and environment will he be able to ensure the satisfaction of his needs. As he grows older, others will resent him and he will come to dislike himself for what was originally a desperate response to emotional deprivation. The drive to control is not an innate trait but a coping style .

我们认为不可磨灭的特质，或许只是无意识中养成的习惯性防御机制。人们常常认同这些习惯模式，认为它们是自我不可或缺的一部分。他们甚至可能因为某些特质而自我厌恶——例如，当一个人形容自己是“控制狂”时。事实上，人类并没有天生的控制欲。所谓“控制型”人格，其实源于深层的焦虑。婴儿和儿童如果感到自身需求未得到满足，可能会发展出一种强迫性的应对方式，对每一个细节都感到焦虑。当这样的人害怕自己无法掌控局面时，就会承受巨大的压力。他们会在潜意识里认为，只有控制生活的方方面面和环境，才能确保自身需求得到满足。随着年龄的增长，他人会因此怨恨他，而他自己也会因为最初对情感匮乏的绝望反应而厌恶自己。控制欲并非与生俱来的特质，而是一种应对方式。

Emotional repression is also a coping style rather than a personality trait set in stone. Not one of the many adults interviewed for this book could answer in the affirmative when asked the following: When, as a child, you felt sad, upset or angry, was there anyone you could talk to—even when he or she was the one who had triggered your negative emotions? In a quarter century of clinical practice, including a decade of palliative work, I have never heard anyone with cancer or with any chronic illness or condition say yes to that question. Many children are conditioned in this manner not because of any intended harm or abuse, but because the parents themselves are too threatened by the anxiety, anger or sadness they sense in their child—or are simply too busy or too harassed themselves to pay attention. “My mother or father needed me to be happy” is the simple formula that trained many a child—later a stressed and depressed or physically ill adult—into lifelong patterns of repression.

情绪压抑与其说是一种根深蒂固的性格特征，不如说是一种应对方式。本书采访的众多成年人中，没有一个人能对以下问题给出肯定的回答：当你还是个孩子时，感到悲伤、沮丧或愤怒，是否有人可以倾诉——即使这个人正是引发你负面情绪的人？在我25年的临床实践中，包括10年的临终关怀工作，我从未听过任何一位癌症患者或任何慢性病患者对这个问题回答“是”。许多孩子之所以会形成这种习惯，并非出于任何有意的伤害或虐待，而是因为父母自身对孩子身上感受到的焦虑、愤怒或悲伤感到不安——或者仅仅是因为自己太过忙碌或疲惫不堪而无暇顾及。“我的父母需要我快乐”这句简单的话语，让许多孩子——后来成为压力过大、抑郁或身患疾病的成年人——养成了终生压抑情绪的习惯。

Jill, a Chicago filmmaker diagnosed with advanced ovarian cancer, admits to being a perfectionist. A friend of hers told me that she had felt concern during the year prior to the diagnosis as she watched Jill endure a stressful experience. “I felt at the time that this is going to be more than psychologically damaging,” the friend said.

吉尔是一位来自芝加哥的电影制作人，被诊断出患有晚期卵巢癌。她承认自己是个完美主义者。吉尔的一位朋友告诉我，在确诊前的一年里，她一直很担心吉尔，因为她目睹了吉尔承受的巨大压力。“当时我就觉得，这不仅仅是心理上的伤害，”这位朋友说。

“About three years ago Jill got into a collaboration on a video. The production company didn’t do a great job. It became a horrendous nightmare for her, because her expectations were that she had to come through on a project. Once she’s agreed to it, it has to be very high quality. She spent three or five times as much time as she was compensated for. That was, I believe, a big trigger for Jill’s body to say, I can’t stand this.”

“大约三年前，吉尔参与了一个视频合作项目。制作公司做得并不好。这对她来说简直是一场噩梦，因为她期望自己能完成一个项目。一旦她答应了，就必须保证质量。她投入的时间是她所得报酬的三到五倍。我相信，这成了吉尔身体发出‘我无法忍受’信号的一个重要触发点。”

My interview with Jill herself was illuminating for its combination of disarming honesty and psychological denial. Jill told revealing stories of stresses in her relationships with her parents and her spouse, without for a moment accepting that these may have contributed to the onset of her illness. She is fifty, highly articulate, with a tendency to go into a labyrinth of details on every topic. I sensed that was her way of keeping anxiety at bay. She appeared uncomfortable with even brief silences in the conversation. At our first meeting, Jill was still wearing a wig, having lost her hair because of chemotherapy.

我对吉尔的采访颇具启发性，她既坦诚得令人难以招架，又极力否认自己的病情。吉尔讲述了她与父母和伴侣关系中的种种压力，却丝毫没有承认这些压力可能导致了她的疾病。她五十岁，口齿伶俐，但凡谈起任何话题，她都喜欢钻研细节，滔滔不绝。我感觉这是她缓解焦虑的方式。即使谈话中出现短暂的沉默，她也会感到不自在。我们第一次见面时，吉尔还戴着假发，因为化疗她掉光了头发。

She had adopted a mothering role in her marriage. When her husband, Chris, suffered an acute but debilitating illness, she cared for him with maternal concern and devotion, calling the doctors, nursing him at nights, ensuring that he was well looked after while she was at work. All this time she was preparing a presentation she was about to give at a national conference and conducted an evening study group for aspiring filmmakers. She led such a group the night before she left for the conference, packing at two in the morning and catching an early flight.

在婚姻中，她扮演着母亲的角色。当她的丈夫克里斯患上急性重病时，她像母亲一样悉心照料他，打电话联系医生，夜间照顾他，确保在她工作期间他得到妥善照料。与此同时，她还在准备即将在一个全国性会议上发表的演讲，并为有志成为电影制作人的年轻人组织了一个晚间学习小组。在她出发去参加会议的前一天晚上，她还带领着这样一个学习小组，凌晨两点才收拾行李，然后赶上了早班飞机。

It was shortly after her stint of caring for her husband that she experienced the first symptoms of ovarian cancer. The contrast in caretaking by husband and wife was dramatic. Chris made no medical inquiries on her behalf over several months, seemingly oblivious to her pain and weight loss, despite that fact that she was “living on Advils.” “Strangers in elevators would ask me if I was well,” she says. As often happens with ovarian cancer, doctors took several months to arrive at the diagnosis.

在她照顾丈夫一段时间后不久，她就出现了卵巢癌的最初症状。夫妻二人照顾妻子的方式截然不同。几个月来，克里斯从未主动询问过她的医疗情况，似乎对她的疼痛和体重下降毫不在意，尽管她“靠布洛芬度日”。“电梯里的陌生人都会问我是否身体不适，”她说。卵巢癌的诊断过程通常如此，医生花了几个月的时间才最终确诊。

The first thing Jill said when informed she had ovarian cancer was “‘My poor husband and my poor mother.’ I am a pillar of strength for them. I felt sorry for them, because they would lose that support.”

吉尔得知自己患上卵巢癌后说的第一句话是：“我可怜的丈夫和我可怜的母亲。我是他们的精神支柱。我为他们感到难过，因为他们会失去我的支持。”

The gynecological oncologist explained to the couple that the prognosis for survival past five years was poor, given the stage at which Jill’s disease had been diagnosed. Chris was in denial. “He didn’t seem to have heard that,” Jill says. “I needed to talk about what I just been told, but in the car on the way home Chris just kept saying how we’re going to fight and beat this. He actually didn’t remember what the specialist had said about the prognosis, not even afterwards. It completely bypassed him.”

妇科肿瘤医生向这对夫妇解释说，鉴于吉尔确诊时的病情阶段，她五年后的生存预后很差。克里斯却不愿接受这个事实。“他好像根本没听进去，”吉尔说。“我需要跟他谈谈我刚刚听到的这些话，但在回家的车上，克里斯却一直念叨着我们要如何战斗，如何战胜病魔。他根本记不起专家之前说过什么预后，甚至事后也完全没听进去。他完全没意识到这一点。”

As she faced her surgery, Jill had to deal with her mother’s decision to stay with her. “She was not going to come. She’s really used to being the centre of attention, and she doesn’t like flying. But everyone was saying to her, ‘Your daughter is going into hospital, and you’re not going to be there?’ So in response to that she had to be a mother and really come.”

吉尔即将接受手术，她不得不面对母亲决定留下来陪伴她的现实。“她本来不想来的。她习惯了成为众人瞩目的焦点，而且她不喜欢坐飞机。但每个人都问她：‘你女儿要住院了，你却不去？’所以，面对这样的局面，她必须尽到母亲的责任，真的要来。”

“If that’s how you saw it, how did you feel about her coming?”

“如果你是那样看待这件事的，那你对她的到来有什么感受？”

“At the very beginning I was happy that she wasn’t coming. I didn’t want her. I knew she was using me to be a good mother, but I’ve always taken care of my mother since my dad died—he had asked me to.”

“一开始我很高兴她不来。我根本不想要她。我知道她想利用我来扮演好母亲的角色，但我自从父亲去世后就一直照顾着我的母亲——这是他生前嘱咐我的。”

“My guess is that you’ve taken care of her since you were born.”

“我猜你从出生起就一直在照顾她。”

“Okay, since I was born. My dad used to say to me, you know, leave her be. He was so very protective, exasperated with her, but he really loved her in some twisted way. He also had a great understanding of her limitations, and at his own expense he accommodated her as much as he could.

“好吧，从我出生起就是这样。我爸爸以前常跟我说，别管她了。他非常保护她，虽然有时对她很无奈，但不知为何，他真的很爱她。他也非常了解她的局限，并且尽其所能地迁就她，甚至不惜牺牲自己的利益。”

“Once my father picked me up at the airport as I came back from a major work trip to Southeast Asia. I was exhausted. My mother was a teacher, and Dad wanted to drive me to her school. ‘So you can say hello to your mom—she’s waiting there with all her pupils,’ he said. I said, ‘No Dad, I don’t want to go. I’m very tired. I’ve had an emotionally draining trip. I just want to go and be by myself.’ ‘Do this for your mom. You know she is really looking forward to this.’ He actually drove me there, and she was waiting with all the kids, and he made me put this rice paddy hat on that I’d bought so that I would entertain them. She was doted on like this all her life—and he knew that she needed to be honoured that way. She could show the kids her daughter had been away, and now she was back to see her. I played that role to please my dad, and it happened all the time.”

“有一次，我从东南亚出差回来，父亲去机场接我。我当时筋疲力尽。我母亲是位老师，父亲想开车送我去她的学校。‘这样你就可以跟妈妈打个招呼了——她和学生们都在那儿等着呢。’他说。我说：‘不，爸爸，我不想去。我太累了。这次出差让我身心俱疲。我只想一个人待着。’‘为了你妈妈，去做吧。你知道她真的很期待这一刻。’他真的开车送我去了，她和孩子们都在等着。他还让我戴上我买的稻田帽，好逗孩子们开心。她一生都备受宠爱——他知道她需要得到这样的尊重。她可以告诉孩子们，她的女儿离开了一段时间，现在回来了。我扮演这个角色是为了取悦父亲，而且这种情况经常发生。”

“Wouldn’t you encourage your children to assert themselves, not be drawn into taking care of somebody in that sense? Jill, you’ve got this serious disease, this major operation coming up, and your mother not only comes, she stays with you a whole month.”

“难道你不应该鼓励你的孩子独立自主，而不是被迫承担照顾别人的责任吗？吉尔，你得了重病，马上要做大手术，你妈妈不仅来了，还陪了你整整一个月。”

“And she’s very demanding. For a whole month I was catering to her. You know, it’s true, I’m very dutiful, I am really very dutiful. I take care of her. I went through it and talked about it with my friends, and a lot of them said not to let her come.

“她要求很高。整整一个月我都在伺候她。你知道，真的，我很尽责，真的非常尽责。我照顾她。我经历过这件事，也和朋友们谈过，她们很多人都劝我不要让她来。”

“It went through my head many times, If one of my kids were having surgery, and if they didn’t want me to come, I would accept it. However, I would hope that they would feel comfortable that I would be there. With my mother, if I was going to feel guilty and miserable because I didn’t provide for her also, that would have been a greater stress for me.”

“我无数次想过，如果我的孩子要做手术，他们不想让我去，我会接受。但我希望他们能因为我的陪伴而感到安心。至于我的母亲，如果我因为没能照顾好她而感到内疚和痛苦，那对我来说压力会更大。”

Jill’s recollection of her childhood is not that she was a compliant child but that she was rebellious. “I wasn’t such a good kid as an adolescent. My father said that he would never wish that I would have a kid like me. I was quite a handful for them. As a teenager, I was considered very difficult. I did well at university, but I just didn’t like school. Then I got married—somebody professional. So I turned out good for my parents, after all.”

吉尔回忆起自己的童年，说她不是个听话的孩子，而是叛逆的孩子。“我青少年时期可不是个乖孩子。我父亲说他绝对不希望我生个像我这样的孩子。我让他们很头疼。十几岁的时候，大家都觉得我很难管教。我大学成绩不错，但我就是不喜欢学校。后来我结婚了——嫁给了一个专业人士。所以，最终我还是让父母满意了。”

Jill’s mother died last year, since our interview. Her daughter felt a need to look after her even in death. The obituary she wrote eulogized her mother for having travelled a long distance to be with her and to nurse her after her surgery for ovarian cancer.

吉尔的母亲去年去世了，就在我们上次采访之后。即使在母亲去世后，吉尔仍然觉得有必要照顾她。她在讣告中赞扬了母亲不远万里前来陪伴她，并在她卵巢癌手术后悉心照料她。

10
10
The 55 Per Cent Solution
55%解决方案

F OURTEEN YEARS AGO , when she was thirty-nine, Martha travelled from Phoenix, Arizona, to the Mayo Clinic in Rochester, Minnesota, for a second opinion. Her bowel specialist had recommended that the entire large intestine be removed as the only way of controlling her Crohn’s disease. “If they said I needed surgery, I was ready to accept that,” she says, “but I was reluctant.”

十四年前，39岁的玛莎从亚利桑那州凤凰城前往明尼苏达州罗切斯特的梅奥诊所寻求第二诊疗意见。她的肠道专家建议切除整个大肠，认为这是控制克罗恩病的唯一方法。“如果他们说我需要手术，我已经做好了接受的准备，”她说，“但我当时很犹豫。”

For more than a decade and a half, Martha suffered episodes of bleeding from the gut, anemia, fevers, fatigue and abdominal pain. The symptoms began shortly after the birth of her third child. “It was a very busy time in my life, with a lot of confusion. Jerry, my husband, was in his last year of dental school in Montana. I was twenty-three with three kids.” The children were four, two and the baby was only five months old. The family had no income yet, so Martha was doing babysitting and whatever other work she could get. After Jerry’s graduation, the couple moved to Phoenix, where he set up his dental practice.

十多年来，玛莎一直饱受肠道出血、贫血、发烧、疲劳和腹痛的折磨。这些症状在她生下第三个孩子后不久就开始出现了。“那段时间我的生活非常忙碌，也很混乱。我的丈夫杰瑞当时正在蒙大拿州读牙科学校的最后一年。我才23岁，却要照顾三个孩子。”孩子们分别是四岁、两岁，最小的婴儿只有五个月大。家里还没有收入，所以玛莎只能靠做保姆和其他零工勉强糊口。杰瑞毕业后，他们搬到了凤凰城，杰瑞在那里开办了自己的牙科诊所。

“I just wasn’t feeling well. Third baby, very tired and drained emotionally. I was completely alone in Phoenix. I had never wanted to come here in the first place. I wanted to live in Montana. And the truth is, he had an affair one night—that’s what pushed me over the top. I began to have abdominal pains.”

“我当时身体很不舒服。这是我的第三个孩子，我非常疲惫，精神上也备受煎熬。我孤身一人待在凤凰城。我一开始就没想过要来这里。我想住在蒙大拿州。说实话，有一天晚上他出轨了——这件事彻底击垮了我。我开始出现腹痛。”

A few months later, the couple returned to Montana for Jerry’s graduation ceremony. “By then I was hemorrhaging from the bowel. I was hospitalized immediately because my mother-in-law worked in a medical clinic and she saw I wasn’t well. That was when I was diagnosed with Crohn’s disease.”

几个月后，这对夫妇回到蒙大拿州参加杰瑞的毕业典礼。“那时我已经肠出血了。因为我婆婆在诊所工作，她发现我身体不舒服，所以我立即被送进了医院。就在那时，我被确诊为克罗恩病。”

Crohn’s is one of the two major forms of inflammatory bowel disease, or IBD. Ulcerative colitis is the other. Both are characterized by inflammation of the bowel but in different patterns. In ulcerative colitis, the more common of the two, the inflammation begins in the rectum and spreads upward. The entire colon may become involved. The inflammation is continuous but confines itself to the mucosa, the superficial layer that lines the gut.

克罗恩病是两种主要的炎症性肠病（IBD）之一，另一种是溃疡性结肠炎。两者都以肠道炎症为特征，但炎症模式不同。溃疡性结肠炎更为常见，其炎症始于直肠并向上蔓延，整个结肠都可能受累。炎症是持续性的，但局限于肠道黏膜层，即覆盖肠道表面的那层组织。

In Crohn’s disease, the inflammation extends through the entire bowel wall. Most often the ileum, which is the third and final part of the small intestine, and the colon are affected, but Crohn’s may appear in any part of the digestive tract, from esophagus to large intestine. Unlike ulcerative colitis, Crohn’s will skip areas of the alimentary canal so that normal tissue alternates with diseased segments. IBD may be associated with inflammation in the joints, the eyes and the skin.

克罗恩病中，炎症会扩散至整个肠壁。最常受累的是回肠（小肠的第三段，也是最后一段）和结肠，但克罗恩病也可能出现在消化道的任何部位，从食管到大肠。与溃疡性结肠炎不同，克罗恩病会跳过消化道的某些区域，导致正常组织与病变段交替出现。炎症性肠病（IBD）可能伴有关节、眼睛和皮肤的炎症。

The symptoms of IBD depend on the site of involvement. Diarrhea is common in both diseases, along with abdominal pain. Patients may need to defecate many times during the day or even find themselves incontinent. When the colon is affected, there will be bloody stools or, as in Martha’s case, frank hemorrhaging. Especially with Crohn’s, patients may experience fever and weight loss. There may be other complications, such as fistulas created by inflammation—tunnels from the intestines to other organs such as the skin or, say, the vagina.

炎症性肠病 (IBD) 的症状取决于受累部位。腹泻和腹痛在两种疾病中都很常见。患者可能一天需要多次排便，甚至出现失禁。当结肠受累时，会出现便血，或者像玛莎的病例一样，出现明显的出血。特别是克罗恩病患者，可能会出现发热和体重减轻。还可能出现其他并发症，例如炎症引起的瘘管——肠道与其他器官（例如皮肤或阴道）之间的通道。

IBD is usually a disease of young people. Although it may occur at any age, most commonly onset happens between the years from fifteen to thirty-five.

炎症性肠病通常是一种年轻人的疾病。虽然任何年龄都可能发生，但最常见的发病年龄在15岁至35岁之间。

Martha’s symptoms settled quickly in hospital with a course of cortisone. Soon after being discharged she bled again and had to be readmitted. “I got a blood transfusion, but when it was time for discharge, I hemorrhaged again. That time I went into shock. I was in intensive care. Then I got back out and tried to pull my life together.

玛莎在医院接受可的松治疗后，症状很快缓解。出院后不久，她再次出血，不得不再次入院。“我输了血，但到了出院的时候，我又出血了。那一次我休克了，进了重症监护室。后来我出院了，努力重新开始生活。”

“I realized that I was probably not wanting to come back to the marriage and the home. I couldn’t figure out why else I kept hemorrhaging whenever it was time for me to leave the hospital. Why didn’t I just leave my husband? I think I must have just been incredibly young. The truth is that when I did come home, he ended up having another affair. I said, ‘I’m going. This is it.’ I should have left then, but I stayed.

“我意识到我可能并不想回到这段婚姻和这个家。我百思不得其解，为什么每次该出院的时候我都会大出血。为什么我不干脆离开我的丈夫呢？我想我当时一定太年轻了。事实上，当我回到家后，他又有了新的婚外情。我说：‘我要走了。到此为止。’我当时就应该离开，但我留了下来。”

“The next three or four years I was a sick puppy. I was tired a lot. My older one, who would then have been five, was having to help with the other two because I just wanted to sleep most of the time.”

“接下来的三四年里，我一直是个病恹恹的小狗，经常很累。我的大儿子当时应该五岁了，不得不帮忙照顾另外两只小狗，因为我大部分时间只想睡觉。”

“What was your husband doing all the while? What was your relationship like?”

“你丈夫这段时间都在做什么？你们的关系如何？”

“I’ve always compromised for him. He has been an angry person, so I was intimidated by him. He physically intimidated me. He never hit me, but he yelled and threatened and was very aggressive. He was also drinking a lot. One time he really humbled me in front of the kids, which was not good at all. He stood right in my face and yelled at me.

“我一直都对他妥协。他脾气很暴躁，所以我很怕他。他甚至会用肢体恐吓我。他虽然没打过我，但他会大吼大叫、威胁我，而且非常具有攻击性。他当时也经常酗酒。有一次，他当着孩子们的面把我羞辱了一番，这非常不好。他直接冲着我的脸大吼大叫。”

“I was a silent sufferer, and he is an incredible manipulator. Everything was always turned on me. I was always made to feel insecure. At times I couldn’t believe how he could twist things to have it be all my fault.”

“我一直默默忍受，而他是个操控高手。所有的事情都怪罪到我头上，让我总是感到没有安全感。有时候我简直不敢相信他能把事情扭曲成全是我的错。”

“Did anyone suggest to you that there might be any connection between your stresses and your disease?”

“有没有人跟你说过，你的压力和你的疾病之间可能存在某种联系？”

“No. No medical person ever suggested that. But at the Mayo they had an interesting questionnaire. They asked, ‘Has anything significant happened/or is happening in this past year?’ I remember reading it and thinking, Oh gee, for the first time somebody’s actually caring about what’s going on in my life. It was significant for me.”

“不，没有哪个医务人员这么建议过。不过梅奥诊所有一份很有意思的问卷。他们问：‘过去一年里有没有发生什么重大事件/正在发生什么重大事件？’我记得当时读到这份问卷时心想，哇，这还是第一次有人真正关心我的生活。这对我来说意义重大。”

Medical science considers IBD to be “idiopathic,” of unknown causation. Heredity plays a role, but not a major one. About 10 to 15 per cent of patients have a family history of IBD. The risk is estimated to be from 2 to 10 per cent if a first-degree relative has been diagnosed. 1 Patients often intuitively feel there is a connection between their IBD and life stresses, as Martha did with her hemorrhaging. In fact, research shows that “most people with inflammatory bowel disease believe that stress is a major contributor to illness.” 2

医学界认为炎症性肠病（IBD）是一种“特发性”疾病，病因不明。遗传因素虽有一定作用，但并非主要因素。约10%至15%的患者有IBD家族史。如果一级亲属被诊断患有IBD，则患病风险估计为2%至10%。患者常常凭直觉感到自己的IBD与生活压力有关，就像玛莎认为出血与压力有关一样。事实上，研究表明，“大多数炎症性肠病患者认为压力是导致疾病的主要因素。”

For Martha, the immediate stressor in the year before her visit to the Mayo had been the departure of her two teenage daughters, who both left home to attend universities in California. She had relied on them for emotional support. Her husband continued to be emotionally abusive, and by then he had exchanged his drinking for a gambling habit. Once her daughters were gone, surgery became unavoidable. She realized later, through counselling, how emotionally underdeveloped and dependent she had been.

对玛莎来说，在去梅奥诊所就诊前一年，最直接的压力来源是两个十几岁的女儿离家，她们都去了加州上大学。她一直依赖她们的情感支持。她的丈夫依然对她进行情感虐待，而且那时他已经把酗酒的恶习换成了赌博。女儿们离开后，手术就成了不可避免的选择。后来，通过心理咨询，她才意识到自己当时的情感发展是多么不成熟，多么依赖他人。

Tim, fifty-two, with ulcerative colitis, acknowledges his obsessive need to please. “I spend a lot of time trying to appease and trying to impress others rather than looking inwardly.” He has two older brothers. Neither has settled down to a recognized career. One of them got married only recently, in his fifties. His mother has been critical of his siblings, judgment Tim has been anxious to avoid.

蒂姆今年52岁，患有溃疡性结肠炎，他承认自己有强烈的取悦他人的倾向。“我花了很多时间试图安抚别人、给别人留下好印象，而不是反省自己。”他有两个哥哥，两人都没有稳定的职业。其中一个哥哥直到五十多岁才结婚。他的母亲一直批评他的哥哥姐姐，而蒂姆则一直竭力避免受到母亲的评判。

“I feel like I’m the perfect son, who got married, has a house with a picket fence and three kids. Maybe in some way I’ve been trying to please my mom without really knowing it.” A 1955 survey of ulcerative colitis patients found that “colitis patients’ mothers were controlling and had a propensity to assume the role of martyr.” 3 No one sets out consciously to be a martyr to her children or to be controlling. A less judgmental way to put this would be that the child perceived himself to be responsible for his mother’s emotional suffering.

“我觉得自己是个完美的儿子，结了婚，有带白色栅栏的房子，还有三个孩子。也许在某种程度上，我一直在不知不觉中努力取悦我妈妈。” 1955 年一项针对溃疡性结肠炎患者的调查发现，“结肠炎患者的母亲控制欲强，并且倾向于扮演殉道者的角色。” 3 没有人会刻意想成为孩子的殉道者或控制欲强。更客观的说法是，孩子觉得自己要为母亲的情感痛苦负责。

Tim is a stickler for detail. “He overorganizes everything,” his wife, Nancy, says. “He drives me crazy always asking me, ‘When is your timeline for this? Don’t forget to do this.’” The 1955 study, which looked at over seven hundred people with ulcerative colitis, concluded that a high proportion of these patients “had obsessive-compulsive character traits, which included neatness, punctuality, and conscientiousness. Along with these character traits, guarding of affectivity [emotional expression], over-intellectualization, rigid attitudes toward morality and standards of behaviour…. Similar personality traits have also been used to describe patients with Crohn’s.” 4

蒂姆是个一丝不苟的人。“他什么都安排得过于周全，”他的妻子南希说。“他总是问我，‘这件事的进度安排是什么时候？别忘了做这个。’，真是把我逼疯了。”1955年的一项研究调查了700多名溃疡性结肠炎患者，得出结论：这些患者中很大一部分“具有强迫症的性格特征，包括爱干净、守时和认真负责。除了这些性格特征外，还有情感表达的保守、过度理性化、对道德和行为准则的僵化态度……类似的性格特征也被用来描述克罗恩病患者。”

Tim says he is very critical of others and of himself—one more trait for which he ends up judging himself. “I am a perfectionist, so I don’t think I have that natural human sympathy. I’m more cold. In fifteen years I’ve never missed work, even when I was running to the toilet twelve or fifteen times a day, with bleeding. An employee yesterday took the day off—his dog died the night before. I was like ‘What are you saying—he’s not here because his dog died? It was just a dog. Why can’t he come to work?’ Some of the staff said, ‘Haven’t you ever owned a dog? Are you heartless or what?’ I just couldn’t relate.”
