Reagan had lifelong difficulty telling fact from fiction. “He had an inability to distinguish between fact and fancy,” a former fiancée recalled—an indication that in the child’s mind, and later in the adult’s, fancy replaced painful fact. “Reagan’s memory was selective,” writes the publisher and editor Michael Korda in his own autobiography, Another Life , published in 1999:

如果情感的关闭发生在脑发育的关键阶段，那么识别现实的能力可能会永久受损。里根一生都难以分辨事实与虚构。“他无法区分事实和幻想，”他的一位前未婚妻回忆道——这表明，在里根的童年时期，以及后来的成年时期，幻想取代了痛苦的现实。“里根的记忆是有选择性的，”出版商兼编辑迈克尔·科尔达在他1999年出版的自传《另一种人生》中写道：

He was also known to confuse fiction and reality. There had been the anecdote he had told Medal of Honor winners about the Eighth Air Force bomber pilot who, when his B-17 was mortally hit by flak, ordered the crew to parachute out. Just as the pilot was about to jump from the flaming aircraft himself, he discovered that the ball gunner was trapped in his turret, wounded and unable to get out of the hatch above him, terrified of dying alone. The pilot took off his parachute…. and lay down on the floor so that he could put his arm into the turret and hold the dying boy’s hand. “Don’t sweat it, son,” he told the gunner, “we’ll go down together,” as the plane plunged to the ground.

他还以混淆虚构与现实而闻名。他曾给荣誉勋章获得者们讲过这样一个轶事：一位第八航空队的轰炸机飞行员，他的B-17轰炸机被高射炮击中，即将坠毁。飞行员命令机组人员跳伞逃生。正当他自己准备从燃烧的飞机上跳下去时，他发现机枪手被困在炮塔里，身负重伤，无法从上方的舱口出来，害怕独自死去。飞行员脱下降落伞……躺在地板上，将手臂伸进炮塔，握住垂死男孩的手。“别担心，孩子，”他对机枪手说，“我们一起坠落。”飞机随即坠向地面。

This brought tears to Reagan’s eyes and to the eyes of the Medal of Honor winners. The only problem, as the press soon discovered, was that it had never happened. It was a scene from a movie, which the president had unwittingly transposed to real life. 12

这令里根总统和荣誉勋章获得者们热泪盈眶。然而，正如媒体很快发现的那样，唯一的问题是，这一切从未发生过。这只是电影中的一个场景，总统无意中将其搬到了现实生活中。

Similar anecdotes about Reagan abound, as do stories of his poor interpersonal memory. “Dad, it’s me . Your son. Mike,” his first-born child once pleaded with him as Reagan blinked at him uncomprehendingly among a group of fellow students.

关于里根的类似轶事不胜枚举，关于他糟糕的人际记忆的故事也比比皆是。“爸，是我。你的儿子。迈克。”有一次，他的长子在同学们中间，一脸茫然地看着他，里根却眨着眼睛，一脸茫然。

The then-future president once described himself as “the calm vacant center of the hurricane.” Morris writes that there was always about Ronald Reagan’s personality an “immense insularity …, the child was already sheathed in a strange calm … [a] paralysis of sensibility.” The purpose of that defensive and self-induced paralysis is clear. As another woman who rejected the young Reagan’s advances said, “I’ve always known Dutch can’t be hurt.”

这位未来的总统曾将自己形容为“飓风中心平静而空旷的地方”。莫里斯写道，罗纳德·里根的性格中始终有一种“极度的孤僻……孩童时期就笼罩在一种奇异的平静之中……一种麻木的情感麻痹”。这种自我防御和自我麻痹的目的显而易见。正如另一位拒绝了年轻里根追求的女性所说：“我一直都知道，荷兰佬是不会受伤的。”

Dutch—Reagan’s early nickname from his radio announcer days— could be hurt. He buried the pain and anger deeply. His resulting emotional repression is nowhere more clearly demonstrated than in Reagan’s description of an incident when, at age eleven, he arrived home to find his father outdoors, inebriated. “It was Jack lying in the snow, his arms outstretched, flat on his back. He was drunk, dead to the world. I stood over him for a minute or two…. I felt myself fill with grief for my father. Seeing his arms spread out as if he were crucified—as indeed he was—his hair soaked with melting snow, snoring as he breathed, I could feel no resentment against him.”

里根早年做电台播音员时就有的绰号“荷兰佬”——他很容易受伤。他把痛苦和愤怒深深地埋藏起来。他这种情感压抑的体现，在他对自己十一岁那年回家发现父亲醉倒在户外的那件事的描述中体现得淋漓尽致。“杰克躺在雪地里，双臂伸展，仰面躺着。他喝得烂醉，神志不清。我站在他身边一两分钟……我感到无比悲伤。看着他张开双臂，仿佛被钉在十字架上——事实上也确实如此——头发被融化的雪水浸透，鼾声如雷，我对他却没有丝毫怨恨。”

“I could feel no resentment” reveals the young man’s rage at his father. In psychotherapy one often sees this kind of “confirmation by denial”: the speaker spontaneously reports not feeling a certain emotion—usually anger—that he had not been asked about in the first place. This self-report would be more valid than he knew. While it is true that he could feel no resentment, that was so only because his awareness of feeling had been impaired long ago. He would be reporting, albeit unwittingly, that his rage lay beyond the bounds of consciousness. The negative assertion—“I could feel no resentment”—represented an internal conflict between that rage and the forces of repression.

“我感觉不到怨恨”这句话揭示了这位年轻人对父亲的愤怒。在心理治疗中，我们经常会看到这种“否认式确认”：说话者会自发地报告自己没有感受到某种情绪——通常是愤怒——而这种情绪他一开始并没有被问及。这种自我报告比他自己意识到的更有说服力。虽然他确实感觉不到怨恨，但这仅仅是因为他对情绪的感知能力早已受损。他实际上是在无意识地报告，他的愤怒已经超越了意识的界限。“我感觉不到怨恨”这种否定性的断言，代表着愤怒与压抑力量之间的内在冲突。

Reagan’s mother was apparently too self-absorbed and overwhelmed by the stresses of marriage to a philandering and alcoholic husband. She was unavailable to her children—just as, later, Ronald Reagan would be unavailable to his children. Often the child’s antidote to his anger at being ignored is to idealize his mother, which is what Reagan likely did. The depths of his denial become most evident when his mother-substitute, his devoted second wife and caregiver, Nancy, developed breast cancer. Their physician, John Hutton, was given the duty of informing the president. Edmund Morris’s notes, from October 1987:

里根的母亲显然过于自我中心，不堪忍受与一个风流成性、酗酒成性的丈夫的婚姻压力。她无暇顾及子女——正如后来的罗纳德·里根也同样如此。孩子常常会通过理想化母亲来排解被忽视的愤怒，里根很可能就是这么做的。当他的第二任妻子兼照护者，也就是他的母亲替代者南希患上乳腺癌时，他极力否认现实的程度才显露无疑。他们的医生约翰·赫顿负责将这一消息告知总统。埃德蒙·莫里斯1987年10月的笔记：

NR has breast cancer.

NR患有乳腺癌。

John Hutton braced himself to tell RR after the Cab. Meeting Oct. 5—“Mr. President, I’m afraid I have rather bad news regarding the First Lady’s mammogram.” Says never before realized the power of Dutch’s denial. Listened at desk, pen in hand, then softly & stonily: “Well, you’re the doctors, & I’m confident you’ll be able to take care of it.” End of interview.

约翰·赫顿在10月5日的内阁会议后，鼓起勇气告诉RR：“总统先生，恐怕我得告诉您一些关于第一夫人乳房X光检查的坏消息。” 他说，他以前从未意识到荷兰人否认的威力。他坐在办公桌前，手里拿着笔，听着，然后轻声而坚定地说：“嗯，你们是医生，我相信你们能够处理好这件事。” 采访结束。

John repairs perplexed to residence: “Mrs. Reagan, the President is too stunned to say anything.” Stays with her until RR arrives, carrying work. Awkward greetings; no mention of the news. Exit Hutton, even more perplexed.

约翰困惑地回到住处：“里根夫人，总统震惊得说不出话来。”他陪着她，直到RR带着工作到来。两人尴尬地打了个招呼，但只字未提那件事。赫顿离开时，更加困惑了。

Such instances do not indicate that the person has no emotions; someone truly lacking attachment could at least pretend to possess some fellow feeling. On the contrary, the emotions can be too overwhelming to be experienced consciously —but they are physiologically all the more active. Once more we witness that avoiding the experience of emotion in fact exposes people to greater and longer-lasting physiological stress. Because they are unaware of their own internal states, they are less able to protect themselves from the consequences of stress. Furthermore, the healthy expression of emotion is itself stress-reducing. Stress-induced chronic hormonal and immune changes prepare the physiologic ground for diseases like Alzheimer’s.

这种情况并不意味着这个人没有情感；真正缺乏依恋的人至少也能假装拥有一些同情心。相反，这些情感可能过于强烈，以至于无法被有意识地体验——但它们的生理活动却更加活跃。我们再次看到，逃避情感体验实际上会使人们承受更大、更持久的生理压力。由于他们不了解自己的内在状态，因此更难保护自己免受压力带来的后果。此外，健康的情感表达本身就具有减压作用。压力引起的慢性激素和免疫变化会为阿尔茨海默病等疾病的发生创造生理基础。

The emotional poverty, disguised by sentiment, in Reagan’s autobiographical writings in his college years is in dramatic contrast to the rich emotional language of the nuns who survived into old age without Alzheimer’s. The correlation between the richly affective accounts written by some young nuns and their later freedom from dementia was remarkable. The ones who wrote with emotional paucity similar to Reagan’s ended up with Alzheimer’s.

里根大学时期自传体作品中流露出的情感贫乏，被感伤所掩盖，这与那些安享晚年且未患阿尔茨海默病的修女们丰富细腻的情感语言形成了鲜明的对比。一些年轻修女笔下饱含深情的文字与她们日后未患痴呆症之间存在着显著的关联。而那些像里根一样情感匮乏的修女，最终却都患上了阿尔茨海默病。

The life histories of all the Alzheimer’s patients I looked after during my years of family practice were characterized by repressed emotion. I interviewed several adults who are now taking care of aged parents suffering with Alzheimer’s. They all reported early loss or emotional deprivation in their parents’ lives. “My mother’s father died when she was quite young,” one person told me. “I think she was about ten or eleven. The family was living in Vancouver, but her parents sent her up to Gibsons to work in a household that summer. This was back in the thirties.

在我多年行医期间照顾的所有阿尔茨海默病患者，他们的人生经历都以情感压抑为特征。我采访了几位现在照顾患有阿尔茨海默病的年迈父母的成年人。他们都提到父母早年经历过丧亲之痛或情感缺失。“我外公在她很小的时候就去世了，”一位受访者告诉我，“我想她当时大概十岁或十一岁。他们一家住在温哥华，但那年夏天，她的父母把她送到吉布森斯的一户人家做工。那是在上世纪三十年代。”

“My mother was working in Gibsons when her father died. My mom’s older sister came up and brought her back to Vancouver. When they arrived home, her mother said to the sister, ‘What did you bring her back for?’ In front of my mother. It was an astoundingly cruel thing to do.”

“我母亲在吉布森斯工作时，她的父亲去世了。我母亲的姐姐来接她回温哥华。她们到家后，我母亲当着我母亲的面问她姐姐：‘你把她带回来干什么？’这真是太残忍了。”

“A huge amount of tension was always there when I was growing up,” a man whose mother also has Alzheimer’s recalled. “Things were under the surface. Everything my mother stated was always super-fine, but the body language was ‘go away.’ She didn’t reveal anything. I always felt growing up that I didn’t know what was going on.”

“我小时候家里总是弥漫着紧张的气氛，”一位母亲也患有阿尔茨海默病的男子回忆道。“很多事情都隐藏在表面之下。我母亲嘴上说的一切都很好，但她的肢体语言却在说‘走开’。她什么都不说。我从小就感觉自己什么都不知道。”

Other people can observe what the emotionally repressed person holds back from himself. A well-known Hollywood actress who knew the rising movie star Ronald Reagan but remained unmoved by his charms was, nevertheless, “touched by the despair behind his incessant, nervous jocularity,” Morris claims.

其他人能够察觉到情感压抑者内心深处隐藏的东西。一位好莱坞知名女演员曾与冉冉升起的电影明星罗纳德·里根相识，但她并未被他的魅力所打动。然而，莫里斯声称，这位女演员“却被他那喋喋不休、神经质的玩笑背后隐藏的绝望所触动”。

Morris once asked the president what he had most longed for as a young man. “There was a long silence as he tried to escape the question,” the author writes. Reagan finally replied that what he most regretted was not the lack of someone to love him. Rather, he said, “I missed not having someone to love.” Morris notes, “I wrote the words down and followed them with a spiral curlicue useful to biographers, meaning, He feels the opposite of what he says [italics his].”

莫里斯曾问总统，年轻时他最渴望的是什么。“他沉默了很久，试图回避这个问题，”作者写道。里根最终回答说，他最遗憾的不是缺少爱人，而是“我怀念没有爱人的日子”。莫里斯指出，“我把这些话记了下来，并在后面加上了一个对传记作家来说很有用的螺旋状装饰，意思是：他内心的想法与他所说的截然相反[斜体字为“他自己”]。”

13
13
Self or Non-Self: The Immune System Confused
自身还是非自身：免疫系统的困惑

I N THE FIRST EDITION OF HIS CLASSIC Principles and Practice of Medicine , published in 1892, William Osler suggested that rheumatoid arthritis has “in all probability, a nervous origin.” In present-day language, Osler was referring to psychoemotional stress. He noted “the association of the disease with shock, worry, and grief.”

威廉·奥斯勒在其1892年出版的经典著作《内科学原理与实践》第一版中提出，类风湿性关节炎“很可能起源于神经系统”。用今天的话来说，奥斯勒指的是心理情绪压力。他指出“这种疾病与惊吓、焦虑和悲伤有关”。

No obscure theoretician, William Osler was the best-known medical doctor in the English-speaking world. According to Sherwin B. Nuland, himself a physician and author, Osler “may have been the greatest clinical teacher of any day, and any country.” He taught at McGill University in Montreal, Johns Hopkins University Medical School, Baltimore, and at Oxford. In England he was knighted for his contributions to the healing arts. His widely used textbook underwent sixteen editions—the last one in 1947, twenty-eight years after his death.

威廉·奥斯勒并非默默无闻的理论家，而是英语世界最著名的医学家。据身为医生和作家的舍温·B·纽兰所言，奥斯勒“或许是任何时代、任何国家最伟大的临床教师”。他曾在蒙特利尔的麦吉尔大学、巴尔的摩的约翰·霍普金斯大学医学院以及牛津大学任教。在英国，他因对医学的贡献而被授予爵士头衔。他那部广为流传的教科书出版了十六版——最后一版于1947年出版，距他去世已过去了二十八年。

In 1957 C. E. G. Robinson, a Vancouver internal medicine specialist, cited Osler’s words in a brief article in the Canadian Medical Assocation Journal . “I have also been impressed,” he wrote, “by the frequency with which chronic or prolonged stress may precede the development of rheumatoid disease…. I think that the emotional and psychological aspect of many rheumatoid patients is of first importance.” 1

1957年，温哥华内科专家C. E. G. Robinson在《加拿大医学会杂志》的一篇短文中引用了奥斯勒的话。他写道：“我也注意到，慢性或长期压力往往先于类风湿性疾病的发生……我认为，许多类风湿性疾病患者的情绪和心理状况至关重要。”

Dr. Robinson’s medical education was still informed by Osler’s humane and holistic approach. Now, at the beginning of the twenty-first century, one may search in vain through the mainstream medical texts for any mention of stress in relationship to rheumatoid arthritis or to its fellow autoimmune conditions, all of them characterized by a civil war of the immune system against the body. The omission, tragic for millions of human beings suffering rheumatoid disease of one type or another, is all the more unjustifiable since research has long since established the stress-autoimmune connection and has given us an understanding of many of its potential physiological pathways.

罗宾逊博士的医学教育仍然深受奥斯勒的人文主义和整体论理念的影响。如今，在二十一世纪初，人们或许会在主流医学文献中徒劳地寻找任何关于压力与类风湿性关节炎或其他自身免疫性疾病之间关系的论述，而这些疾病的共同特征是免疫系统与自身免疫力之间的“内战”。对于数百万遭受各种类型类风湿性疾病折磨的人来说，这种疏忽无疑是悲剧性的，尤其令人难以接受的是，研究早已证实了压力与自身免疫之间的联系，并让我们了解了许多潜在的生理途径。

The large and overlapping set of medical conditions called rheumatic diseases include rheumatoid arthritis, scleroderma, ankylosing spondylitis and systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE). In these disorders, and in many others, a disturbed immune system reacts against the body’s own tissues, particularly against connective tissues like cartilage, tendon sheaths, the lining of joints and the walls of blood vessels. These illnesses are characterized by various patterns of inflammation that strikes the joints of the limbs or the spine; or surface tissues like skin or the lining of the eyes; or internal organs such as the heart or the lungs or—in the case of SLE—even the brain.

风湿性疾病是一类症状繁多且相互重叠的疾病，包括类风湿性关节炎、硬皮病、强直性脊柱炎和系统性红斑狼疮（SLE）。在这些疾病以及许多其他疾病中，免疫系统紊乱会攻击自身组织，尤其是结缔组织，例如软骨、腱鞘、关节内膜和血管壁。这些疾病的特征是炎症表现为多种形式，炎症可累及四肢或脊柱的关节；或皮肤、眼睑等表面组织；或心脏、肺等内脏器官，甚至在系统性红斑狼疮的情况下，还可能累及大脑。

Characteristic of many persons with rheumatoid diseases is a stoicism carried to an extreme degree, a deeply ingrained reticence about seeking help. People often put up silently with agonizing discomfort, or will not voice their complaints loudly enough to be heard, or will resist the idea of taking symptom-relieving medications.

许多风湿病患者的特点是极度坚忍，他们根深蒂固地不愿寻求帮助。人们常常默默忍受剧烈的不适，或者不敢大声抱怨，或者抗拒服用缓解症状的药物。

Celia, a woman in her thirties, experienced an episode of arteritis, or generalized inflammation of the arteries, another autoimmune process. Her pain was severe. “For two days I was in so much pain that I was throwing up from the amount of Tylenol and Ibuprofen I was ingesting. My girlfriend said, ‘Do you give up yet?’ and she took me to emergency.”

三十多岁的西莉亚患上了动脉炎，也就是全身动脉炎症，这是另一种自身免疫性疾病。她疼痛难忍。“我疼了两天，吃了大量的泰诺和布洛芬，疼得我直呕吐。我女朋友说，‘你放弃了吗？’然后她带我去了急诊。”

“‘Do you give up yet’—what does that mean?” I wonder.

“‘你放弃了吗？’——这句话是什么意思？”我疑惑道。

“I’m stubborn. Whenever I’m sick, I always have this underlying fear that I won’t be believed or that I’ll be seen as a hypochondriac.”

“我很固执。每当我生病时，我总会担心别人不相信我，或者认为我是个疑病症患者。”

“So here you are, not able to move because of agonizing pain, and you’re worried people will think you’re a hypochondriac. Let’s reverse this situation for a moment. Imagine it was a friend, or your husband, or your child who was suffering such pain. Would you not have acted much more quickly?”

“所以，你现在因为剧痛而无法动弹，还担心别人会觉得你是疑病症患者。我们不妨换位思考一下。想象一下，如果遭受这种痛苦的是你的朋友、丈夫或孩子，你会不会反应更快呢？”

“Yes.”

“是的。”

“Why the double standard?”

为什么会有双重标准？

“I don’t know. It goes back a long way, probably. Back to the way I grew up.”

“我不知道。这大概要追溯到很久以前了，从我的成长经历说起。”

The non-complaining stoicism exhibited by rheumatoid patients is a coping style acquired early in life. Celia’s anxieties have always been focused on others. Although she herself was abused as a child, her concern was to protect her mother from a series of abusive partners. She was afraid the family would not have enough money or that the outside world would find out about the family violence.

类风湿病患者表现出的不抱怨的坚忍是一种早年习得的应对方式。西莉亚的焦虑总是集中在他人身上。尽管她自己童年时期也遭受过虐待，但她最关心的却是保护母亲免受一系列虐待伴侣的伤害。她害怕家里会入不敷出，也害怕家庭暴力会被外界知晓。

“Mostly I was very worried about my brother becoming a juvenile delinquent or horrible things happening to him.”

“我最担心的是我弟弟会成为少年犯，或者发生什么可怕的事情。”

“What about you?”

“你呢？”

“I always felt I somehow could manage it and get through it. I don’t want to accept how really upsetting things are. I rationalize it to a point where I can accept it and deal with it. I minimize.”

“我一直觉得我能应付过去，挺过去。我不想承认事情有多么令人沮丧。我试图用理性分析，让自己能够接受并应对。我尽量淡化问题。”

An intensive medical-psychiatric study of people with rheumatoid arthritis conducted for the Maryland Chapter of the Arthritis and Rheumatism Foundation in 1969 concluded that “despite the diversity in the group, the patients’ psychological characteristics, vulnerabilities and life conflicts were remarkably similar.” 2 One common characteristic was a pseudo-independence, described by the authors as a compensating hyperindependence . Celia’s rigid belief that she could get through everything by herself was a coping mechanism, a compensation for emotional needs ignored in childhood. A child in her situation survives by pretending to herself, and to the world, that she has no needs she cannot take care of herself. One aspect of that pretence is to reduce the perception of emotional stresses to a child-friendly size, a habit that may then last for a lifetime.

1969年，马里兰州关节炎和风湿病基金会分会开展了一项针对类风湿性关节炎患者的深入医学精神病学研究，该研究得出结论：“尽管患者群体存在差异，但他们的心理特征、脆弱性和生活冲突却惊人地相似。” 2 其中一个共同特征是伪独立，作者将其描述为一种补偿性的过度独立。西莉亚坚信自己可以独自应对一切，这是一种应对机制，是对童年时期被忽视的情感需求的一种补偿。像她这样的孩子，通过向自己和世界假装自己没有任何无法照顾的需求来生存。这种假装的一个方面是将情感压力的感知降低到适合孩子的程度，而这种习惯可能会伴随终生。

Compensating hyperindependence originating in early role reversal between parent and child also explains Celia’s teeth-gritting endurance of physical pain, to the point that a friend had to drag her to the emergency ward with “Do you give up yet?”

父母与孩子之间早期角色互换所导致的补偿性过度独立，也解释了西莉亚对身体疼痛的咬牙忍耐，以至于朋友不得不把她拖到急诊室，并问她：“你放弃了吗？”

In 1969 the British psychiatric researcher John Bowlby published Attachment , the first volume of his classic trilogy exploring the influence of parent-child relationships on personality development. “The reversal of roles between child, or adolescent, and parent, unless very temporary, is almost always not only a sign of pathology in the parent,” he wrote, “but a cause of it in the child.” 3 Role reversal with a parent skews the child’s relationship with the whole world. It is a potent source of later psychological and physical illness because it predisposes to stress.

1969年，英国精神病学研究员约翰·鲍尔比出版了《依恋》，这是他探讨亲子关系对人格发展影响的经典三部曲的第一卷。他写道：“除非是暂时的，否则儿童或青少年与父母角色互换几乎总是不仅是父母自身存在病态的标志，也是儿童自身存在病态的原因。”角色互换会扭曲儿童与整个世界的关系。它极易导致日后出现心理和生理疾病，因为它会使人更容易受到压力的影响。

Other traits identified in the psychological investigations of people with rheumatoid disease include perfectionism, a fear of one’s own angry impulses, denial of hostility and strong feelings of inadequacy. As we have seen, similar traits are said to be associated with the “cancer personality” or with personalities at risk for MS, ALS, or any other chronic condition. None of these traits represent innate features of a person, nor are they irremediably fixed in the individual.

对类风湿性关节炎患者的心理调查还发现，其他一些特征包括完美主义、害怕自己的愤怒冲动、否认敌意以及强烈的无力感。正如我们所见，类似的特征也被认为与“癌症人格”或易患多发性硬化症、肌萎缩侧索硬化症或其他慢性疾病的人群有关。这些特征都不是人的先天特质，也不是不可逆转的。

“In the developmental history of these patients a striking finding was the early effective loss of one or both parents,” according to the Maryland study. The reader will have noticed how often in the personal histories related in this book there was early separation of the parents, abandonment or even the death of a mother or father. Even more universal is emotional deprivation , another commonly repeated theme in the research literature. A 1967 Australian study of people with systemic lupus erythematosus reported that: “More patients than controls reported emotional deprivation in childhood associated with a disturbed parent-child relationship within ‘unbroken’ families.” 4

马里兰州的一项研究指出：“在这些患者的成长经历中，一个显著的发现是他们早期失去了一位或两位父母。”读者会注意到，本书中讲述的个人经历中，父母早期分离、遗弃甚至父母一方去世的情况屡见不鲜。情感剥夺更为普遍，这也是研究文献中反复出现的主题。1967年澳大利亚一项针对系统性红斑狼疮患者的研究报告称：“在‘完整’的家庭中，与对照组相比，更多患者报告童年时期遭受情感剥夺，这与亲子关系紊乱有关。”

Like compensatory hyperindependence, the repression of anger is a form of dissociation , a psychological process originating in childhood. The young human being unconsciously banishes from awareness feelings or information that, if consciously experienced, would create unsolvable problems. Bowlby calls this phenomenon “defensive exclusion.” “The information likely to be defensively excluded is of a kind that, when accepted for processing in the past, has led the person concerned to suffer more or less severely.” 5

与补偿性过度独立类似，压抑愤怒也是一种分离形式，一种起源于童年的心理过程。幼小的个体无意识地将某些感受或信息从意识中排除，因为如果这些感受或信息被有意识地体验，就会造成无法解决的问题。鲍尔比将这种现象称为“防御性排除”。“那些可能被防御性排除的信息，如果在过去被接受并进行处理，就会给当事人带来或多或少的痛苦。”

In other words, the angry child got into trouble and experienced rejection. The anger and the rejection had to be deflected inside, against the self, in order to preserve the attachment relationship with the parent. That, in turn, leads to the “strong feelings of inadequacy and a poor self-concept” researchers have recognized in people with rheumatoid disease. “Not infrequently anger is redirected away from an attachment figure who aroused it and aimed instead at the self,” Bowlby explains. “Inappropriate self-criticism results.” 6

换句话说，愤怒的孩子惹了麻烦，遭受了拒绝。为了维系与父母的依恋关系，愤怒和被拒绝的感受不得不转移到自身，指向自己。这反过来又导致了研究人员在类风湿性关节炎患者身上发现的“强烈的无力感和低自尊”。鲍尔比解释说：“愤怒常常会从激起愤怒的依恋对象身上转移开来，转而指向自己。结果就是不恰当的自我批评。”

In autoimmune disease, the body’s defences turn against the self. In the life of a society—the body politic—such behaviour would be denounced as treason. Within the individual organism, physical mutiny results from an immunologic confusion that perfectly mirrors the unconscious psychological confusion of self and non-self. In this disarray of boundaries, the immune cells attack the body as if the latter were a foreign substance, just as the psychic self is attacked by inward-directed reproaches and anger.

在自身免疫性疾病中，身体的防御机制会攻击自身。在社会——即政治共同体——中，这种行为会被视为叛国。在个体有机体内部，生理上的反抗源于免疫混乱，这种混乱完美地反映了无意识中自我与非我的心理混乱。在这种边界混乱的情况下，免疫细胞攻击自身，仿佛自身是外来物质，正如心理自我受到内向的责备和愤怒的攻击一样。

The cross-confusion reflects disruptions of the interconnected body/mind mechanisms within the emotional-nervous-immune-hormonal super-system, which we have called the PNI system.

这种交叉混淆反映了情绪-神经-免疫-激素超级系统（我们称之为 PNI 系统）内相互关联的身心机制的紊乱。

Emotions precisely parallel and complement the other components of the PNI network: like the immune and nervous systems, emotions safeguard the organism from external threat; like the nervous system and the hormones, they assure the satisfaction of indispensable appetites and needs; and, like all these systems together, they help maintain and repair the internal milieu.

情绪与 PNI 网络的其他组成部分精确地平行和互补：像免疫系统和神经系统一样，情绪保护机体免受外部威胁；像神经系统和激素一样，它们确保满足不可或缺的欲望和需求；并且，像所有这些系统一样，它们帮助维持和修复内部环境。

Emotions—fear, anger, love—are as necessary for the organism’s survival as nerve impulses, immune cells or hormonal activity. Early on in the process of evolution, primitive responses of attraction or repulsion became essential to the life and reproduction of living creatures. Emotions, and the physical cells and tissues that make them possible, evolved as part and parcel of the apparatus of survival. It is no wonder, then, that the basic molecules that connect all the body systems of homeostasis and defence also participate in emotional reactions. Messenger substances, including endorphins, may be found in the most primitive of creatures who lack even a rudimentary nervous system. It is not that the organs of emotion interact with the PNI system—they form an essential part of this system.

恐惧、愤怒、爱等情绪，对于生物体的生存而言，与神经冲动、免疫细胞或激素活动一样必不可少。在进化的早期阶段，原始的吸引或排斥反应就成为生物体生存和繁衍的必需条件。情绪，以及构成情绪的细胞和组织，都作为生存机制不可分割的一部分而进化而来。因此，连接所有体内平衡和防御系统的基本分子也参与情绪反应也就不足为奇了。包括内啡肽在内的信使物质，甚至存在于缺乏基本神经系统的最原始生物体内。情绪器官并非与神经系统相互作用——它们本身就是神经系统的重要组成部分。

In chapter 7 we noted that cytokines, messenger molecules produced by immune cells, can bind to receptors on brain cells to cause changes in body states, mood and behaviour. That emotions induce changes in immune activity is only the other side of the same coin. To illustrate the parallel and complementary protective duties of the emotional system and the immune apparatus, we can compare the role of immune cells with that of an emotion such as, say, anger.

在第七章中我们提到，细胞因子（免疫细胞产生的信使分子）可以与脑细胞上的受体结合，从而引起身体状态、情绪和行为的改变。情绪会引发免疫活动的变化，这只是同一枚硬币的另一面。为了说明情绪系统和免疫系统在保护功能上的平行和互补作用，我们可以将免疫细胞的作用与某种情绪（例如愤怒）的作用进行比较。

Why do we have anger? In the animal world, anger is not a “negative emotion.” An animal experiences anger when some essential need is either threatened or frustrated. Although animals lack conscious knowledge of emotional phenomena, they do feel emotion and experience the physiological changes of Emotion I. And, of course, they manifest the behavioural displays classified as Emotion II. The specific purpose of Emotion I biological changes is to prepare the creature for fight or flight responses. But since flight or fight both demand great expenditures of energy and impose risks of injury or death, the Emotion II displays serve a crucial intermediary function: they often settle the conflict without any of the participants having to get hurt.

我们为什么会愤怒？在动物世界里，愤怒并非一种“负面情绪”。当动物的某些基本需求受到威胁或挫败时，它们就会产生愤怒。尽管动物缺乏对情绪现象的意识认知，但它们确实能感受到情绪，并经历第一类情绪的生理变化。当然，它们也会表现出第二类情绪的行为。第一类情绪的生理变化旨在使动物做好战斗或逃跑的准备。但由于战斗或逃跑都需要消耗大量能量，并可能造成伤害甚至死亡，第二类情绪的行为就发挥了至关重要的中间作用：它们通常能够化解冲突，避免任何一方受到伤害。

A cornered animal turns to face his pursuer with a fierce display of rage. Anger may save his life, either by intimidating the hunter or by enabling the prey to resist successfully. Or anger is aroused in an animal when a stranger of the same species, from outside the family or pack or troop, intrudes on his territory. If the two creatures immediately engaged in physical battle over the disputed territory, one or both would likely become injured. Nature provides a resolution by prompting both of them to mount anger displays: teeth bared, menacing bodily motions, threatening sounds. The more convincing display often wins the day, avoiding harm to either contestant.

被逼到角落的动物会转身面对追捕者，展现出凶猛的愤怒。愤怒或许能救它一命，既能震慑猎人，也能帮助猎物成功抵抗。当同种的陌生个体，无论是来自家族、群体还是兽群之外，闯入领地时，动物也会被激起愤怒。如果这两个生物立即为了争夺领地而发生肢体冲突，很可能一方或双方都会受伤。大自然提供了一种解决办法，促使它们都做出愤怒的展示：龇牙咧嘴、做出威胁性的肢体动作、发出恐吓的叫声。更具说服力的展示往往能赢得胜利，避免双方受到伤害。

For anger to be deployed appropriately, the organism has to distinguish between threat and non-threat. The fundamental differentiation to be made is between self and non-self. If I don’t know where my own boundaries begin and end, I cannot know when something potentially dangerous is intruding on them. The necessary distinctions between what is familiar or foreign, and what is benign or potentially harmful, require an accurate appraisal of self and non-self. Anger represents both a recognition of the foreign and dangerous and a response to it.

要恰当地运用愤怒，个体必须区分威胁与非威胁。最根本的区分在于自我与非我。如果我不知道自身的边界在哪里，我就无法察觉潜在的危险何时侵入其中。区分熟悉与陌生、良性与潜在有害，需要对自我与非我进行准确的评估。愤怒既是对陌生和危险的认知，也是对它们的回应。

The first essential task of the immune system, too, is distinguishing self from non-self. Thus immunity also begins with recognition . Recognition is a sensory function, performed in the nervous system by the sensory organs. We may rightly say that the immune system is also a sensory organ. Any failure of the immune system in its responsibility of recognition would expose us to as much danger as we would face if our capacities to see, hear, feel or taste were impaired. Another function of the nervous system is memory. The immune system must also have memory: it needs to recall what in the external world is benign and nourishing, what is neutral and what is potentially toxic.

免疫系统的首要任务也是区分自身与非自身。因此，免疫也始于识别。识别是一种感觉功能，由神经系统中的感觉器官执行。我们可以说，免疫系统本身也是一个感觉器官。如果免疫系统在识别方面出现任何缺陷，我们所面临的危险程度将与视觉、听觉、触觉或味觉受损时所面临的危险程度不相上下。神经系统的另一项功能是记忆。免疫系统也必须具备记忆能力：它需要记住外部世界中哪些物质是良性的、有益的，哪些是中性的，哪些是潜在的有害物质。

Under the watchful eyes of the parent, the infant and toddler explore the environment, learning what is edible and what is not, what is comfortable or a source of pain, what is hazardous or safe. The acquired information is stored in the developing brain’s memory banks. Immunity is also a matter of learning. Memory is stored by the immune system in cells programmed to recall instantaneously any threat previously encountered. And just as the nervous system must retain its potential for learning throughout the lifetime, so the immune system has the capacity to develop new “memories” by forming clones of immune cells trained specifically to recognize any new threat.

在父母的悉心照料下，婴幼儿探索周围环境，学习哪些东西可以吃，哪些不能吃；哪些感觉舒适，哪些会带来疼痛；哪些危险，哪些安全。这些习得的信息会被储存在正在发育的大脑记忆库中。免疫力也是一个学习的过程。免疫系统将记忆储存在特定细胞中，这些细胞经过编程，能够立即回忆起之前遇到的任何威胁。正如神经系统必须终生保持学习能力一样，免疫系统也能够通过形成专门训练的免疫细胞克隆来发展新的“记忆”，这些克隆能够识别任何新的威胁。

With immune cells found in the bloodstream and in all tissues and spaces of the body, we may think of the immune system as a “floating brain” equipped to detect the non-self. The sensory apparatus—the eyes and ears and taste buds—serving this “floating brain” are receptors on the surfaces of immune cells, configured to know benign from noxious. The self is identified by means of so-called self-antigens on the membranes of the body’s normal cells, molecules that the immune receptors infallibly recognize. Self-antigens are proteins found on every cell type. Foreign organisms and substances lack such self-markers, making them targets for attack by the immune system. The diversity of self-antigens is just beginning to be discovered. “Chances are that a lot more self-markers will pop up in the future,” according to an article in the journal Science. 7

免疫细胞遍布血液以及人体所有组织和体腔，我们可以将免疫系统想象成一个“漂浮的大脑”，它能够识别非自身物质。为这个“漂浮的大脑”提供服务的感官器官——眼睛、耳朵和味蕾——是免疫细胞表面的受体，它们能够区分良性和有害物质。自身则通过人体正常细胞膜上的所谓自身抗原来识别，这些分子能够被免疫受体准确识别。自身抗原是存在于所有细胞类型上的蛋白质。外来生物体和物质缺乏这种自身标记，因此成为免疫系统的攻击目标。自身抗原的多样性才刚刚开始被发现。《科学》杂志上的一篇文章指出：“未来很可能会发现更多类型的自身标记。”

The lymphocytes whose job it is to “remember” foreign antigens are the T-cells that reach maturity in the thymus gland. There are up to a million million of them in human beings. They and their fellow immune corpuscles “must learn to tolerate every tissue, every cell, every protein in the body. They must be able to distinguish the hemoglobin found in blood from the insulin secreted by the pancreas from the vitreous humor contained in the eye from everything else. They must manage to repel innumerable different kinds of invading organisms and yet not attack the body.” 8

负责“记住”外来抗原的淋巴细胞是T细胞，它们在胸腺中成熟。人体内T细胞的数量可达百万之多。它们及其免疫细胞同伴“必须学会耐受体内每一种组织、每一种细胞、每一种蛋白质。它们必须能够区分血液中的血红蛋白、胰腺分泌的胰岛素、眼球中的玻璃体液以及其他所有物质。它们必须能够抵御无数种入侵的微生物，同时又不攻击自身。”

It is beyond the scope of this book to discuss the mechanisms by which the various immune cells recognize hostile micro-organisms or other noxious substances and how squadrons of immune cells become programmed to eliminate such invaders. Much has yet to be discovered, and what is already understood involves an extraordinarily complicated sequence of biochemical events, interactions and effects. The point to grasp here is the shared functions of immunity and emotion: first, the “awareness” of self accompanied by an awareness of non-self; second, the appreciation of nourishing inputs and the recognition of threats; finally, the acceptance of life-enhancing influences paralleled by a capacity to limit or eliminate danger.

本书篇幅有限，无法详述各种免疫细胞识别有害微生物或其他有害物质的机制，以及免疫细胞群如何被编程以清除这些入侵者。许多奥秘尚待发掘，而我们目前所了解的也涉及极其复杂的一系列生化事件、相互作用和效应。本书旨在阐明免疫和情感的共同功能：首先，它们都包含对自我的“觉察”以及对非我的觉察；其次，它们都包含对有益物质的感知和对威胁的识别；最后，它们都包含对有益因素的接纳以及限制或消除危险的能力。

When our psychological capacity to distinguish the self from non-self is disabled, the impairment is bound to extend to our physiology as well. Repressed anger will lead to disordered immunity. The inability to process and express feelings effectively, and the tendency to serve the needs of others before even considering one’s own, are common patterns in people who develop chronic illness. These coping styles represent a blurring of boundaries, a confusion of self and non-self on the psychological level. The same confusion will follow on the level of cells, tissues and body organs. The immune system becomes too confused to know self from other or too disabled to defend against danger.

当我们区分自我与非我的心理能力受损时，这种损伤必然也会延伸到我们的生理层面。压抑的愤怒会导致免疫功能紊乱。无法有效处理和表达情感，以及在考虑自身需求之前就倾向于满足他人需求，是慢性病患者常见的模式。这些应对方式代表着心理层面的界限模糊，自我与非我的混淆。同样的混淆也会蔓延到细胞、组织和器官层面。免疫系统会变得过于混乱，无法区分自我与他人，或者过于虚弱，无法抵御危险。

Ordinarily, immune cells that react against a self-product are immediately killed or inactivated. If immune cells that turn against the self are not destroyed or made harmless, they will attack the body tissues they were meant to guard. Allergic reactions or autoimmune diseases may result. Alternatively, if healthy immune cells are destroyed by radiation, drugs or, say, the HIV virus, the body is left without protection against infections or against the unchecked growth of tumours. Disabling the immune system through chronic emotional stress may have the same effect.

通常情况下，攻击自身产物的免疫细胞会被立即杀死或灭活。如果攻击自身的免疫细胞没有被清除或灭活，它们就会攻击原本应该保护的身体组织，从而导致过敏反应或自身免疫性疾病。另一方面，如果健康的免疫细胞被辐射、药物或例如艾滋病毒破坏，身体就会失去对感染或肿瘤不受控制生长的保护。长期情绪压力导致的免疫系统功能受损也可能产生同样的效果。

The relationship between self-suppression and immune mutiny was illustrated in a 1965 study of the healthy relatives of women suffering from rheumatoid arthritis. Antibodies are normally produced only in response to invasion by microbes or potentially harmful foreign molecules. One of the laboratory hallmarks of rheumatoid arthritis is the finding of an antibody directed against the self by the confused immune system. It is called rheumatoid factor, or RF. Found in over 70 per cent of patients with rheumatoid arthritis, RF may also be present in people without the condition. The purpose of this particular research was to find out whether certain personality characteristics were associated with the presence of the antibody, even in the absence of disease.

1965 年一项针对类风湿性关节炎女性患者健康亲属的研究阐明了自身抑制与免疫叛变之间的关系。抗体通常只在微生物或潜在有害的外来分子入侵时才会产生。类风湿性关节炎的实验室特征之一是检测到一种由紊乱的免疫系统产生的针对自身的抗体，称为类风湿因子（RF）。超过 70% 的类风湿性关节炎患者体内可检测到 RF，但 RF 也可能存在于非患病人群中。这项研究的目的是探究某些人格特征是否与 RF 的存在相关，即使在没有患病的情况下也是如此。

Included in the study were thirty-six female adults or adolescents, none of whom had rheumatic disease. Among the subjects, fourteen had the RF antibody. Compared with the women without the antibody, the RF-positive group scored significantly higher on psychological scales reflecting the inhibition of anger and concern about the social acceptability of behaviours. They also scored higher on a scale that indicated traits such as “compliance, shyness, conscientiousness, religiosity and moralism.”

该研究纳入了36名成年或青少年女性，她们均无风湿性疾病。其中14名受试者体内存在类风湿因子（RF）抗体。与未检测到抗体的女性相比，RF阳性组在反映愤怒抑制和对行为社会可接受性关注的心理量表上的得分显著更高。她们在反映“顺从、害羞、尽责、宗教信仰和道德主义”等特质的量表上的得分也更高。

The presence of the antibody in these subjects suggests that emotional repression had already initiated immune reactivity against the self, although not to the point of clinical disease. One might expect that should additional stressful events occur in the lives of these women, they could further incite the immune mutiny, activate inflammation and trigger frank disease. “Emotional disturbances in conjunction with rheumatoid factor may lead to rheumatoid disease,” the researchers concluded. 9 It is also possible to develop rheumatoid arthritis without the anti-self antibody RF. As we would expect, in those cases the degree of stress may even have to be greater—precisely as found in another study. 10

这些受试者体内抗体的存在表明，情绪压抑已经引发了针对自身的免疫反应，尽管尚未发展到临床疾病的程度。可以预见，如果这些女性的生活中发生其他压力事件，可能会进一步诱发免疫叛变，激活炎症并引发明显的疾病。“情绪紊乱与类风湿因子共同作用可能导致类风湿病，”研究人员总结道。 9 即使没有抗自身抗体类风湿因子，也可能发生类风湿性关节炎。正如我们所预期的，在这些情况下，压力程度可能需要更大——正如另一项研究发现的那样。 10

A 1987 review of the literature concluded that “the weight of evidence from a variety of studies strongly suggests a role for psychologic stress in inducing, exacerbating, and effecting the ultimate outcome in rheumatoid arthritis.” 11

1987 年的一项文献综述得出结论：“来自各种研究的证据有力地表明，心理压力在诱发、加剧类风湿性关节炎以及影响其最终结局方面发挥着作用。”

Just how specific the effect of stress can be in provoking autoimmune disease is illustrated by the experience of Rachel, a young Jewish woman. Her first episode of rheumatoid arthritis occurred in response to an event that was a re-enactment of childhood emotional trauma.

压力对自身免疫性疾病的诱发作用究竟有多么具体，年轻的犹太女性瑞秋的经历便是一个很好的例证。她的第一次类风湿性关节炎发作，正是由一次童年时期情感创伤的重现事件引发的。

Rachel had grown up in conflict with her older brother, whom she always perceived to be the favoured sibling. The parents separated, and she felt especially rejected by her father. “I was always the second-class citizen,” she says. “It was my brother that he wanted. I still remember walking halfway down the block by myself behind them, my father with his arm around my brother. I remember always having to go into the back seat. I was told by my mother quite a few years ago that I went to Chicago to visit my dad with my brother only because she said, ‘You take both kids or you don’t take either.’ I was never wanted there.”

瑞秋从小就和哥哥关系紧张，她一直觉得哥哥是父母更偏爱的孩子。父母离异后，她尤其感到被父亲冷落。“我一直都是二等公民，”她说，“他想要的是我的哥哥。我还记得自己一个人跟在他们身后，走半个街区，父亲搂着哥哥。我还记得自己总是被迫坐在后座。几年前，母亲告诉我，我和哥哥一起去芝加哥看望父亲，只是因为她说：‘要么两个孩子都带走，要么一个都别带。’我从来都不受欢迎。”

As a child Rachel says she was another “good little girl who never caused any problems,” a coping style she continued into adulthood. Two years ago on Rosh Hashanah, the Jewish New Year celebration, she was at her mother’s home, preparing dinner for the family. She was in a hurry, since she was to leave in time to avoid meeting her brother, who had decided to join the family at the last moment. “He didn’t want to come with me there, so we’d made an agreement that I would go early to my mother’s house and help her cook. At 4:00 p.m. I would leave so he and my sister-in-law and niece could spend the rest of Rosh Hashanah with my mother.”

瑞秋说，她小时候也是个“乖乖女，从不惹麻烦”，这种处事方式她一直延续到成年。两年前的犹太新年（Rosh Hashanah）那天，她在母亲家准备晚餐。她很着急，因为她得赶在最后时刻和弟弟见面之前离开。弟弟临时决定来参加新年庆祝活动。“他不想跟我一起去，所以我们商量好，我早点去母亲家帮她做饭。下午四点我就走，这样他、我的嫂子和侄女就可以和母亲一起过完剩下的新年了。”

“Am I getting this right?” I interjected. “What you’re saying is that you would go there and cook and do all the work and then you’d leave so others can have a nice ceremony and a meal together? Why did you accept that arrangement?”

“我理解得对吗？”我插话道，“你的意思是，你会去那里做饭，做完所有的事情，然后离开，这样其他人就可以一起举行一个美好的仪式，享用一顿美餐？你为什么接受这样的安排？”

“Because it was Rosh Hashanah and I feel family should be together.”

“因为那天是犹太新年，我觉得家人应该团聚。”

“What happened?”

“发生了什么？”

“When I was at my mother’s house, my body went into pain that you wouldn’t believe. I was taken to the hospital. The arthritis was in one of my legs, and I couldn’t use it at all. I don’t usually scream in pain. The whole emergency room heard me, I’m sure. The very next day, I was back at the hospital because it was throughout my whole body. I could not move. Even being wheeled in a wheelchair, I was screaming my head off.”

“我在母亲家的时候，突然浑身剧痛，那种疼痛简直难以想象。我被送进了医院。我的一条腿关节炎发作，完全动不了。我平时很少因为疼痛而尖叫。我敢肯定，整个急诊室的人都听到了我的叫声。第二天，我又回到了医院，因为疼痛蔓延到了全身。我动弹不得。即使被推着轮椅，我也一直在撕心裂肺地尖叫。”

Not only are the onset and flare-ups of rheumatic diseases related to stress but so is their severity. In a study initiated in 1967, fifty young adults newly diagnosed with rheumatoid arthritis were followed over a period of five years. Psychosocial stress factors preceding the onset of the disease were assessed at the beginning. All the patients were examined twice yearly and had annual X-rays of the wrists and hands, the commonest locations of disease activity. At study’s end, the subjects were classified according to the degree of tissue damage: in category 1, no swelling on physical examination or X-ray evidence of bone destruction, called erosions; in category 2, soft tissue swelling but no bone erosions; in category 3, bone erosions in the wrists and hands. The results were published in The American Journal of Medicine . The researchers observed that the patients who would eventually place in category 3 were, on entering the study, “judged by the interviewers to have a significantly higher frequency of psychosocial stress factors associated with the onset of disease” than those who finished in the other categories. 12

风湿性疾病的发生和复发不仅与压力有关，其严重程度也与压力密切相关。一项始于1967年的研究对50名新确诊为类风湿性关节炎的年轻人进行了为期五年的随访。研究开始时评估了疾病发作前的社会心理压力因素。所有患者每年接受两次体检，并每年进行腕部和手部（疾病活动最常见的部位）的X光检查。研究结束时，根据组织损伤程度对受试者进行分类：1级，体格检查无肿胀，X光片也未显示骨破坏（称为骨侵蚀）；2级，软组织肿胀但无骨侵蚀；3级，腕部和手部均出现骨侵蚀。研究结果发表于《美国医学杂志》。研究人员观察到，最终被归入第 3 类的患者，在入组时“经访谈者判断，其与疾病发作相关的社会心理压力因素的发生频率显著高于其他类别的患者”。

Most of the interviews I conducted in preparing this book took place in people’s homes. Gila, a fifty-one-year-old woman with rheumatoid arthritis, insisted on meeting at the neighbourhood McDonald’s outlet. She could serve as the prototype of the “self-sacrificing, conforming, self-conscious, shy, inhibited, perfectionistic” rheumatoid patient described in the psychological literature.

我在撰写本书过程中进行的大部分访谈都是在受访者家中进行的。吉拉是一位患有类风湿性关节炎的51岁女性，她坚持要在附近的麦当劳餐厅见面。她可以作为心理学文献中描述的“自我牺牲、顺从、缺乏自信、害羞、内向、完美主义”的类风湿性关节炎患者的典型代表。

Gila was diagnosed in 1976, during an episode of polymyositis, or generalized muscle inflammation. By the time she sought medical attention, she had lost much of her muscle bulk in her shoulders and hips. Her muscles of respiration were so weakened that she was breathing in a shallow way. She couldn’t lift her arms or legs or swallow anything dry. When the specialist saw her, she was hospitalized immediately for a course of intravenous corticosteroid medication. “He said I was a walking corpse. I should not even have been walking around. On my lung-function tests, when I was blowing into the machine, the needle would not move. Not even the slightest movement. But I compensated. You know … I didn’t realize. When I was walking, I didn’t notice that I was swinging, instead of lifting, my leg.”

吉拉在1976年被确诊患有多发性肌炎，也就是全身肌肉炎症。在她就医时，她的肩膀和臀部肌肉已经严重萎缩。她的呼吸肌也极度虚弱，呼吸非常浅。她无法抬起胳膊或腿，也无法吞咽任何干燥的食物。专科医生接诊后，立即将她送入医院接受静脉注射皮质类固醇治疗。“他说我像个行尸走肉，根本不应该到处走动。做肺功能测试时，我对着机器吹气，针头纹丝不动，一动不动。但我还是做了代偿。你知道……我当时并没有意识到。走路的时候，我没有注意到自己是在摆动腿，而不是抬起腿。”

“Why, do you suppose, you didn’t notice?”

“你觉得你为什么没注意到呢？”

“I was busy, I guess. I was tired. Because I had two kids, small kids, and I was running around.”

“我当时很忙，也很累。因为我有两个孩子，都是小孩子，我整天忙个不停。”

“I’m curious why you wanted to meet me at McDonald’s.”

“我很好奇你为什么想在麦当劳和我见面。”

“At home I’m always self-conscious about how my house looks. It has to be clean and tidy. If somebody comes to my house and notices that there is dust here or there, then …”

“在家我总是很在意家里的整洁程度。家里必须干净整洁。如果有人来我家，发现这里那里有灰尘，那……”

“You’re not talking about tidiness, you’re talking about perfection. You can’t get away from dust, can you? Dust is part of life. And if you can’t accept that, everything has to be perfect. Are you that way with everything?”

“你说的不是整洁，而是完美。灰尘是无法避免的，对吧？灰尘是生活的一部分。如果你无法接受这一点，那就意味着一切都必须完美。你对所有事情都这样吗？”

“Yeah. Before I had the rheumatoid arthritis actually, I was even more … My aunts called me a superwoman. My husband used to go out of town. He had to work in a sawmill for his apprenticeship. I was by myself here with two kids. I worked, and I worked overtime because we just bought a house. Sometimes I worked seven days a week, ten hours a day.”

“是啊。其实在我得类风湿性关节炎之前，我更……我姑姑们都叫我女超人。我丈夫以前经常出差，因为他要去锯木厂当学徒。我一个人带着两个孩子。我工作，而且经常加班，因为我们刚买了房子。有时候我一周工作七天，每天工作十个小时。”

“What did you do?”

你做了什么？

“I used to work for the post office. I enjoyed the work, though.”

“我以前在邮局工作。我很喜欢那份工作。”

“You liked working ten hours a day, seven days a week?”

“你喜欢每天工作十小时，每周工作七天吗？”

“Going to work is almost like going on holiday. I enjoyed the people there. I was friends with the supervisor; nobody gave me a hard time. Although everybody seems to be bored about post-office work around me, I just can’t understand why they are bored and complaining. I’m having a good time. So I think that was one of the reasons, too, that I had rheumatoid at first. I think I was abusing myself. I didn’t have enough rest. Not enough sleep.”

“上班就像度假一样。我很喜欢那里的人。我和主管是朋友；没有人为难我。虽然周围的人似乎都对邮局的工作感到厌倦，但我就是不明白他们为什么会觉得无聊和抱怨。我过得很开心。所以我想，这也是我最初患上类风湿性关节炎的原因之一。我想我当时太苛待自己了。我休息不足，睡眠也不够。”

In addition to her job and her housework, Gila also felt she needed to maintain an immaculate garden and backyard. Her home was located between the houses of two retired couples who kept their yards to perfection, and she was concerned that if she neglected her garden their house values would go down. “Yes, impeccable. They would mow every week. So I have to do my lawn every week to keep up.” She also was keen for her children to be exposed to opportunities she herself had missed. On weekends she drove them to piano lessons, singing lessons, ballet lessons, folk dancing, sports events.

除了工作和家务，吉拉还觉得自己必须把花园和后院打理得井井有条。她家夹在两对退休夫妇的房子中间，这两对夫妇把自家的院子都维护得完美无瑕，吉拉担心如果自己疏于照料花园，会影响到他们房子的价值。“没错，他们家的院子一尘不染。他们每周都修剪草坪。所以我也得每周都打理草坪，才能跟上他们的步伐。”她还渴望孩子们能有机会体验她自己错过的精彩人生。周末，她会开车送孩子们去上钢琴课、声乐课、芭蕾舞课、民间舞蹈课，还会参加各种体育活动。

Gila did all this without any assistance from her husband and, all the while, worked at the post office on the afternoon shift, from 4:30 p.m. until 1:00 a.m. She slept about four hours a night for years. “When I had my rheumatoid arthritis, my physiotherapist told me, ‘When you have the pain, you have to stop. You have to rest, because that means your body is telling you that you need to stop.’ And so I do that. But the thing is, my housework is not done the way it used to be. Before, I would vacuum every other day, or even twice a day. Now, my husband is the one doing the vacuuming because I can’t do it any more. And I’m not happy with the way he vacuums. So sometimes I do it after him, although I don’t let him know that. I’m just doing the finishing. My house is not clean or neat and tidy the way it used to be.”

吉拉独自一人完成了这一切，没有得到丈夫的任何帮助。与此同时，她还在邮局上下午班，从下午4点半到凌晨1点。多年来，她每晚只能睡大约四个小时。“我患上类风湿性关节炎时，我的理疗师告诉我：‘疼痛的时候，你必须停下来休息，因为这意味着你的身体在告诉你需要休息。’所以我照做了。但问题是，我的家务活再也做不了了。以前，我隔一天吸尘一次，甚至一天两次。现在，因为我做不了了，所以都是我丈夫在吸尘。我对他的吸尘方式不满意。所以有时候，我会在他吸完之后再吸一遍，虽然我不会让他知道。我只是做最后的收尾工作。我的房子不像以前那样干净整洁了。”

Gila was brought up in the Philippines, amid circumstances the reader by now will have guessed. She was the eldest of eight children and the caregiver to all. Her parents criticized her mercilessly. When anything went wrong, she was spanked.

吉拉在菲律宾长大，读者想必已经猜到了她的成长环境。她是八个孩子中的老大，也是所有孩子的照顾者。她的父母对她毫不留情地批评。一旦她做错了什么事，就会挨打。

“I had asthma. And every time I got a spanking, the asthma came. And every time I got the asthma, my mom would say, ‘Oh, that’s God’s punishment because you were bad. Because you didn’t do your job, because you answered back.’ So then I tried to do everything. I was not purposefully being bad. I was doing my best, and I was still being punished when I forgot. And sometimes I just couldn’t do it the way she wanted it. She is also a perfectionist.”

“我有哮喘。每次挨打之后，哮喘就会发作。每次哮喘发作，我妈就会说，‘哦，这是上帝的惩罚，因为你做错了事。因为你没做好功课，因为你顶嘴了。’所以，我努力把所有事情都做好。我不是故意做错事的。我尽力了，但即使我忘了，还是会被惩罚。有时候，我就是做不到她想要的那样。她也是个完美主义者。”

Gila’s husband beat her in the early years of their marriage. Later the abuse lapsed into emotional indifference, but he continues to be morbidly jealous and controlling.

吉拉的丈夫在他们婚姻的最初几年里经常殴打她。后来，虐待行为逐渐演变为情感上的冷漠，但他仍然极度嫉妒，并且控制欲极强。

Although some physiotherapists brought up stress issues in their work with Gila, none of the physicians who have treated her for rheumatoid arthritis ever inquired about her personal or emotional life. The wisdom of Sir William Osler has been lost in that vast Bermuda Triangle of modern medical practice.

尽管一些理疗师在治疗吉拉的过程中提到了压力问题，但没有一位治疗她类风湿性关节炎的医生询问过她的个人生活或情感状况。威廉·奥斯勒爵士的智慧似乎已经湮没在现代医学实践这片广袤的“百慕大三角”之中。

After she developed her illness, Gila realized she needed to do some psychological work. She understood that her disease, unwelcome as it was, was perhaps trying to teach her something. The medical system was unable to help. At her own request, Gila was referred to a psychiatrist. “He told me that I should not be so upset, that I should treat my husband like he was my oldest son. I didn’t go back. I didn’t want a third son. I wanted a husband.”

吉拉患病后，意识到自己需要进行一些心理治疗。她明白，尽管疾病令人不快，但或许是在试图教会她一些东西。医疗系统对此束手无策。吉拉主动要求去看精神科医生。“他告诉我，我不应该这么难过，应该像对待大儿子一样对待我的丈夫。我没有再回去。我不想再要个儿子。我想要的是一个丈夫。”

In women with rheumatoid arthritis, the immune system has shown increased disturbance during periods of stress, but those who enjoyed better marriage relationships were spared exacerbations of disease activity like inflammation and pain. 13 Another study found that increases in relationship stresses were associated with increases in joint inflammation. 14

在患有类风湿性关节炎的女性中，压力时期免疫系统紊乱加剧，但婚姻关系良好的女性则避免了炎症和疼痛等疾病活动加剧的情况。 13 另一项研究发现，婚姻关系压力增加与关节炎症加剧相关。 14

Results like these are not surprising. Recall that stress is a response to a perception of threat. Laboratory studies have demonstrated that many organs and tissues of the body become more vulnerable to inflammation and harm during or after periods perceived as threatening. 15 Stimuli interpreted as potentially dangerous can instantaneously induce dilation of blood vessels, swelling, bleeding, increased susceptibility to tissue damage and a lowered pain threshold. Such changes can be initiated rapidly in subjects simply by interview techniques that augment the perception of threat.

这样的结果并不令人意外。要知道，压力是对感知到的威胁的一种反应。实验室研究表明，在感知到威胁的时期或之后，人体的许多器官和组织更容易受到炎症和损伤。 15 被解读为潜在危险的刺激可以立即诱发血管扩张、肿胀、出血、组织损伤敏感性增加以及疼痛阈值降低。仅仅通过增强受试者威胁感知的访谈技巧，就可以迅速引发这些变化。

There are several potential pathways by which overwhelming psychological pressures could become manifested as inflammation in joints, connective tissues and body organs. One of the teachings of the influential second-century Roman physican Galen was that any part of the body can affect any other part through neural connections. The rapid body changes in response to stress are, no doubt, effected through the instantaneous activity of the nervous system. Discharges originating in the brain can stimulate faraway nerve endings to release powerful pro-inflammatory molecules capable of inducing joint damage through hyperactivity of the immune cells. Some nerve-derived chemicals are also potent irritating agents for inducing pain. In autoimmune diseases, elevated levels of some of these substances are found in the fluid of inflamed joints as well as in the circulation. Such a dramatically quick mechanism was likely responsible for the acute onset of Rachel’s arthritic symptoms as she was labouring over the Rosh Hashanah supper she was not to attend. The severity of symptoms during that first attack indicated the severity of her repressed emotional reaction to the situation with her brother.

巨大的心理压力可能通过多种途径表现为关节、结缔组织和器官的炎症。二世纪罗马著名医生盖伦的理论之一是，身体的任何部位都可以通过神经连接影响其他部位。毫无疑问，身体对压力的快速反应是由神经系统的瞬时活动引起的。源自大脑的放电可以刺激远端的神经末梢释放强效的促炎分子，这些分子能够通过免疫细胞的过度活跃而导致关节损伤。一些神经源性化学物质也是强效的刺激物，能够诱发疼痛。在自身免疫性疾病中，炎症关节液和血液循环中都会发现这些物质的含量升高。这种迅速而剧烈的机制很可能是导致瑞秋在准备她无法参加的犹太新年晚宴时，关节炎症状突然发作的原因。第一次发作时症状的严重程度表明了她对与哥哥之间关系的压抑情绪反应的强烈程度。

The chronic features of autoimmune disease involve the entire PNI super-system, particularly the brain-hormone-immune connections. The hypothesis that stress-induced PNI imbalances are physiologically responsible for the onset and flare-ups of autoimmune conditions rests on abundant research evidence.

自身免疫性疾病的慢性特征涉及整个周围神经系统（PNI），尤其是脑-激素-免疫连接。大量研究证据支持应激诱导的PNI失衡是自身免疫性疾病发生和复发的生理原因这一假设。

Elaboration of the many potential mechanisms by which stress acts through the PNI system to cause autoimmune illness would involve too much scientific detail for our purposes. Suffice it to say that the body’s stress apparatus, and particularly the production of the key stress hormone, cortisol, becomes unbalanced through chronic overstimulation. Recall that normal cortisol secretion by the adrenals regulates the immune system and dampens the inflammatory reactions triggered by the products of immune cells. In rheumatoid arthritis, there are lower than normal cortisol responses to stress: we can see why, then, there would be disordered immune activity and excess inflammation. On the one hand, the immune system escapes from normal control and attacks the body to cause inflammation, and on the other, the required anti-inflammatory responses are weakened and ineffective.

要详细阐述压力通过PNI系统引发自身免疫性疾病的众多潜在机制，需要涉及过多的科学细节，超出了我们讨论的范围。简而言之，长期过度刺激会导致人体的压力机制失衡，尤其是关键压力激素皮质醇的产生。要知道，肾上腺正常分泌的皮质醇能够调节免疫系统，抑制免疫细胞产物引发的炎症反应。在类风湿性关节炎患者中，皮质醇对压力的反应低于正常水平：由此可见，免疫活动紊乱和炎症过度是其原因。一方面，免疫系统失去正常控制，攻击自身组织引发炎症；另一方面，必要的抗炎反应减弱且无效。

It is surely no coincidence that the one medication consistently used in all the autoimmune conditions is the adrenal corticosteroid, cortisol—or, more accurately, its synthetic analogues. Cortisol is the hormone most central to the stress response and the one that studies show to be most disregulated after chronic stress. Autoimmune connective tissue diseases, from SLE and rheumatoid arthritis to scleroderma and ankylosing spondylitis, reflect an exhaustion and disruption of the organism’s normal stress-control mechanisms.

在所有自身免疫性疾病中，唯一被反复使用的药物是肾上腺皮质激素皮质醇——更准确地说是其合成类似物——这绝非巧合。皮质醇是应激反应中最核心的激素，研究表明，慢性应激后其功能失调最为严重。从系统性红斑狼疮（SLE）、类风湿性关节炎到硬皮病和强直性脊柱炎，自身免疫性结缔组织疾病都反映了机体正常应激控制机制的耗竭和紊乱。

Exhaustion is the word that leapt to mind as a former patient of mine with ankylosing spondylitis described his life prior to the onset of his disease, and even after.

当我的一位患有强直性脊柱炎的前患者描述他患病前甚至患病后的生活时，我脑海中立刻浮现出“疲惫”这个词。

Robert is prominent British Columbia labour leader. I interviewed him in his office. A large and affable man in his late forties, Robert speaks with a resonant voice and a hearty humour. When he needs to turn his head to answer the phone or to look at you from a slightly different angle, he swivels his whole trunk. There is virtually no movement in his spine. “Everything’s frozen from my neck to my butt,” he says.

罗伯特是卑诗省一位杰出的工会领袖。我在他的办公室采访了他。罗伯特身材魁梧，和蔼可亲，年近五十，说话声音洪亮，幽默风趣。当他需要转头接电话或从稍稍不同的角度看你时，他会转动整个躯干。他的脊椎几乎纹丝不动。“从脖子到屁股，我的身体都僵硬了，”他说。

When he was twenty-five, Robert began experiencing pain in his heels, followed by twelve years of unremitting pain in the joints of his shoulders and collarbone. He went to doctors a few times but soon gave up. “They keep telling you it is this and that, or it is not this or that. They don’t give you anything for relief. What else are you going to do about it?” He finally saw a rheumatologist, following five years of pain in his hip and legs.

罗伯特25岁时开始脚后跟疼痛，随后12年间，他的肩关节和锁骨关节一直疼痛难忍。他看过几次医生，但很快就放弃了。“他们总是说这是这个病那个病，或者说不是这个病那个病。他们不给我开任何缓解疼痛的药。你还能怎么办呢？”在髋部和腿部疼痛持续5年后，他终于去看了一位风湿病专家。

“I would favour my left leg to the point that I was lying in bed one night and my partner noticed that one leg was smaller than the other—the muscles had shrunk because I didn’t use it. Of course, she went into hysterics and made me go to the doctor.”

“我太依赖左腿了，以至于有一天晚上我躺在床上，我的伴侣发现我的一条腿比另一条短——因为我不用它，肌肉萎缩了。当然，她当时就歇斯底里地大哭，非要我去看医生。”

In the twelve years between the onset of his symptoms and his diagnosis, Robert never missed work. In many respects his story was typical. Every trade union official I’ve ever treated in my practice has been beyond overworked. The demands on their time have been enormous, to say nothing of the inherent stress in the job itself, with the constant conflict and the politics, the long unpredictable hours, meetings, never-ending duties. “Our pension plans in the labour movement are very, very good,” says Robert. “The reason we have very good pension plans is that nobody lives to sixty-five to collect their pensions … or very few! That’s why the pension plan for those of us in the labour movement is so strong. Nobody ever retires.”

从出现症状到确诊的十二年间，罗伯特从未缺勤。在很多方面，他的经历都很典型。我诊治过的每一位工会官员都工作过度。他们肩负着巨大的时间压力，更不用说工作本身带来的压力了，比如持续不断的冲突和政治斗争、漫长而难以预料的工作时间、没完没了的会议和永无止境的任务。“我们工会的养老金计划非常好，”罗伯特说。“之所以养老金计划这么好，是因为几乎没有人能活到六十五岁去领养老金……或者说很少有人能活到六十五岁！这就是为什么我们工会成员的养老金计划如此完善。没有人会退休。”

When his rheumatic disease began, Robert was travelling about 100,000 miles a year by air all over North America. In 1976, which he calls his worst year, he was on the road for a consecutive period of four and a half months. “Never saw home all that time. I was working on a strike in the southern U.S. because I was in an international union that didn’t have anybody with the skills needed. I was in Arkansas and Oklahoma and Georgia, working twelve to fourteen hours a day, six days a week.” He would sleep during “whatever time was left over.”

罗伯特患上风湿病时，每年要乘飞机在北美各地飞行约10万英里。1976年，他称之为自己病情最严重的一年，那一年他连续四个半月都在路上奔波。“那段时间我根本没回家。我在美国南部参与一场罢工，因为我所在的国际工会没有合适的人选。我去了阿肯色州、俄克拉荷马州和佐治亚州，每天工作12到14个小时，每周工作6天。” 他只能利用“剩下的时间”睡觉。

“What was going on in your personal life?”

“你的个人生活发生了什么事？”

“Wife, two kids. Labour movement work always kills marriages. I don’t know any of my friends still married to their original wives. There are guys that I started with in 1973—some are dead, but some have had two or three, and one guy has had five marriages! This work just chews them up and spits them out.

“妻子，两个孩子。劳工运动的工作总是会毁掉婚姻。我认识的朋友里，没有一个还和原来的妻子在一起。有些兄弟和我1973年一起入行——有的已经去世了，有的结过两三次婚，甚至有一个结过五次婚！这份工作简直把他们榨干了。”

“You’re never there and never contribute. I feel bad about it now. At the time I was too stupid to feel bad about it. I didn’t recognize what I had. I’ve got a close relationship with my kids now—they’re grown up. I don’t remember my son very much when he was a teenager and when he was a little child; well, I’ve got photographs. I didn’t even know I had a daughter until she was twenty.

“你从来不在，也从来不付出。我现在为此感到愧疚。当时我太傻了，根本没意识到这一点。我根本没意识到自己拥有什么。现在我和孩子们关系很亲密——他们都长大了。我不太记得儿子十几岁和小时候的样子了；不过，我有照片。我甚至直到女儿二十岁才知道自己有个女儿。”

“I don’t think I questioned it, because everybody else was doing the same thing. It was just part of the culture. Dead marriages and booze were just common. I was the first one in my peer group to stop drinking.”

“我当时并没有质疑过这件事，因为其他人都一样。这只是文化的一部分。失败的婚姻和酗酒都很常见。我是我同龄人中第一个戒酒的人。”

Robert says he has an addictive personality. “Not just to work. Booze, drugs, women, gambling—the whole nine yards. I haven’t had a drink since September 2, 1980, at 7:40 p.m. That was the last time I had a beer. I got tired of waking up on the floor with my tongue stuck to the carpet and feeling like a bag of shit. I’ve also quit smoking 132 times. Problem is, I’ve started 133 times. That’s the one addiction I haven’t been able to break.”

罗伯特说他有成瘾倾向。“不只是工作。酒、毒品、女人、赌博——什么都上瘾。自从1980年9月2日晚上7点40分之后，我就没再喝过酒了。那是我最后一次喝啤酒。我受够了醒来发现自己躺在地板上，舌头粘在地毯上，感觉自己像坨屎。我还戒过132次烟。问题是，我又开始抽了133次。这是我唯一没能戒掉的瘾。”

What drew Robert to union organizing, and what still keeps him committed to it, is the opportunity to improve people’s lives and to work for a more fair, more equitable society. “That’s why you never say no. There’s always so much more to be done. The list of injustices never gets any shorter. I feel very fortunate to be able to contribute to making this a better world.”

罗伯特投身工会组织工作的原因，以及他至今仍坚持下去的原因，在于有机会改善人们的生活，并为建设一个更加公平公正的社会而努力。“这就是为什么你永远不能说‘不’。总有更多的事情要做。不公正的现象层出不穷。我非常荣幸能够为创造一个更美好的世界贡献一份力量。”

Robert has now developed the capacity to say no to excessive demands. Interestingly—and perhaps not coincidentally—he also finds that his ankylosing spondylitis, with the complete fusion of his ribs and his vertebrae, has conferred an unexpected benefit in emotional expression.

罗伯特现在已经能够对过分的要求说“不”。有趣的是——或许并非巧合——他还发现，他的强直性脊柱炎导致肋骨和脊椎完全融合，却意外地增强了他的情感表达能力。

“I have an advantage over others in terms of expressing anger. I have a command of the language. I never shout at anybody. I don’t have to shout because I can put words right through you just by controlling my breathing. One of the good things about AS is that freezes your ribs, so your ribs are locked in front and back.” Robert explains that when people become upset and lose control of their angry responses, they breathe in a very shallow fashion, using the muscles between the ribs to inflate the chest cavity and thus to draw air into the lungs. Because of his AS, he is unable to do that.

“在表达愤怒方面，我比其他人更有优势。我能很好地控制自己的情绪。我从不对任何人大喊大叫。我不需要喊叫，因为我只需控制呼吸就能让你明白我的意思。自闭症的一个好处是它会使你的肋骨僵硬，前后肋骨都被锁住了。”罗伯特解释说，当人们情绪激动、无法控制自己的愤怒反应时，他们会呼吸很浅，利用肋骨间的肌肉扩张胸腔，从而将空气吸入肺部。但由于患有自闭症，他无法做到这一点。

“In order to have a stronger voice and more control over the way you speak, you have to breathe with your diaphragm. You don’t breathe there—you breathe shallowly and your ribs move in and out. My gut goes up and down because I have to breathe with my diaphragm. There’s much more muscle control in the diaphragm than there is over top of the ribs.” It also affords better emotional control and ensures improved oxygen supply to the thinking parts of the brain.

“想要拥有更浑厚的声音和更好的说话方式，你必须用横膈膜呼吸。否则，你的呼吸会很浅，肋骨会跟着起伏。我的肚子也会上下起伏，因为我必须用横膈膜呼吸。横膈膜的肌肉控制力比肋骨上方的肌肉要强得多。” 横膈膜呼吸还能更好地控制情绪，并确保大脑负责思考的部分获得充足的氧气供应。

“Before, I had to work at it. As my ribs froze up, I didn’t have any choice.”

“以前，我必须努力才能做到。但现在我的肋骨僵硬了，我就别无选择。”

“That’s most interesting. Teachers of yogic breathing are always telling us to breathe using the diaphragm. That’s the healthy thing to do. Your AS forced you to do that.”

“这很有意思。瑜伽呼吸法的老师总是告诉我们用横膈膜呼吸。这才是健康的呼吸方式。你的强直性脊柱炎迫使你这样做。”

“It gives me the power of clarity. You can tell if most people are angry because they shout at you. That’s the way, verbally, they can express that they’re angry. With my breathing the way it is, I have to speak in shorter sentences, and I can clip words and project my voice rather than yell. Controlling your breathing allows you to control your temper and your anger—and by controlling I mean using it to get to where you want to go.”

“它赋予我清晰的思维。大多数人生气时都会对你大吼大叫，这是他们表达愤怒的方式。而我的呼吸方式不同，我必须用更短的句子说话，我可以精简词语，提高音量，而不是大喊大叫。控制呼吸就能控制脾气和愤怒——我说的控制是指利用它来达到你想要的目标。”

As Robert spoke, I was struck by the uncanny ability of nature to teach through adult disease lessons that, in a better world, should be learned in childhood and in health.

罗伯特说话时，我被大自然不可思议的能力所震撼，它通过成年人的疾病来传授一些道理，而在一个更美好的世界里，这些道理本应在童年和健康时期就学到。

One study pointed to the intriguing possibility that even the painful inflammation of rheumatoid arthritis could serve a protective function: joint tenderness was significantly related to a decrease in stressful events one week later. “The results have important clinical implications,” the researchers concluded.” The dynamic interplay between social-conflict events and joint pain describe a homeostatic system in which negative social interaction is regulated through worsening of the disease. 16

一项研究指出了一种有趣的可能，即类风湿性关节炎的疼痛性炎症也可能发挥保护作用：关节压痛与一周后压力事件的减少显著相关。“研究结果具有重要的临床意义，”研究人员总结道。“社会冲突事件与关节疼痛之间的动态相互作用描述了一种稳态系统，其中负面社会互动通过疾病的恶化得到调节。”

In other words, the flare-up of disease forced patients into avoiding stressful interactions. The body says no.

换句话说，疾病的爆发迫使患者避免压力大的社交互动。身体发出了拒绝的信号。

14
14
A Fine Balance: The Biology of Relationships
微妙的平衡：关系的生物学

A PATIENT OF MINE, A CHILD seven years old, was scheduled for cardiac surgery at British Columbia Children’s Hospital. She had already undergone two earlier operations for a congenital heart defect. Her parents were well familiar with the routine and wanted one of the rules of the operating room changed. Previously their daughter had been emotionally upset and struggled when she found herself strapped to the stretcher, surrounded by strangers wearing masks, her arm forcibly held as an intravenous catheter was inserted. This time they wished to stay with her until the anaesthetic took effect and she was fully asleep. Although the hospital staff believed that if parents were present the child would be clingy and all the more recalcitrant, they did relent. The anaesthetic procedure was effected without difficulty.

我的一位病人，一个七岁的孩子，在不列颠哥伦比亚儿童医院接受心脏手术。她之前已经接受过两次先天性心脏病手术。她的父母对手术流程非常熟悉，希望更改手术室的一项规定。之前，他们的女儿在被绑在担架上，周围都是戴着口罩的陌生人，手臂被强行按住插入静脉导管时，情绪非常激动，难以接受。这次，他们希望能够陪伴在她身边，直到麻醉生效，她完全睡着。虽然医院工作人员认为，如果父母在场，孩子会更加黏人，更加不配合，但他们最终还是同意了。麻醉过程顺利完成。

The traditional hospital practice of excluding parents ignored the importance of attachment relationships as regulators of the child’s emotions, behaviour and physiology. The child’s biological status would be vastly different under the circumstances of parental presence or absence. Her neurochemical output, the electrical activity in her brain’s emotional centres, her heart rate, blood pressure and the serum levels of the various hormones related to stress would all vary significantly.

传统医院将父母排除在外的做法忽视了依恋关系对调节儿童情绪、行为和生理机能的重要性。父母在场与否会对儿童的生理状态产生巨大影响。儿童的神经化学反应、大脑情绪中枢的电活动、心率、血压以及与压力相关的各种激素的血清水平都会发生显著变化。

Life is possible only within certain well-defined limits, internal or external. We can no more survive, say, high sugar levels in our bloodstream than we can withstand high levels of radiation emanating from a nuclear explosion. The role of self-regulation, whether emotional or physical, may be likened to that of a thermostat ensuring that the temperature in a home remains constant despite the extremes of weather conditions outside. When the environment becomes too cold, the heating system is switched on. If the air becomes overheated, the air conditioner begins to work. In the animal kingdom, self-regulation is illustrated by the capacity of the warm-blooded creature to exist in a broad range of environments. It can survive more extreme variations of hot and cold without either chilling or overheating than can a coldblooded species. The latter is restricted to a much narrower range of habitats because it does not have the capacity to self-regulate the internal environment.

生命只能在某些明确的限制范围内存在，这些限制既可以是内在的，也可以是外在的。例如，我们无法承受血液中过高的糖分，就像我们无法承受核爆炸产生的高辐射一样。自我调节，无论是情绪上的还是生理上的，其作用都可以比作恒温器，它确保室内温度在极端天气条件下保持恒定。当环境过冷时，供暖系统就会启动；如果空气过热，空调就会开始工作。在动物界，温血动物能够在各种环境中生存的能力就体现了自我调节的作用。与冷血动物相比，温血动物能够承受更极端的冷热变化而不至于过冷或过热。冷血动物的栖息地范围要狭窄得多，因为它们不具备自我调节内部环境的能力。

Children and infant animals have virtually no capacity for biological self-regulation; their internal biological states—heart rates, hormone levels, nervous system activity—depend completely on their relationships with caregiving grown-ups. Emotions such as love, fear or anger serve the needs of protecting the self while maintaining essential relationships with parents and other caregivers. Psychological stress is whatever threatens the young creature’s perception of a safe relationship with the adults, because any disruption in the relationship will cause turbulence in the internal milieu.

儿童和幼年动物几乎没有自我调节的能力；他们的内部生理状态——心率、激素水平、神经系统活动——完全依赖于与成年照护者的关系。爱、恐惧或愤怒等情绪满足了他们保护自身以及维持与父母和其他照护者之间重要关系的需求。任何威胁到幼小个体对与成年者之间安全关系的感知的因素都会构成心理压力，因为这种关系的任何中断都会导致其内部环境的动荡。

Emotional and social relationships remain important biological influences beyond childhood. “Independent self-regulation may not exist even in adulthood,” Dr. Myron Hofer, then of the Departments of Psychiatry and Neuroscience at Albert Einstein College of Medicine in New York, wrote in 1984. “Social interactions may continue to play an important role in the everyday regulation of internal biologic systems throughout life.” 1 Our biological response to environmental challenge is profoundly influenced by the context and by the set of relationships that connect us with other human beings. As one prominent researcher has expressed it most aptly, “Adaptation does not occur wholly within the individual.” 2

即使过了童年时期，情感和社会关系仍然是重要的生物学影响因素。“即使到了成年，独立的自我调节能力也可能并不存在，”当时在纽约阿尔伯特·爱因斯坦医学院精神病学和神经科学系任教的迈伦·霍弗博士在1984年写道，“社会互动可能在整个人的一生中，继续在日常的内部生物系统调节中发挥重要作用。”我们对环境挑战的生物反应深受环境以及我们与他人之间关系的影响。正如一位著名研究者精辟地指出，“适应并非完全发生在个体内部。”

Human beings as a species did not evolve as solitary creatures but as social animals whose survival was contingent on powerful emotional connections with family and tribe. Social and emotional connections are an integral part of our neurological and chemical makeup. We all know this from the daily experience of dramatic physiological shifts in our bodies as we interact with others. “You’ve burnt the toast again,” evokes markedly different bodily responses from us, depending on whether it is shouted in anger or said with a smile. When one considers our evolutionary history and the scientific evidence at hand, it is absurd even to imagine that health and disease could ever be understood in isolation from our psychoemotional networks. “The basic premise is that, like other social animals, human physiologic homeostasis and ultimate health status are influenced not only by the physical environment but also by the social environment.” 3

人类作为一个物种，并非进化成独居动物，而是社会性动物，其生存依赖于与家庭和部落之间强大的情感联系。社会和情感联系是我们神经和化学构成中不可或缺的一部分。我们每天都能从与他人互动时身体发生的剧烈生理变化中体会到这一点。“你又把吐司烤糊了”这句话，会引发我们截然不同的身体反应，取决于说话者是愤怒地喊出还是面带微笑。考虑到我们的进化史和现有的科学证据，认为健康和疾病可以脱离我们的心理情感网络来理解，这种想法是荒谬的。“基本前提是，与其他社会性动物一样，人类的生理稳态和最终健康状况不仅受物理环境的影响，也受社会环境的影响。”

From such a biopsychosocial perspective, individual biology, psychological functioning and interpersonal and social relationships work together, each influencing the other.

从生物心理社会学的角度来看，个体生物学、心理功能以及人际关系和社会关系相互影响、共同发挥作用。

Joyce is a forty-four-year-old professor of applied linguistics. Self-imposed stress, she has noticed, is a major factor in the onset of her asthmatic symptoms. “I think every time I’ve had an episode, it’s been when I’ve taken on more than I can handle. Even though I think I can handle it, somehow my body is saying that I can’t.

乔伊斯是一位44岁的应用语言学教授。她注意到，自我施加的压力是引发她哮喘症状的主要因素。“我觉得每次哮喘发作，都是因为我承担了超出自己能力范围的事情。即使我觉得自己能应付，但我的身体却告诉我我做不到。”

“I’ve been a faculty member at the university for a decade. For a number of years I was the only female. Now it has actually changed; I feel my efforts have paid off. There are four women now, which is good, but internally I always had to take on a lot of things. I had to prove myself. They’d never tenured a woman in my department. There was a climate that wasn’t that conducive to women’s ideas or women professors.

“我在这所大学任教十年了。有好几年，我是唯一的女性。现在情况确实有所改变；我觉得我的努力终于有了回报。现在有四位女性教员，这很好，但在校内，我总是要承担很多事情。我必须证明自己。我们系以前从未授予过女性终身教职。当时的氛围并不利于女性的思想或女性教授。”

“I was internalizing a lot of ‘shoulds.’ It was very hard. Not being able to say no was my issue. For me to say no would mean an incredible emptiness, which I was scared about. I’ve done a lot of things just to fill up the emptiness.”

“我当时脑子里塞满了各种‘应该’。这很难熬。我最大的问题是不会说‘不’。对我来说，说‘不’意味着巨大的空虚，我很害怕这种空虚。我做了很多事只是为了填补这种空虚。”

During this past autumn and winter, Joyce’s asthma has been particularly troublesome. She has had to use higher than the usual doses of inhaled medications to open the airways and to counteract the inflammation in her lungs. “I realize my illness is making me say no. As part of an exchange I was to be going to Baltimore, and I said, ‘No, I can’t go.’ That’s happened other times. I’ve cancelled things, saying, ‘I have an asthma attack, so I can’t do it.’ I’m still hiding behind something. I’m not willing to just say, ‘I won’t do it.’”

去年秋冬季，乔伊斯的哮喘特别严重。她不得不使用比平时更高剂量的吸入药物来扩张气道，对抗肺部炎症。“我知道我的病让我不得不拒绝。之前我本来要去巴尔的摩参加一个交流项目，但我说，‘不行，我去不了。’这种情况以前也发生过。我取消过一些活动，说，‘我哮喘发作了，去不了。’我仍然在找借口。我不愿意直接说，‘我不去了。’”

In asthma, from the Greek root “breathe hard,” there is a reversible narrowing of the bronchioles, the small airways in the lungs, because the muscle fibres that encircle them begin to tighten. At the same time, the lining of the bronchioles becomes swollen and inflamed. All the various components of the PNI apparatus are involved in asthma: emotions, nerves, immune cells and hormones. Nervous discharges can narrow the airways in response to many stimuli, including emotions. The immune system is responsible for inflammation of the bronchiolar lining, the other characteristic feature of asthma. Swelling of the airway lining and the accumulation of inflammatory debris in the bronchioles are the final consequences.

哮喘一词源于希腊语，意为“呼吸困难”。哮喘是指肺部细小气道——细支气管——发生可逆性狭窄，这是由于环绕细支气管的肌肉纤维开始收缩所致。与此同时，细支气管内壁也会出现肿胀和炎症。周围神经系统（PNI）的各个组成部分都与哮喘有关，包括情绪、神经、免疫细胞和激素。神经系统的各种刺激，包括情绪，都可能导致气道狭窄。免疫系统负责细支气管内壁的炎症，这是哮喘的另一个特征。气道内壁肿胀和炎症碎片在细支气管内积聚是最终的后果。

It is not inhalation but the outflow of air from the narrowed bronchioles that is impaired in asthma. The asthmatic has difficulty exhaling and feels his chest begin to tighten. The lungs attempt to clear the clogged airways by activating the cough reflex. In acute episodes, the laboured exhalations produce the well-known wheezing noise from the narrowed bronchioles, as from lips puckered for whistling. In milder cases, the only symptom may be an irritating cough. For some people asthma is chronic, while others experience it only intermittently.

哮喘并非吸气障碍，而是支气管狭窄导致的空气排出受阻。哮喘患者呼气困难，并感到胸闷。肺部会通过激活咳嗽反射来尝试清除阻塞的气道。在急性发作时，由于呼吸困难，狭窄的支气管会发出我们熟知的喘鸣声，就像嘴唇撅起吹口哨一样。在较轻的病例中，可能唯一的症状是令人烦躁的咳嗽。有些人的哮喘是慢性的，而另一些人则只是间歇性发作。

Depending on individual predisposition, asthmatic attacks may be set off by everything from allergens to exercise, cold temperatures or medications such as Aspirin, to crying and laughing, viral respiratory infections and emotional arousal. Asthma is one of the few diseases recognized by mainstream medicine to have a significant mind-body component.

根据个体体质不同，哮喘发作的诱因多种多样，包括过敏原、运动、寒冷环境、服用阿司匹林等药物、哭泣和大笑、病毒性呼吸道感染以及情绪激动等等。哮喘是主流医学认为具有显著身心因素的少数几种疾病之一。

Emotions can play a major role in making a person susceptible, no matter what the immediate trigger may be—Aspirin or cold air or anxiety. Chronic emotional stresses sensitize the immune system, so that it becomes overly reactive to any number of triggers.

无论直接诱因是什么——阿司匹林、冷空气或焦虑——情绪都可能使人变得易感。长期的情绪压力会使免疫系统变得敏感，从而对各种诱因过度反应。

Another way emotions affect the inflammation in asthma is through hormones. Glucocorticoid hormones—anti-inflammatory steroid hormones, most notably cortisol—are secreted by the adrenal glands on signals from the hypothalamic-pituitary system in the brain. A diminished cortisol response by an impaired HPA axis would promote inflammation. At the University of Trier, Germany, a study found that children known to suffer from atopic dermatitis (eczema, itchy allergic rashes) or from asthma have a diminished production of cortisol in response to stress. “When asked to tell a story or to do mental math, these children show less increase in the glucocorticoid concentrations in their saliva than do healthy peers.” 4 In fact, man-made cortisol-like hormones are a crucial part of the treatment for asthma.

情绪影响哮喘炎症的另一种途径是通过激素。糖皮质激素——尤其是皮质醇——是一种抗炎类固醇激素，由肾上腺在大脑下丘脑-垂体系统的信号刺激下分泌。下丘脑-垂体-肾上腺轴功能受损导致皮质醇反应减弱，从而促进炎症。德国特里尔大学的一项研究发现，已知患有特应性皮炎（湿疹、瘙痒性过敏性皮疹）或哮喘的儿童，在压力下皮质醇分泌减少。“当被要求讲故事或进行心算时，这些儿童唾液中糖皮质激素浓度的升高幅度低于健康同龄人。”事实上，人工合成的皮质醇样激素是哮喘治疗的关键组成部分。

Many studies of asthmatic children and adults have documented a strong association between disease severity and emotional states triggered by relationships. 5 Researchers who looked at the interactions between parents and asthmatic children have identified characteristic patterns of insecure attachments. Separation anxiety has been observed in children with asthma to a greater degree, not only in comparison with healthy controls but also when matched with children suffering from cystic fibrosis, a congenital lung disease, more serious by far. 6 The severity of the disease, in other words, was not the cause of the anxiety.

许多针对哮喘儿童和成人的研究表明，疾病严重程度与人际关系引发的情绪状态之间存在密切关联。研究人员观察了父母与哮喘儿童之间的互动，发现了不安全依恋的特征模式。与健康对照组相比，哮喘儿童的分离焦虑程度更高；即使与患有囊性纤维化（一种更为严重的先天性肺部疾病）的儿童相比，哮喘儿童的分离焦虑程度也更高。换句话说，疾病的严重程度并非焦虑的根源。

Under test conditions, one study examined the breathing patterns of asthmatic children between two and thirteen years of age, using a comparison group of healthy controls. Each child listened to recordings of his or her mother’s voice and that of a stranger. “Regardless of the tone of the voice, asthmatic children showed more abnormal respiratory patterns when listening to their mother’s voice than when listening to that of a strange woman. This interesting result suggested a specific emotional effect on breathing that was contrary to what one would have predicted if the child had seen the mother as being reassuring.” 7

在实验条件下，一项研究以健康对照组为对照，考察了2至13岁哮喘儿童的呼吸模式。每个孩子分别聆听了自己母亲的声音和一位陌生人的声音录音。“无论声音的语调如何，哮喘儿童在聆听母亲的声音时，呼吸模式的异常程度都高于聆听陌生女性的声音。这一有趣的结果表明，情绪对呼吸存在特定的影响，这与人们预期中母亲的声音能带来安慰时的情况截然相反。”

In German studies, asthmatic children were more likely than their healthy counterparts to engage in long, escalating, mutually negative interactions with both their mothers and fathers. Their parents tended to exhibit more critical behaviour toward them than the parents of other children. 8 On objective measures, when asthmatic children felt frustrated or criticized, the flow of air from their lungs diminished, indicating airway narrowing. Decreased airflow has also been documented when children with asthma were asked to recall incidents of intense anger or fear.

德国的研究表明，哮喘儿童比健康儿童更容易与父母发生长时间、不断升级的负面互动。他们的父母也往往比其他孩子的父母对他们表现出更多的批评行为。客观测量结果显示，当哮喘儿童感到沮丧或受到批评时，他们肺部的气流会减少，表明气道狭窄。此外，当要求哮喘儿童回忆强烈的愤怒或恐惧事件时，也观察到了气流减少的现象。

The stresses that may induce asthma in a child are not necessarily recognized as such by either the patient or the family. Dr. Salvador Minuchin at the Philadelphia Child Guidance Clinic has studied asthma and other childhood illnesses. In his view, highly sensitive children pick up subconscious cues from the environment, particularly about the emotional states of their parents. He has noted that family systems in which children develop disease have four features in common: enmeshment, overprotectiveness (controlling), rigidity and lack of conflict resolution. “A pathologically enmeshed family system is characterized by a high degree of responsiveness and involvement. This can be seen in the interdependence of relationships, intrusions on personal boundaries, poorly differentiated perception of self and of other family members, and weak … boundaries.” 9

儿童哮喘的诱发因素未必会被患者或家人意识到。费城儿童指导诊所的萨尔瓦多·米努钦博士研究过哮喘和其他儿童疾病。他认为，高度敏感的儿童会潜意识地从环境中获取信息，尤其是父母的情绪状态。他指出，儿童患病的家庭系统具有四个共同特征：过度纠缠、过度保护（控制）、僵化和缺乏冲突解决能力。“病态纠缠的家庭系统以高度的回应性和参与度为特征。这体现在人际关系的相互依赖、对个人界限的侵犯、对自身和其他家庭成员认知的模糊不清以及界限不清等方面。”

One of Joyce’s recent asthma flare-ups, which lingered several months after the original incident, occurred after a family get-together. The episode, in which she felt attacked by her older brother, brought up emotions of fright and suppressed anger from her childhood.

乔伊斯最近一次哮喘发作，距离最初的哮喘发作已经持续了几个月，这次发作发生在一次家庭聚会之后。在那次发作中，她感觉自己受到了哥哥的攻击，这唤起了她童年时期被压抑的恐惧和愤怒。

“When I was young, I operated in fear of the anger that was displayed. I was never hit, but there was a lot of anger around in my family—my father’s and my brother’s. My mother was complicit in that. She didn’t defend me from that anger. The anger wasn’t necessarily directed at me, but it was around me. I felt helpless in all of that. Part of my inability to say no has been always that fear of displeasing, of being in difficult situations. Even now, I find it very difficult to deal with problematic situations.

“小时候，我总是生活在对愤怒的恐惧之中。我虽然没挨过打，但我的家庭——父亲和哥哥的家庭——却充斥着很多愤怒。我的母亲也对此负有责任。她没有保护我免受这些愤怒的侵扰。这些愤怒未必是针对我的，但它们却无处不在。我感到无助。我一直无法说‘不’，部分原因就是害怕惹人厌烦，害怕陷入困境。即使现在，我仍然觉得处理棘手的情况非常困难。”

“It was this low level of anger all the time. My father was the righteous one. There would be an expression on his face, a tone in his voice. It was always so irrational, like a child’s response to the world. It wasn’t like an adult.

“他一直都带着一种淡淡的怒气。我父亲是个正直的人。他脸上总会有一种表情，说话的语气也有些怪异。他的反应总是那么不理智，就像孩子对世界的反应一样。这不像个成年人。”

“I couldn’t take it—I was scared by it. I never felt safe. My father is now eighty-two. He doesn’t lash out as much because he’s pretty old. My brother is a very angry person; he lashes out all the time and it can be quite devastating.

“我受不了——我被吓坏了。我从来没有安全感。我父亲现在八十二岁了。他年纪大了，所以不像以前那样动不动就发脾气。我哥哥是个非常易怒的人；他总是发脾气，而且会造成很大的伤害。”

“Just to say what happened this fall … At the end of November is my son’s birthday—six years old, and that’s a big deal. My parents came up from Seattle, and my brother joined us. We all had dinner together. He just went over the top—critical, angry, directed at me. That happened Friday. Saturday was my son’s birthday, and I felt completely upset. I woke up Monday morning and couldn’t talk, couldn’t walk, couldn’t do anything.”

“我只想说说今年秋天发生的事……11月底是我儿子的生日——他六岁了，这可是件大事。我父母从西雅图过来，我弟弟也来了。我们一起吃了顿饭。他突然情绪失控——批评指责，怒气冲冲，而且都是冲着我来的。那是周五发生的事。周六是我儿子的生日，我当时感觉糟透了。周一早上醒来，我发现自己说不出话，走不了路，什么都做不了。”

____

A recent Australian study pointed to the importance of positive social relationships in modulating stress. Five hundred and fourteen women who required breast biopsies were interviewed. Slightly fewer than half of the subjects were subsequently diagnosed with cancer, the others with benign tumours. The results “revealed a significant interaction between highly threatening life stressors and social support.
