Women experiencing a stressor objectively rated as highly threatening and who were without intimate emotional social support had a ninefold increase in risk of developing breast carcinoma.” 10

澳大利亚最近的一项研究指出，积极的社会关系在调节压力方面至关重要。研究人员采访了514名需要进行乳腺活检的女性。其中略少于一半的受访者随后被诊断出患有癌症，其余受访者则患有良性肿瘤。研究结果“揭示了高度威胁性的生活压力源与社会支持之间存在显著的交互作用。经历客观上被评为高度威胁性压力源且缺乏亲密情感社会支持的女性，患乳腺癌的风险增加了九倍。”

The investigators found themselves taken by surprise. They write, “Our finding of an interaction between severely threatening life events and the absence of social support was somewhat unexpected given the absence of independent effect.”

调查人员对此感到意外。他们写道：“考虑到缺乏独立的影响，我们发现严重威胁生活事件与缺乏社会支持之间存在相互作用，这多少有些出乎意料。”

Yet this finding is no more startling than learning that non-swimmers without life jackets are not at risk of drowning—at least, not until they are thrown into deep water. The reader will remember from chapter one that medical students under the stress of exams were shown to have diminished immune system activity, but that the most isolated among them were the most vulnerable. The physiological functioning of human beings is inseparable—even in theory, let alone in practice—from the emotional and social connections that help to sustain us.

然而，这一发现并不比得知不会游泳且不穿救生衣的人不会溺水更令人惊讶——至少在他们被扔进深水区之前不会。读者或许还记得第一章的内容，考试压力下的医学生免疫系统活性有所下降，而其中最孤单的学生则最为脆弱。人类的生理机能——即使在理论上，更遑论在实践中——也与维系我们生存的情感和社会联系密不可分。

A seventeen-year follow-up study of residents of Alameda County, California, looked at the possible links between people’s social connectedness or sense of isolation and the onset of cancer. In this prospective study, none of the adults enrolled at the start had cancer. “The risk factor of major interest for women appeared to be social isolation, not only being isolated, but also of feeling isolated…. Given the effect of emotions on hormonal regulation, it is not unlikely that isolation may have a direct promotional effect on the development of this set of cancers.” 11 The researchers grouped cancers of the female breast, ovary and uterus as hormone related.

一项对加利福尼亚州阿拉米达县居民进行的为期17年的随访研究，探讨了人们的社会联系或孤独感与癌症发生之间的可能联系。在这项前瞻性研究中，所有入组的成年人在研究开始时均未患癌症。“对女性而言，主要的风险因素似乎是社会孤立，不仅是实际的孤立状态，还包括感到孤立……考虑到情绪对激素调节的影响，孤立很可能直接促进这类癌症的发生。”研究人员将女性乳腺癌、卵巢癌和子宫癌归为激素相关癌症。

We do not all mirror one another in how we are physiologically affected by social and interpersonal stressors or other external pressures. What, apart from inborn temperament, accounts for these individual differences?

我们每个人在生理上对社会和人际压力或其他外部压力的反应都不尽相同。除了与生俱来的气质之外，还有什么因素造成了这些个体差异？

A key factor is emotional development. Should the child in the first example require a further operation at the age of twenty-five, she will no longer need her mother and father to hold her hand while the anaesthetic is administered. She will have enough self-regulation that neither her neurotransmitter activity nor her stress hormones would go out of balance without her parents’ immediate proximity. We cannot take it for granted, however, that with chronological adulthood we automatically attain emotional independence. At any age, our responses to potential stressors are deeply influenced by the degree to which our emotional functioning continues to be dominated by our attachment needs, fears and anxieties.

关键因素在于情绪发展。例如，如果第一个例子中的孩子在25岁时需要再次手术，她将不再需要父母在麻醉时握着她的手。她将具备足够的自我调节能力，即使没有父母的陪伴，她的神经递质活动和压力激素水平也不会失衡。然而，我们不能想当然地认为，随着年龄的增长，我们就会自动获得情绪独立。在任何年龄，我们对潜在压力源的反应都深受依恋需求、恐惧和焦虑对我们情绪功能的影响程度的影响。

According to the family systems theory articulated by the late American psychiatrist Dr. Murray Bowen, illness is not a simple biological event in a separate human being. A family systems view recognizes the moment-to-moment interrelatedness of the physiological functioning of individuals. Self-evident in the relationship of mother and fetus, this physiological interrelatedness does not end with birth or even with physical maturation. As we have seen, relationships remain important biological regulators throughout a whole life.

根据已故美国精神病学家默里·鲍文博士提出的家庭系统理论，疾病并非发生在一个独立个体身上的简单生物学事件。家庭系统理论强调个体生理功能在各个时刻之间的相互关联。这种生理关联在母胎关系中显而易见，并且不会随着出生甚至身体发育成熟而终止。正如我们所见，人际关系在整个生命历程中始终是重要的生物学调节因素。

A fundamental concept in family systems theory is differentiation , defined as “the ability to be in emotional contact with others yet still autonomous in one’s emotional functioning.” The poorly differentiated person “lacks an emotional boundary between himself and others and lacks a ‘boundary’ that prevents his thinking process from being overwhelmed by his emotional feeling process. He automatically absorbs anxiety from others and generates considerable anxiety within himself.” 12

家庭系统理论的一个基本概念是分化，其定义为“既能与他人建立情感联系，又能保持自身情感功能的自主性”。分化不良的人“缺乏自身与他人之间的情感界限，也缺乏防止其思维过程被情绪过程所淹没的‘界限’。他会自动吸收他人的焦虑，并在自身内部产生相当大的焦虑。”

The well-differentiated person can respond from an open acceptance of her own emotions, which are not tailored either to match someone else’s expectations or to resist them. She neither suppresses her emotions nor acts them out impulsively. Dr. Michael Kerr, a former colleague of Murray Bowen’s, is currently director of the Georgetown University Family Center, Washington, D.C. Dr. Kerr distinguishes between two types of differentiation: functional differentiation and basic differentiation . The two types may superficially appear to be identical, but from the perspective of health and stress they are worlds apart.

一个情感分化良好的人能够坦然接纳自己的情绪，既不刻意迎合他人的期望，也不刻意抗拒。她既不压抑自己的情绪，也不冲动地发泄。迈克尔·克尔博士曾是默里·鲍文的同事，现任华盛顿特区乔治城大学家庭中心主任。克尔博士区分了两种情感分化类型：功能性分化和基本分化。这两种类型表面上看起来似乎相同，但从健康和压力的角度来看，它们却截然不同。

Functional differentiation refers to a person’s ability to function based on his relationships with others . For instance, it may be that I can do my work well only when other people—my employees, my spouse, my children—can absorb my unresolved anxieties by putting up with my bad temper, unreliable habits, lack of emotional engagement or even abusive behaviour. Were they to reject the roles I assign them, I might fall apart. That would be an example of functional differentiation. On the other hand, if my ability to function is independent of other people’s having to do my emotional work for me—that is, if I can remain engaged with others while staying emotionally open to them and to myself—then I would be said to have basic differentiation. The less basic differentiation a person has attained, the more prone he is to experience emotional stress and physical illness.

功能分化是指一个人基于与他人关系而发挥自身功能的能力。例如，我可能只有在其他人——我的员工、配偶、孩子——能够包容我未解决的焦虑，容忍我的坏脾气、不可靠的习惯、缺乏情感投入甚至虐待行为时，才能做好工作。如果他们拒绝我赋予他们的角色，我可能会崩溃。这就是功能分化的一个例子。另一方面，如果我的功能独立于他人为我承担情感工作——也就是说，如果我能够与他人保持互动，同时又能对他们和自己保持情感上的开放——那么我就被认为具有基本分化。一个人的基本分化程度越低，就越容易经历情绪压力和身体疾病。

In a study of stress, adaption and immunity, fourteen hundred military cadets at West Point were followed for four years. They were tested psychologically and had regular blood tests to study their susceptibility to the Epstein-Barr virus, the causative agent for infectious mononucleosis. Those most susceptible to contract the virus or to develop clinical disease had the following in common: they had high ambitions for themselves; they were struggling academically; they had fathers who were high achievers. 13 We can see here the relationship between the stress and the perceived need to live up to parental expectation—that is, between the internal biological milieu and the child’s continuing need to gain acceptance.

在一项关于压力、适应和免疫的研究中，研究人员对西点军校的1400名学员进行了为期四年的追踪调查。他们接受了心理测试，并定期进行血液检查，以研究他们对EB病毒（传染性单核细胞增多症的病原体）的易感性。那些最容易感染病毒或发展成临床疾病的学员具有以下共同特征：他们对自己抱有很高的期望；他们在学业上遇到困难；他们的父亲都是成就卓著的人。由此可见，压力与渴望达到父母期望的需求之间存在着关联——也就是说，内在的生物环境与孩子持续获得认可的需求之间存在着关联。

In another study, married women were matched with an equal number of women who were divorced or separated. In the married group, marital quality and satisfaction were assessed by means of self-reports. Immune system activity was studied in blood samples drawn from each participant. Poorer marital quality was “strongly and positively” related to poorer immune response. In the divorced or separated group, the two psychological factors most closely associated with diminished immune functioning were the time elapsed since the breakup (the more recent the marriage failure, the greater the immune suppression) and the woman’s degree of attachment to the former spouse (the greater the emotional attachment, the worse the immune function). 14 Women who were more self-regulated, less emotionally dependent on a relationship that failed to work for them, had stronger immune systems. Greater differentiation means better health.

在另一项研究中，研究人员将已婚女性与数量相同的离异或分居女性进行匹配。在已婚组中，婚姻质量和满意度通过自我报告进行评估。研究人员采集了每位参与者的血液样本，并检测了其免疫系统活性。结果显示，婚姻质量越差，免疫反应越弱。在离异或分居组中，与免疫功能下降最密切相关的两个心理因素是分手时间（婚姻破裂时间越近，免疫抑制程度越高）以及女性对前配偶的依恋程度（情感依恋程度越高，免疫功能越差）。 14 那些自我调节能力更强、对失败关系依赖性更低的女性，其免疫系统更强大。更高的分化程度意味着更好的健康状况。

The less powerful partner in any relationship will absorb a disproportionate amount of the shared anxiety—which is the reason that so many more women than men are treated for, say, anxiety or depression. (The issue here is not strength but power: that is, who is serving whose needs?) It is not that these women are more psychologically unbalanced than their husbands, even though the latter may seem to function at higher levels. What is unbalanced is the relationship, so that the women are absorbing their husband’s stresses and anxieties while also having to contain their own.

在任何关系中，弱势一方都会承受不成比例的共同焦虑——这就是为什么接受焦虑症或抑郁症治疗的女性人数远多于男性。（这里的问题不在于力量强弱，而在于权力：也就是说，谁在满足谁的需求？）并非这些女性的心理状态比她们的丈夫更不稳定，即使后者看起来表现得更好。真正失衡的是这段关系，女性不仅要承受丈夫的压力和焦虑，还要努力压抑自己的情绪。

We recall that Nancy, wife of a man with ulcerative colitis, was exasperated at the stress triggered for her by her husband’s obsessive and rigid controlling attitudes. * Tim’s disease has been in reasonable control over the years. Nancy has effectively absorbed much of his anxiety, but at her own expense. Nancy is now being treated for depression and anxiety and says she is nearing the end of her rope. “It has felt like I have another child,” she says, “because he is very high maintenance. I now understand that I have four children I have been responsible for. I’m the parent for both of us. I’ve repressed my emotional needs for a very long time, without realizing it. It’s frightening to think now that I wasn’t even aware of that, until I had a mini-breakdown.” If Nancy lets go of her one-sided nurturing role in the relationship, Tim may experience a flare-up of his colitis—unless he learns to take more emotional responsibility for himself.

我们记得，患有溃疡性结肠炎的蒂姆的妻子南希，因丈夫偏执且固执的控制欲而倍感压力。多年来，蒂姆的病情一直控制得不错。南希默默地承担了他大部分的焦虑，但这却让她自己承受了巨大的痛苦。南希目前正在接受抑郁症和焦虑症的治疗，她说自己已经快要崩溃了。“感觉就像我又多了一个孩子，”她说，“因为他非常难伺候。我现在才意识到，我实际上要对四个孩子负责。我既是蒂姆的父母，也是我们两个孩子的父母。我长期以来一直压抑着自己的情感需求，却浑然不觉。现在想想，直到我情绪崩溃，我才意识到这一点，真是令人恐惧。”如果南希放弃她在这段关系中单方面的付出，蒂姆的结肠炎可能会复发——除非他学会对自己的情绪负责。

The partner who must suppress more of his or her own needs for the sake of the relationship is more likely to develop physical illness as well—hence the greater incidence, for example, of autoimmune disease and of non-smoking-related cancers among women. “The existence of a mind-body link and a person-person link means that it is possible for anxiety in one person to be manifested as a physical symptom in another person,” Dr. Kerr writes. “As is the case with the emotional dysfunctions, the one prone to develop symptoms is the spouse who adapts most to maintain harmony in the relationship system.” 15

为了维系关系而压抑自身需求的一方，更容易患上身体疾病——例如，女性自身免疫性疾病和非吸烟相关癌症的发病率更高。“身心联系和人与人之间的联系意味着，一个人的焦虑有可能在另一个人身上表现为身体症状，”克尔博士写道。“与情绪功能障碍一样，最容易出现症状的往往是那些为了维持关系和谐而做出最大努力的一方。”

Nature’s ultimate goal is to foster the growth of the individual from absolute dependence to independence—or, more exactly, to the interdependence of mature adults living in community. Development is a process of moving from complete external regulation to self-regulation, as far as our genetic programming allows. Well-self-regulated people are the most capable of interacting fruitfully with others in a community and of nurturing children who will also grow into self-regulated adults. Anything that interferes with that natural agenda threatens the organism’s chances for long-term survival. Almost from the beginning of life we see a tension between the complementary needs for security and for autonomy. Development requires a gradual and age-appropriate shift from security needs toward the drive for autonomy, from attachment to individuation. Neither is ever completely lost, and neither is meant to predominate at the expense of the other.

自然的最终目标是促进个体从完全依赖走向独立——更确切地说，是走向成熟成年人在社群中相互依存。发展是一个从完全依赖外部调节走向自我调节的过程，其程度取决于我们的基因程序。自我调节能力强的人最能有效地与社群中的其他人互动，也最能养育出将来也能自我调节的孩子。任何干扰这一自然进程的因素都会威胁到生物体的长期生存。几乎从生命之初，我们就能看到安全需求和自主需求这两种互补需求之间的张力。发展需要一个循序渐进、符合年龄的转变过程，从安全需求转向自主驱动，从依恋走向个体化。两者从未完全消失，也并非注定要以牺牲另一方为代价。

With an increased capacity for self-regulation in adulthood comes also a heightened need for autonomy—for the freedom to make genuine choices. Whatever undermines autonomy will be experienced as a source of stress. Stress is magnified whenever the power to respond effectively to the social or physical environment is lacking or when the tested animal or human being feels helpless, without meaningful choices—in other words, when autonomy is undermined.

随着成年期自我调节能力的增强，个体对自主性的需求也随之增加——即对做出真正选择的自由的需求。任何削弱自主性的因素都会被视为压力源。当个体缺乏有效应对社会或物理环境的能力，或者当受试动物或人类感到无助、没有有意义的选择时——换句话说，当自主性受到损害时——压力就会被放大。

Autonomy, however, needs to be exercised in a way that does not disrupt the social relationships on which survival also depends, whether with emotional intimates or with important others—employers, fellow workers, social authority figures. The less the emotional capacity for self-regulation develops during infancy and childhood, the more the adult depends on relationships to maintain homeostasis. The greater the dependence, the greater the threat when those relationships are lost or become insecure. Thus, the vulnerability to subjective and physiological stress will be proportionate to the degree of emotional dependence .

然而，自主性的行使必须以不破坏社会关系为前提，而社会关系对生存至关重要，无论这些关系是与亲密的情感伙伴，还是与重要的其他人——雇主、同事、社会权威人士——的关系。婴儿期和儿童期自我调节情绪的能力发展越弱，成年后就越依赖人际关系来维持身心平衡。依赖性越强，一旦这些关系丧失或变得不安全，所面临的威胁就越大。因此，个体对主观和生理压力的脆弱程度与情感依赖程度成正比。

To minimize the stress from threatened relationships, a person may give up some part of his autonomy. However, this is not a formula for health, since the loss of autonomy is itself a cause of stress. The surrender of autonomy raises the stress level, even if on the surface it appears to be necessary for the sake of “security” in a relationship, and even if we subjectively feel relief when we gain “security” in this manner. If I chronically repress my emotional needs in order to make myself “acceptable” to other people, I increase my risks of having to pay the price in the form of illness.

为了减轻关系受到威胁带来的压力，人们可能会放弃部分自主权。然而，这并非健康之道，因为失去自主权本身就是压力的来源。放弃自主权会加剧压力，即便表面上为了维系关系中的“安全感”而不得不这样做，即便我们主观上会因这种“安全感”而感到解脱。如果我为了让自己“被他人接受”而长期压抑自己的情感需求，那么我最终患病的风险也会随之增加。

The other way of protecting oneself from the stress of threatened relationships is emotional shutdown. To feel safe, the vulnerable person withdraws from others and closes against intimacy. This coping style may avoid anxiety and block the subjective experience of stress but not the physiology of it. Emotional intimacy is a psychological and biological necessity. Those who build walls against intimacy are not self-regulated, just emotionally frozen. Their stress from having unmet needs will be high.

另一种保护自己免受关系危机压力的方式是情感封闭。为了获得安全感，脆弱的人会选择疏远他人，拒绝亲密关系。这种应对方式或许可以避免焦虑，阻断压力的主观体验，但却无法消除压力的生理反应。情感上的亲密是心理和生理上的必需。那些筑起高墙拒绝亲密关系的人并非自我调节能力强，而是情感麻木。他们因需求未被满足而承受着巨大的压力。

Social support helps to ameliorate physiological stress. The close links between health and the social environment have been amply demonstrated. In the Alameda County study, those more socially isolated were more susceptible to illness of many types. In three separate studies of aging people, five-year mortality risks were associated directly with social integration: the more socially connected a person was, the lower their risk of death. “Social ties and support,” a group of researchers concluded, “… remain powerful predictors of morbidity and mortality in their own right, independent of any associations with other risk factors.” 16

社会支持有助于缓解生理压力。健康与社会环境之间的密切联系已被充分证实。阿拉米达县的研究表明，社会孤立程度越高的人越容易患上各种疾病。在三项针对老年人的独立研究中，五年死亡风险与社会融合度直接相关：一个人的社会联系越紧密，其死亡风险就越低。一组研究人员总结道：“社会关系和支持……本身就是发病率和死亡率的强有力预测因素，与任何其他风险因素的关联无关。”

For the adult, therefore, biological stress regulation depends on a delicate balance between social and relationship security on the one hand, and genuine autonomy on the other. Whatever upsets that balance, whether or not the individual is consciously aware of it, is a source of stress.

因此，对成年人而言，生物压力调节取决于社会和人际关系安全感与真正自主性之间的微妙平衡。任何打破这种平衡的因素，无论个体是否意识到，都会成为压力的来源。

* See chapter 10 .

* 参见第10章。

15
15
The Biology of Loss
丧失的生物学

R ACHEL, WHOSE RHEUMATOID JOINT inflammation first flared on the eve of Rosh Hashanah, is a slight woman, barely five feet tall. Sitting on the sofa in her living room, she is dwarfed by the giant teddy bear propped up beside her. There is something hungry-looking about her, reminiscent of the undernourished and emotionally deprived premature infant she was.

瑞秋的类风湿性关节炎在犹太新年（Rosh Hashanah）前夕首次发作，她身材瘦小，身高不足五英尺。坐在客厅的沙发上，她被身旁倚着的巨型泰迪熊衬得更加娇小。她看起来有些饥饿，让人想起她早产时营养不良、情感匮乏的模样。

“When I was born, I choked on all the amniotic fluid that had filled my lungs. I spent my first four weeks in a toaster oven of an incubator. Back in 1961 there wasn’t the knowledge that infants in incubators still need to be touched. So my first month of life was needles and pokes and prods. My mother didn’t come because she had to look after my brother. If my father came … I don’t know.”

“我出生时，羊水灌满了我的肺，我被呛住了。我在保温箱里待了四个星期，那保温箱就像个烤箱。1961年的时候，人们还不知道保温箱里的婴儿也需要人抚摸。所以我出生后的第一个月，每天都要挨针扎。我妈妈没来，因为她要照顾我弟弟。我爸爸来没来……我不知道。”

The consequences of emotional and tactile deprivation during her first month could have been overcome had Rachel enjoyed nurturing relationships subsequently, but that was not to be. She failed in her appointed life purpose almost from conception. Her mother, who had hoped that the pregrancy would keep the marriage together, was abandoned by her husband even before Rachel’s birth. One can imagine the mother’s state of mind, being alone and having the sole care of both a toddler—Rachel’s brother—and the newborn.

如果瑞秋之后能享受到关爱和呵护，那么她在出生第一个月所遭受的情感和触觉剥夺或许可以得到弥补，但事与愿违。她几乎从受孕之初就未能完成她被赋予的生命使命。她的母亲原本希望怀孕能维系婚姻，却在瑞秋出生前就被丈夫抛弃。我们可以想象这位母亲当时的心情，独自一人，既要照顾蹒跚学步的弟弟（瑞秋的哥哥），又要独自照顾新生儿。

Under such circumstances, having to justify her existence became second nature to Rachel—it is nobody’s first nature. Her fundamental expectation is that she will be abandoned. “I believe if anybody got to know me, they would leave me for sure,” she says. She was astounded when over the last holiday season she received several invitations from people just to visit. That anyone would want her without expecting anything is well nigh impossible for her to fathom.

在这种情况下，证明自己存在的价值成了瑞秋的第二天性——但这并非任何人的本能。她最根本的预期是自己会被抛弃。“我相信，如果有人真正了解我，肯定会离开我，”她说。上个假期，她收到好几位朋友的邀请，只为去拜访她，这让她感到无比惊讶。有人会真心实意地想要她，却不求任何回报，这几乎让她难以置信。

Since her diagnosis with rheumatoid arthritis, Rachel has entered therapy. As a result, she is much more able than before to know what she feels at any moment. Anger is the emotion she still has the most difficulty recognizing. It is usually roused in her by perceptions of being dismissed or demeaned as, for example, recently when her mother criticized her choice of therapist. “She couldn’t understand why I would use a portion of my welfare cheque to pay for therapy rather than go to a psychiatrist funded by the medical plan. So here I have finally found someone I can communicate with, and my mother thinks only about the money part of it.” Yet instead of stating calmly that her decisions are her own to make, Rachel argued and pleaded for her mother’s understanding. The rancorous exchange induced a week of anorexia, her mode of self-directed rage.

自从确诊类风湿性关节炎后，瑞秋就开始接受治疗。因此，她比以前更能觉察自己当下的感受。愤怒是她仍然最难识别的情绪。通常，当她感到被忽视或被贬低时，就会激起愤怒，例如，最近她母亲批评她选择的治疗师。“她不明白我为什么要用一部分福利金来支付治疗费用，而不是去看医保报销的精神科医生。我好不容易找到了一个可以沟通的人，而我母亲却只想着钱。”然而，瑞秋并没有冷静地表明这是她自己的决定，而是争辩并恳求母亲的理解。这场激烈的争吵引发了她长达一周的厌食症，这是她发泄自我愤怒的一种方式。

When self-assertion is called for, Rachel swallows her anger and tries to justify herself, to placate or to engage in some interaction designed to persuade the other person to “get it.” These efforts are the automatic responses of the vulnerable child who works intensely to bring the parent into alignment with her needs. Her anxiety and fear of abandonment compel her to repress any emotion that may cause her to be rejected.

当需要维护自身权益时，瑞秋会压抑住怒火，试图为自己辩解，安抚对方，或者进行一些旨在说服对方“理解”她的互动。这些都是脆弱的孩子下意识的反应，她竭尽全力地想要让父母满足自己的需求。她的焦虑和被抛弃的恐惧迫使她压抑任何可能导致她被拒绝的情绪。

Rachel’s pet rabbit, on the other hand, is acutely sensitive to her owner’s emotional states. When Rachel is angry, the rabbit simply refuses be picked up by her. “If I know I’m angry I’ll leave her alone. If I am angry but don’t know it, she won’t let me touch her—she tells me and I’ll check in inside, and sure enough I’m angry about something.” Although this seems strange to some people, the explanation is straightforward. People and their pets connect via shared brain structures that predate the development of the human frontal cortex with its apparatus of language and rationality. Animals and humans interact from their respective limbic systems, the brain’s emotional parts. Unlike people, animals are acutely sensitive to messages from the limbic brain—both their own and that of their owners. In Rachel’s unconscious anger the rabbit senses a threat.

另一方面，瑞秋的宠物兔却对主人的情绪状态极其敏感。瑞秋生气时，兔子会直接拒绝被她抱起来。“如果我知道自己生气了，我就会让她一个人待着。如果我生气了但自己没意识到，她也不会让我碰她——她会告诉我，然后我回过神来，果然又因为什么事生气了。”虽然这听起来很奇怪，但解释起来却很简单。人和宠物通过共享的大脑结构建立联系，这些结构早于人类额叶皮层（负责语言和理性）的发育。动物和人类通过各自的边缘系统（大脑的情感部分）进行互动。与人类不同，动物对来自边缘系统的信息极其敏感——既包括它们自己的信息，也包括主人的信息。在瑞秋无意识的愤怒中，兔子会感受到威胁。

How does it come about that a human being would need a rabbit to let her know when she is upset? The simple answer is childhood conditioning. No infant is born with a propensity to repress the expression of emotion—quite the contrary. Anyone who has ever tried to force a baby to swallow foods he disliked or to induce a toddler even to open her mouth when she did not wish to eat can testify to the young human’s inherent capacity to resist coercion and to express displeasure. So why do we start swallowing food we do not want or feelings our parents do not want? Not out of any natural inclination but from the need to survive.

为什么人类需要兔子来表达自己的不快呢？答案很简单：童年经历的影响。没有哪个婴儿天生就倾向于压抑自己的情绪——恰恰相反。任何试图强迫婴儿吞下他们不喜欢的食物，或者试图让幼儿在不想吃东西时张开嘴的人，都可以证明，幼小的人类天生就具备抵抗强迫和表达不满的能力。那么，为什么我们会开始吞下自己不想吃的食物，或者吞下父母不想让我们感受到的情绪呢？并非出于任何自然倾向，而是出于生存的需要。

Only some aspects of childhood experiences are available to conscious retrieval. Rachel, for example, recalls the sense of rejection and humiliation she felt following her father and brother at a distance as the two walked ahead in an embrace. She is also aware of her birth history, although she cannot recall it directly. Yet even without such information, we have infallible testimony about her experience of early childhood: her hopelessness about intimacy; her continued pleas for understanding from her mother, despite nearly forty years of futility; and her reliance on the rabbit as an anger sensor. These behaviours represent an exceedingly accurate memory system, one that was imprinted in her brain in the early stages of her development. That memory system has guided her behaviour all her life and eventually prepared the terrain for the onset of autoimmune disease.

只有部分童年经历可以被意识层面提取。例如，瑞秋记得，当父亲和哥哥拥抱着走在前面时，她远远地跟在后面，感到一种被拒绝和羞辱的滋味。她也知道自己的出生史，尽管她无法直接回忆起来。然而，即使没有这些信息，我们仍然拥有关于她早期童年经历的确凿证据：她对亲密关系的绝望；尽管近四十年来都徒劳无功，她仍然不断地向母亲乞求理解；以及她依赖兔子来感知愤怒。这些行为表明她拥有一个极其精准的记忆系统，这个系统在她发育早期就已深深地印刻在她的大脑中。这个记忆系统指导了她的一生，并最终为自身免疫性疾病的发生埋下了伏笔。

The biology of potential illness arises early in life. The brain’s stress-response mechanisms are programmed by experiences beginning in infancy, and so are the implicit, unconscious memories that govern our attitudes and behaviours toward ourselves, others and the world. Cancer, multiple sclerosis, rheumatoid arthritis and the other conditions we examined are not abrupt new developments in adult life, but culminations of lifelong processes. The human interactions and biological imprinting that shaped these processes took place in periods of our life for which we may have no conscious recall.

潜在疾病的生物学基础在生命早期就已形成。大脑的应激反应机制由婴儿时期的经历塑造，那些支配我们对待自己、他人和世界的态度和行为的内隐无意识记忆也是如此。癌症、多发性硬化症、类风湿性关节炎以及我们探讨的其他疾病并非成年后突然出现的新情况，而是终生过程的最终结果。塑造这些过程的人际互动和生物印记发生在我们生命中某些我们可能没有意识记忆的时期。

Emotionally unsatisfying child-parent interaction is a theme running through the one hundred or so detailed interviews I conducted for this book. These patients suffer from a broadly disparate range of illnesses, but the common threads in their stories are early loss or early relationships that were profoundly unfulfilling emotionally. Early childhood emotional deprivation in the histories of adults with serious illness is also verified by an impressive number of investigations reported in the medical and psychological literature.

在为本书进行的约一百次详细访谈中，贯穿始终的一个主题是：缺乏情感满足的亲子互动。这些患者患有各种各样的疾病，但他们故事中的共同点是：早年经历的丧失或早期关系在情感上极度匮乏。大量医学和心理学文献中的研究也证实了，患有严重疾病的成年人的童年早期情感缺失现象普遍存在。

In an Italian study, women with genital cancers were reported to have felt less close to their parents than healthy controls. They were also less demonstrative emotionally. 1

一项意大利研究报告称，患有生殖器癌症的女性与父母的亲密程度低于健康对照组，她们的情感表达也较少。

A large European study compared 357 cancer patients with 330 controls. The women with cancer were much less likely than controls to recall their childhood homes with positive feelings. As many as 40 per cent of cancer patients had suffered the death of a parent before the age of seventeen—a ratio of parental loss two and a half times as great as had been suffered by the controls. 2

一项大型欧洲研究比较了357名癌症患者和330名对照组。与对照组相比，癌症患者回忆起童年故居时产生积极感受的可能性要低得多。高达40%的癌症患者在17岁之前就失去了父母——这一比例是对照组的2.5倍。

The thirty-year follow-up of Johns Hopkins medical students was previously quoted. Those graduates whose initial interviews in medical school had revealed lower than normal childhood closeness with their parents were particularly at risk. By midlife they were more likely to commit suicide or develop mental illness, or to suffer from high blood pressure, coronary heart disease or cancer. In a similar study, Harvard undergraduates were interviewed about their perception of parental caring. Thirty-five years later these subjects’ health status was reviewed. By midlife only a quarter of the students who had reported highly positive perceptions of parental caring were sick. By comparison, almost 90 per cent of those who regarded their parental emotional nurturing negatively were ill. “Simple and straightforward ratings of feelings of being loved are significantly related to health status,” the researchers concluded. 3

此前曾引用过一项对约翰·霍普金斯大学医学院学生进行的30年追踪研究。研究发现，那些在医学院入学初期访谈中，童年时期与父母亲密程度低于正常水平的毕业生，风险尤其高。到了中年，他们更容易自杀、患上精神疾病，或罹患高血压、冠心病或癌症。一项类似的研究采访了哈佛大学本科生，了解他们对父母关爱的感受。35年后，研究人员对这些受访者的健康状况进行了回顾。结果显示，到了中年，那些对父母关爱持高度积极态度的学生中，只有四分之一患病。相比之下，那些对父母情感养育持负面看法的学生中，近90%患病。研究人员总结道：“对被爱感受的简单直接的评价与健康状况显著相关。”

Tactile contact is the newborn’s earliest experience of the world. It is how we first receive love. Mammalian mothers invariably provide tactile stimulation to their offspring, for instance, rats by licking their pups, primates by stroking them. Ashley Montague writes in his superb book Touching: The Human Significance of the Skin , “The various forms in which the newborn and young receive it is of prime importance for their healthy physical and behavioural development. It appears probable that, for human beings, tactile stimulation is of fundamental significance for the development of healthy emotional or affectional relationships, that ‘licking,’ in its actual and in its figurative sense, and love are closely connected; in short, that one learns love not by instruction, but by being loved.”

触觉接触是新生儿对世界的最早体验，也是我们最初感受爱的方式。哺乳动物的母亲总是会给幼崽提供触觉刺激，例如，老鼠会舔舐幼崽，灵长类动物会抚摸它们。阿什利·蒙塔古在他那本杰出的著作《触摸：皮肤的人类意义》中写道：“新生儿和幼童接受触觉刺激的各种形式，对其健康的生理和行为发育至关重要。对人类而言，触觉刺激对于建立健康的情感或亲密关系具有根本意义；‘舔舐’，无论从字面意义还是象征意义上来说，都与爱紧密相连；简而言之，爱不是通过教导而来，而是通过被爱而来。”

From animal experiments, it is known that physical touching induces growth-hormone production, promoting better weight gain and development. These findings also apply to human beings. In a study of premature babies, incubated infants were divided into two groups. All their nutritional and other conditions were identitical, except for one variable: one group was given fifteen minutes of tactile stimulation three times a day over a period of two weeks. “Providing this form of stimulation to these babies resulted in significant acceleration of weight gain, increased head circumference, and improved behavioural indices,” compared with the control group. 4 The lack of touching that Rachel experienced impaired her physical development and at the same time gave her the first inkling that she was not desirable or lovable. Later events reinforced those earliest impressions.

动物实验表明，身体接触能够促进生长激素分泌，从而促进体重增长和发育。这些发现同样适用于人类。一项针对早产儿的研究中，研究人员将保温箱中的婴儿分为两组。两组婴儿的营养和其他条件完全相同，唯一的区别在于：一组婴儿在两周内每天接受三次、每次十五分钟的触觉刺激。“与对照组相比，接受这种刺激的婴儿体重增长显著加快，头围增大，行为指标也有所改善。”瑞秋缺乏身体接触的经历阻碍了她的身体发育，同时也让她第一次意识到自己不讨人喜欢。后来的事件进一步强化了她最初的这种感受。

Interactions with the world program our physiological and psychological development. Emotional contact is as important as physical contact. The two are quite analogous, as we recognize when we speak of the emotional experience of feeling touched . Our sensory organs and brains provide the interface through which relationships shape our evolution from infancy to adulthood. Social-emotional interactions decisively influence the development of the human brain. From the moment of birth, they regulate the tone, activity and development of the psychoneuroimmunoendocrine (PNI) super-system. Our characteristic modes of handling psychic and physical stress are set in our earliest years.

与世界的互动塑造了我们的生理和心理发展。情感接触与身体接触同等重要。两者非常相似，正如我们谈到被触碰的情感体验时所感受到的那样。我们的感觉器官和大脑提供了一个界面，通过这个界面，人际关系塑造了我们从婴儿期到成年期的进化。社会情感互动对人脑的发育起着决定性的影响。从出生那一刻起，它们就调节着心理神经免疫内分泌（PNI）超系统的张力、活动和发育。我们应对心理和生理压力的独特模式在幼年时期就已经形成。

Neuroscientists at Harvard University studied the cortisol levels of orphans who were raised in the dreadfully neglected child-care institutions established in Romania during the Ceausescu regime. In these facilities the caregiver/child ratio was one to twenty. Except for the rudiments of care, the children were seldom physically picked up or touched. They displayed the self-hugging motions and depressed demeanour typical of abandoned young, human or primate. On saliva tests, their cortisol levels were abnormal, indicating that their hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal axes were already impaired. 5 As we have seen, disruptions of the HPA axis have been noted in autoimmune disease, cancer and other conditions.

哈佛大学的神经科学家研究了在齐奥塞斯库政权时期罗马尼亚建立的、极度缺乏关爱的儿童福利机构中长大的孤儿的皮质醇水平。在这些机构中，照护人员与儿童的比例为1:20。除了最基本的照料外，孩子们很少被抱起或触摸。他们表现出被遗弃的幼童（无论是人类还是灵长类动物）典型的自我拥抱动作和抑郁情绪。唾液检测显示，他们的皮质醇水平异常，表明他们的下丘脑-垂体-肾上腺轴（HPA轴）已经受损。正如我们所见，HPA轴功能紊乱与自身免疫性疾病、癌症和其他疾病有关。

It is intuitively easy to understand why abuse, trauma or extreme neglect in childhood would have negative consequences. But why do many people develop stress-related illness without having been abused or traumatized? These persons suffer not because something negative was inflicted on them but because something positive was withheld. As Dr. Myron Hofer, director of the Division of Developmental Psychobiology at Columbia University, wrote in a special editon of the journal Psychosomatic Medicine in 1996, “The paradox remains, how could the absence of something or somebody create such disturbances…. There must be a biology of loss, and we must find it.” 6

人们很容易凭直觉理解童年时期遭受虐待、创伤或极端忽视会带来负面后果。但为什么许多人在没有遭受虐待或创伤的情况下也会患上与压力相关的疾病呢？这些人并非因为遭受了什么负面的东西，而是因为失去了什么积极的东西。正如哥伦比亚大学发展心理生物学系主任迈伦·霍弗博士在1996年《心身医学》杂志的特刊中所写：“悖论依然存在，为什么缺少某些东西或某个人会造成如此大的困扰……这其中必然存在某种关于丧失的生物学机制，我们必须找到它。”

How the absence of something or someone creates physiological disturbances becomes clearer if we recall our discussion of stress. All stressors represent the absence, threatened or real, of essential features in the environment, features that the organism perceives as necessary for survival. In “What Is Stress,” S. Levine and H. Ursin write that, “Stress stimuli … indicate that something is missing or about to disappear and that this something is highly relevant and desirable to the organism.” 7

如果我们回顾一下关于压力的讨论，就能更清楚地理解缺失某物或某人如何造成生理紊乱。所有压力源都代表着环境中某些重要特征的缺失，无论这种缺失是实际存在还是受到威胁，这些特征是生物体认为生存所必需的。在《什么是压力》一文中，S. Levine 和 H. Ursin 写道：“压力刺激……表明某些东西正在缺失或即将消失，而这些东西对生物体来说至关重要且不可或缺。”

For any young warm-blooded creature, life is impossible without the parent. The young human depends on adults much longer than the offspring of any other species, for reasons that go well beyond immediate physical needs. Parental caregivers are more than providers of food, shelter, lifeskills information, and protection against predators. As the sad example of the Romanian orphans showed, parents are also the biological regulators of the child’s immature physiological and emotional systems. Parental love is not simply a warm and pleasant emotional experience, it is a biological condition essential for healthy physiological and psychological development. Parental love and attention drive the optimal maturation of the circuitry of the brain, of the PNI system and of the HPA axis.

对于任何幼小的温血动物来说，没有父母就无法生存。人类幼崽对成年人的依赖时间远长于其他任何物种的后代，其原因远不止于满足眼前的生理需求。父母提供的不仅仅是食物、住所、生活技能指导和抵御天敌的保护。正如罗马尼亚孤儿的悲惨遭遇所揭示的那样，父母也是孩子尚未成熟的生理和情感系统的生物调节器。父母的爱不仅仅是一种温暖愉悦的情感体验，它更是健康生理和心理发育所必需的生物学条件。父母的爱和关注能够促进大脑回路、副交感神经系统和下丘脑-垂体-肾上腺轴（HPA轴）的最佳发育成熟。

The brain of the human newborn is smaller and less mature, in relation to the adult brain, than that of any other mammal. A horse, by comparison, can run on the first day of life—an activity for which we lack the required nerve circuitry, visual-spatial skills and muscle coordination for another year and a half or more. The straightforward anatomical reason for entering the world so neurologically challenged is the size of our head. Already at birth, the head of the human child is the biggest diameter of the body. It is the part most likely to become stuck in the birth canal. At the same time as the human head grew to accommodate the increasingly complex intellectual and manual-control capacities of the brain, the human pelvis narrowed to permit more balanced two-legged locomotion. One cannot walk two-legged with the pelvis of a horse. Thus, increase in head size co-evolved with the narrowed pelvis; were our brains much larger at the end of gestation, no one would ever be born.

与成人大脑相比，新生儿的大脑体积更小，发育也更不成熟，这在哺乳动物中是无法比拟的。相比之下，马出生第一天就能奔跑——而我们人类要到一年半甚至更长的时间里，才能发育出奔跑所需的神经回路、视觉空间技能和肌肉协调能力。造成我们出生时神经发育如此受限的直接解剖学原因是头部的大小。人类婴儿出生时，头部就已经是身体直径最大的部分，也是最容易卡在产道里的部位。随着人类头部为了适应大脑日益复杂的智力和手部控制能力而不断增大，与此同时，人类的骨盆却逐渐变窄，以便更好地平衡地进行双足行走。人类的骨盆像马一样，根本无法进行双足行走。因此，头部尺寸的增大与骨盆的变窄是共同进化的；如果我们的大脑在妊娠末期过大，那么人类就无法出生了。

Three-quarters of brain growth and almost 90 per cent of brain development take place following birth, mostly in the first three years of life. Immediately after birth, the human brain, alone among mammalian brains, continues to grow at the same rate outside the uterus as it did inside. In the first months and beyond, there is an astoundingly rapid and complex development of nerve connections, or synapses. We form millions of new synapses a second during some periods.

大脑生长的四分之三和近90%发生在出生后，主要集中在生命的前三年。出生后，人类大脑（哺乳动物中唯一在子宫外仍以与子宫内相同的速度生长的大脑）立即开始发育。在最初的几个月及之后，神经连接（或突触）的发育速度惊人且复杂。在某些时期，我们每秒钟都会形成数百万个新的突触。

The unfolding of any developmental process depends not only on inherited genetic potential but also on environmental conditions. The finest and hardiest strain of wheat will fail to grow in barren and dry soil. Decades of neuroscientific research have established that an indispensable requirement of human brain development is nurturing emotional interactions with the parent. Emotional interactions stimulate or inhibit the growth of nerve cells and circuits by complicated processes that involve the release of natural chemicals. To give a somewhat simplified example, when “happy” events are experienced by the infant, endorphins—“reward chemicals,” the brain’s natural opioids—are released. Endorphins encourage the growth and connections of nerve cells. Conversely, in animal studies, chronically high levels of stress hormones such as cortisol have been shown to cause important brain centres to shrink.

任何发育过程的展开不仅取决于遗传潜能，也取决于环境条件。即使是最优质、最耐寒的小麦品种，也无法在贫瘠干燥的土壤中生长。数十年的神经科学研究表明，人类大脑发育不可或缺的要素之一是与父母进行滋养性的情感互动。情感互动通过涉及天然化学物质释放的复杂过程，刺激或抑制神经细胞和神经回路的生长。举个简单的例子，当婴儿经历“快乐”事件时，大脑会释放内啡肽——“奖励化学物质”，即大脑的天然阿片类物质。内啡肽能够促进神经细胞的生长和连接。相反，动物研究表明，长期高水平的皮质醇等压力激素会导致大脑重要区域萎缩。

The neural circuits and neurochemistry of the brain develop in response to input from the environment. An infant with perfectly good eyes at birth would become irreversibly blind if he were confined to a dark room for five years, because the circuitry of vision needs the stimulation of light waves for its development. A “Darwinian” competition decides the survival of neurons and their synapses: those that get used survive and grow. Those deprived of the appropriate environmental stimulation atrophy or die, or fail to develop optimally.

大脑的神经回路和神经化学物质的发育是对环境输入的一种响应。一个出生时视力完全正常的婴儿，如果被关在黑暗的房间里五年，就会永久失明，因为视觉回路的发育需要光波的刺激。神经元及其突触的生存取决于一种“达尔文式”的竞争：那些被利用的神经元和突触能够存活并生长；而那些缺乏适当环境刺激的神经元和突触则会萎缩、死亡或发育不良。

A fundamental goal of human development is the emergence of a self-sustaining, self-regulated human being who can live in concert with fellow human beings in a social context. Vital for the healthy development of the neurobiology of self-regulation in the child is a relationship with the parent in which the latter sees and understands the child’s feelings and can respond with attuned empathy to the child’s emotional cues. Emotions are states of physiological arousal, either positive—“I want more of this”—or negative—“I want less of this.” Infants and small children do not have the capacity to regulate their own emotional states, and hence are physiologically at risk for exhaustion and even death if not regulated by the interaction with the parent. Closeness with the parent, therefore, serves to preserve the infant’s biological regulation.

人类发展的一个根本目标是培养出能够自我维持、自我调节的个体，使其能够在社会环境中与他人和谐共处。对于儿童自我调节神经生物学的健康发展而言，至关重要的是与父母建立亲密关系，在这种关系中，父母能够感知并理解孩子的感受，并以敏锐的同理心回应孩子的情绪信号。情绪是生理唤醒状态，分为积极情绪（“我想要更多这种情绪”）和消极情绪（“我想要更少这种情绪”）。婴幼儿不具备调节自身情绪状态的能力，因此，如果缺乏与父母的互动，他们的生理状态将面临衰竭甚至死亡的风险。因此，与父母的亲密关系有助于维持婴儿的生理调节能力。

Self-regulation requires the coordinated activities of anatomically separate brain areas, along with the benign dominance of the upper, more recently evolved regions of the brain over the lower ones. The oldest part of the brain—and the most essential for life—is the brain stem , where the primitive survival impulses of the “reptilian brain” arise and where basic autonomic functions are controlled, including—among others—hunger, thirst, cardiovascular and respiratory drives, and body temperature. The newest part of the human brain is the neocortex in the front of the brain. Cortex means “bark,” as in the bark of a tree, and refers to the thin rim of grey matter enveloping the white matter of the brain. Made up largely of the cell bodies of nerve cells, or neurons, the cortex processes the most highly evolved activities of the human brain. This prefrontal cortex modulates our responses to the world not in terms of primitive drives but in terms of learned information about what is friendly, neutral or hostile and what is socially useful and what is not. Its functions include impulse control, social-emotional intelligence and motivation. Much of the regulating work of the cortex involves not the initiation of actions but the inhibition of impulses arising in the lower brain centres.

自我调节需要大脑中不同解剖区域之间的协调活动，以及大脑上部较新近进化的区域对下部区域的良性主导地位。大脑最古老的部分——也是对生命至关重要的部分——是脑干，原始的生存本能（即“爬行动物脑”）源于此，基本的自主神经功能也在此受到控制，包括饥饿、口渴、心血管和呼吸驱动以及体温等。人脑最新的部分是位于大脑前部的新皮层。皮层（Cortex）一词意为“树皮”，指的是包裹在大脑白质周围的一层薄薄的灰质。皮层主要由神经细胞（即神经元）的细胞体构成，负责处理人脑中高度进化的活动。前额叶皮层调节我们对世界的反应，并非基于原始本能，而是基于对友好、中立或敌对事物以及社会有用或无用事物的后天习得信息。其功能包括冲动控制、社交情感智能和动机。大脑皮层的大部分调节工作并非启动行动，而是抑制来自较低级脑区的冲动。

Mediating between the regulatory processes of the cortex and the basic survival functions of the brain stem is the limbic emotional apparatus. The limbic system includes structures located between the cortex and brain stem but also encompasses some parts of the cortex. The limbic system is essential for survival. Without it the regulatory and thinking capacities of the cortex would function like the brain of an idiot savant: intellectual knowledge would be disconnected from real knowledge of the world.

连接大脑皮层调节过程和脑干基本生存功能的，是边缘系统的情感机制。边缘系统包含位于大脑皮层和脑干之间的结构，也包含部分大脑皮层。边缘系统对生存至关重要。没有它，大脑皮层的调节和思维能力就会像白痴学者的大脑一样：智力知识与对世界的真实认知脱节。

Emotions interpret the world for us. They have a signal function, telling us about our internal states as they are affected by input from the outside. Emotions are responses to present stimuli as filtered through the memory of past experience, and they anticipate the future based on our perception of the past.

情绪为我们解读世界。它们具有信号功能，告诉我们受外界刺激影响的内在状态。情绪是对当前刺激的反应，这种反应经过过往经验记忆的过滤，并且基于我们对过去的感知来预测未来。

The brain structures responsible for the experience and modulation of emotions, whether in the cortex or the midbrain, develop in response to parental input, just as visual circuitry develops in response to light. The limbic system matures by “reading” and incorporating the emotional messages of the parent. The centres of memory, both conscious and unconscious, rely on the interaction with the parent for their consolidation and for their future interpretations of the world. The circuits responsible for the secretion of important neurotransmitters like serotonin, norepinephrine and dopamine—essential for mood stability, arousal, motivation and attention—are stimulated and become coordinated in the context of the child’s relationship with his caregivers. In the brains of infant monkeys, serious imbalances of these various neurochemicals have been measured after only a few days of separation from their mothers.

大脑中负责体验和调节情绪的结构，无论是在大脑皮层还是中脑，都会像视觉回路对光线做出反应一样，在父母的引导下发育。边缘系统通过“解读”和整合父母的情感信息而成熟。无论是意识层面还是无意识层面，记忆中心都依赖于与父母的互动来巩固记忆，并影响其未来对世界的解读。负责分泌重要神经递质（如血清素、去甲肾上腺素和多巴胺）的回路——这些神经递质对于情绪稳定、唤醒、动机和注意力至关重要——会在儿童与照护者的关系中得到刺激并协调运作。在幼猴的大脑中，即使与母亲分离仅几天，这些神经化学物质的严重失衡也已被检测到。

In the parent-child interaction is established the child’s sense of the world: whether this is a world of love and acceptance, a world of neglectful indifference in which one must root and scratch to have one’s needs satisfied or, worse, a world of hostility where one must forever maintain an anxious hypervigilance. Future relationships will have as their templates nerve circuits laid down in our relationships with our earliest caregivers. We will understand ourselves as we have felt understood, love ourselves as we perceived being loved on the deepest unconscious levels, care for ourselves with as much compassion as, at our core, we perceived as young children.

在亲子互动中，孩子对世界的感知逐渐形成：这究竟是一个充满爱与接纳的世界，还是一个被忽视、冷漠的世界（在这个世界里，孩子必须苦苦挣扎才能满足自身需求），又或是更糟糕的，一个充满敌意的世界（在这个世界里，孩子必须时刻保持焦虑和高度警惕）。未来的各种关系都将以我们与最早的照护者之间的关系所形成的神经回路为模板。我们将以曾经被理解的方式去理解自己，以我们潜意识深处感知到的爱来爱自己，并以我们幼年时内心深处感受到的那种慈悲来关爱自己。

The disruption of attachment relationships in infancy and childhood may have long-term consequences for the brain’s stress-response apparatus and for the immune system. A large number of animal experiments have established a powerful connection between early attachment disturbances and unbalanced stress-response capacities in the adult. The crux of this research is that disrupted attachment in infancy leads to exaggerated physiological stress responses in the adult. Obversely, nurturing attachment interactions in infancy provide for better modulated biological stress reactions in the adult.

婴儿期和儿童期依恋关系的破坏可能对大脑的应激反应机制和免疫系统产生长期影响。大量动物实验已证实，早期依恋障碍与成年期应激反应能力失衡之间存在密切联系。这项研究的核心在于，婴儿期依恋关系的破坏会导致成年期生理应激反应过度。相反，婴儿期良好的依恋互动则有助于成年期生物应激反应的调节。

For the satisfaction of attachment needs in human beings, more than physical proximity and touching is required. Equally essential is a nourishing emotional connection, in particular the quality of attunement . Attunement, a process in which the parent is “tuned in” to the child’s emotional needs, is a subtle process. It is deeply instinctive but easily subverted when the parent is stressed or distracted emotionally, financially or for any other reason. Attunement may also be absent if the parent never received it in his or her childhood. Strong attachment and love exist in many parent-child relationships but without attunement. Children in non-attuned relationships may feel loved but on a deeper level do not experience themselves as appreciated for who they really are. They learn to present only their “acceptable” side to the parent, repressing emotional responses the parent rejects and learning to reject themselves for even having such responses.

人类依恋需求的满足，需要的不仅仅是身体上的亲近和触碰。同样重要的是滋养性的情感联结，尤其是情感共鸣。情感共鸣是指父母“感知”到孩子的情感需求，这是一个微妙的过程。它是一种根深蒂固的本能，但当父母感到压力、情绪低落、经济拮据或其他任何原因时，这种本能很容易被破坏。如果父母在童年时期从未获得过情感共鸣，那么他们自身也可能缺乏这种能力。许多亲子关系中存在着强烈的依恋和爱，但却缺乏情感共鸣。在缺乏情感共鸣的关系中，孩子可能感受到爱，但在更深层次上，他们并不觉得自己被真正地欣赏。他们学会了只向父母展现自己“合格”的一面，压抑那些被父母拒绝的情感反应，甚至连这些反应本身也会让他们感到自卑。

Infants whose caregivers were too stressed, for whatever reason, to give them the necessary attunement contact will grow up with a chronic tendency to feel alone with their emotions, to have a sense—rightly or wrongly—that no one can share how they feel, that no one can “understand.” We are speaking here not of a lack of parental love, nor of physical separation between parent and child, but of a void in the child’s perception of being seen, understood, empathized with and “got” on the emotional level. The phenomenon of physical closeness but emotional separation has been called proximate separation . Proximate separation happens when attuned contact between parent and child is lacking or is interrupted due to stresses on the parent that draw her away from the interaction.

如果照护者因各种原因压力过大，无法给予婴儿必要的情感联结，那么婴儿长大后往往会长期感到情绪孤单，无论这种感觉是否正确，都会觉得没有人能感同身受，没有人能“理解”自己。这里所说的并非缺乏父母的爱，也不是父母与孩子之间的身体分离，而是孩子在情感层面上缺乏被看见、被理解、被共情和被“领会”的感受。这种身体上的亲近与情感上的疏离被称为“近距离分离”。当父母与孩子之间缺乏情感联结，或者由于父母的压力而中断这种联结时，就会发生近距离分离。

An example of such an attunement break occurs when the parent looks away first from the child during one of their intensely pleasurable eye-to-eye gaze interactions. Another attunement break occurs if the parent insists on stimulating a resting child because he (the parent) desires the mutual engagement, even if the child at that moment needs some respite from the intensity of their interaction.

例如，当父母在与孩子进行充满愉悦的眼神交流时，如果父母先移开视线，就属于这种共情中断。另一种共情中断的情况是，如果父母坚持要刺激正在休息的孩子，仅仅因为父母渴望这种互动，即使孩子当时需要从这种强烈的互动中得到一些喘息，也属于共情中断。

“Primate experiments show that infants can undergo severe separation reactions even though their mothers are visually, but not psychologically, available,” writes the UCLA psychologist, theorist and researcher Allan Schore. “I suggest that proximate separations are a common and potent phenomenon in early personality development.” 8

“灵长类动物实验表明，即使母亲在视觉上（而非心理上）就在身边，婴儿也会出现严重的亲子分离反应，”加州大学洛杉矶分校心理学家、理论家和研究员艾伦·肖尔写道。“我认为，近距离分离是早期人格发展中一种常见且影响深远的现象。”

In proximate separations the parents are physically present but emotionally absent. Such parent-child interactions are increasingly the norm in our hyperstressed society. The levels of physiological stress experienced by the child during proximate separation approaches the levels experienced during physical separation. Proximate separation affects the young child on the unconscious physiological levels rather than on the conscious thought-feeling levels. It will not be recalled later as the adult looks back on his childhood experience, but it is entrenched as the biology of loss.

在近距离分离的情况下，父母虽然身在身边，情感上却缺席。这种亲子互动方式在当今压力巨大的社会中日益普遍。孩子在近距离分离期间所经历的生理压力水平接近于身体分离时的水平。近距离分离对幼童的影响主要体现在无意识的生理层面，而非意识层面。成年后，当孩子回首童年经历时，这种近距离分离的影响或许并不明显，但它却作为一种生物学意义上的丧失体验，深深地烙印在孩子的记忆中。

Experiences of proximate separation become part of the person’s psychological programming: people “trained” in this way in childhood are likely to choose adult relationships that re-enact repeated proximate separation dynamics. They may, for example, choose partners who do not understand, accept or appreciate them for who they are. Thus the physiological stresses induced by proximal separation will also continue to be repeated in adult life—and, again, often without conscious awareness.

童年时期经历的近距离分离会成为个体心理模式的一部分：童年时期接受过这种“训练”的人，成年后往往会选择那些会重复出现近距离分离模式的伴侣关系。例如，他们可能会选择那些不理解、不接受或不欣赏他们的伴侣。因此，近距离分离带来的生理压力也会在成年生活中不断重现——而且，往往是在无意识的情况下发生的。

16
16
The Dance of Generations
世代之舞

G IVEN THE INFORMATION PRESENTED in previous chapters, it may seem as though parents are to blame for the later development of illness in their offspring. Such a conclusion is quite contrary to my intentions and entirely out of keeping with the scientific evidence. Parenting styles do not reflect greater or lesser degrees of love in the heart of the mother and father; other, more mundane factors are at play. Parental love is infinite and for a very practical reason: the selfless nurturing of the young is embedded in the attachment apparatus of the mammalian brain.

根据前几章提供的信息，读者或许会认为父母应该为子女日后患病负责。然而，这样的结论与我的初衷截然相反，也完全不符合科学证据。父母的教养方式并不反映他们心中爱的多少；还有其他更为实际的因素在起作用。父母的爱是无限的，这背后有着非常实际的原因：无私地养育幼崽是哺乳动物大脑依恋机制中固有的本能。

If a parent’s loving feelings are constricted, it only because that parent has himself or herself suffered deep hurt. In my work with drug addicts in Vancouver’s Downtown Eastside, I treat many substance-dependent men and women. Hardened as they are—with their criminal records, their continued drug-seeking, their HIV infections and their harassed and socially marginal lives—the deepest pain they all have is about the children whom they have abandoned or who have been taken from them. Without exception, they themselves were abused or abandoned in childhood.

如果父母的爱意受到压抑，那一定是因为他们自己曾遭受过深深的伤害。我在温哥华市中心东区与吸毒者一起工作，接触过许多对毒品依赖的男女。尽管他们内心充满挣扎——背负着犯罪记录，持续寻求毒品，感染了艾滋病毒，过着饱受骚扰、被社会边缘化的生活——但他们内心最深的痛苦，都来自于他们抛弃或被夺走的孩子。无一例外，他们自己童年时期都曾遭受过虐待或遗弃。

Where parenting fails to communicate unconditional acceptance to the child, it is because of the fact that the child receives the parent’s love not as the parent wishes but as it is refracted through the parent’s personality . If the parent is stressed, harbours unresolved anxiety or is agitated by unmet emotional needs, the child is likely to find herself in situations of proximate abandonment regardless of the parent’s intentions.

如果父母未能向孩子传递无条件的接纳，那是因为孩子感受到的爱并非父母所愿，而是透过父母的个性折射而来。如果父母压力过大、内心充满未解决的焦虑或因未被满足的情感需求而烦躁不安，那么无论父母的本意如何，孩子都可能陷入近乎被遗弃的境地。

For better or worse, many of our parenting attitudes and responses have to do with our own experiences as children. That modes of parenting reflect the parent’s early childhood conditioning is evident both from animal observations and from sophisticated psychological studies of humans.

无论好坏，我们许多育儿态度和方式都与我们自身的童年经历息息相关。无论是对动物的观察，还是对人类的深入心理学研究，都表明育儿方式反映了父母早期的童年经历。

Rhesus monkeys are a species of primates favoured by psychological investigators because of their relatively small size and ease of care. In a troop of these monkeys, about 20 per cent are “high reactors” who are more likely than others to exhibit depressive behaviours on separation from mother, along with greater and longer activation of the HPA axis, exaggerated sympathetic nervous system arousal and deeper suppression of immune activity. In human terms, we might call the high reactors temperamentally hypersensitive. Not unlike their human counterparts, they tend to end up at the bottom of the social hierarchy. Their offspring resemble them in behaviour, reactivity and social status.

恒河猴是心理学研究者青睐的灵长类动物，因为它们体型相对较小且易于饲养。在一群恒河猴中，约有20%是“高反应型”个体，与其他个体相比，它们在与母亲分离时更容易表现出抑郁行为，同时伴有更强烈、更持久的下丘脑-垂体-肾上腺轴（HPA轴）激活、交感神经系统过度兴奋以及更深层次的免疫抑制。用人类的术语来说，我们可以称这些高反应型个体为气质上的高敏感人群。与人类类似，它们往往最终处于社会等级的底层。它们的后代在行为、反应能力和社会地位方面也与它们相似。

Research has revealed that the “constitutional high-reactor destiny can be interrupted by changing the environment.” The positive changes are passed on to future generations: “When reared with especially nurturing mothers, such animals show no signs of the usual behavioural disorder. Instead, they showed signs of precocious behavioural development and rose to the top of the hierarchy as adults. Females adopted the maternal style typical of their especially nurturing mothers .” 1

研究表明，“通过改变环境可以改变先天性高反应性动物的命运”。这种积极的变化会传递给后代：“如果由特别慈爱的母亲抚养长大，这类动物就不会表现出通常的行为障碍。相反，它们表现出早熟的行为发育，并在成年后占据了等级制度的顶端。雌性会模仿它们特别慈爱的母亲的典型育儿方式。”

These observations are not about learned behaviours, strictly speaking. For the most part, parent-child similarities in nurturing approach do not reflect cognitive learning, either in animals or in human beings. The intergenerational transmission of parenting style is largely a matter of physiological development, of how the limbic circuits of the brain become programmed in childhood and how the connections within the PNI super-system are established. As discussed in the previous chapter , the emotional brain of the child develops under the influence of the emotional brain of the parent. The child does not learn the parenting styles of his mother and father by imitation—or only in part. The biggest influence on the future parenting style of the child is the development of his emotional and attachment circuits in the context of his relationship with his parents. The same is true of the development of the child’s stress-response apparatus.

严格来说，这些观察结果并非关于习得行为。在大多数情况下，父母与子女在养育方式上的相似性并不反映认知学习，无论是在动物还是人类身上。养育方式的代际传递主要取决于生理发育，取决于儿童时期大脑边缘回路的编程方式以及PNI超系统内部连接的建立方式。正如前一章所述，儿童的情感大脑是在父母情感大脑的影响下发育的。儿童并非通过模仿——或者只是部分地——来学习父母的养育方式。对儿童未来养育方式影响最大的因素是其情感和依恋回路在与父母关系中的发育。儿童应激反应机制的发育也是如此。

One dramatic animal experiment will suffice to illustrate this principle. Tranquilizers like Valium and Ativan belong to a class of drugs called benzodiazepines . Like all pharmacological agents that affect mental functions, they work because certain brain areas have receptors for similar natural tranquilizing substances manufactured in the brain itself. The amygdala , an almond-shaped structure in the temporal lobe of the brain, is one of the main regulators of the fear and anxiety response. It is supplied with natural benzodiazepine receptors that, when activated, cool down our fearful reactions. Compared with adult rats who received less nurturing, in adult rats who had been licked and groomed more by their mothers the amygdala was found to contain many more benzodiazepine receptors . Maternal care in infancy influenced the physiology of anxiety regulation in the brain of the adult. These differences were not explained by genetic factors. 2

一个引人注目的动物实验足以说明这一原理。像安定和劳拉西泮这样的镇静剂属于苯二氮卓类药物。与所有影响精神功能的药物一样，它们的作用机制是：大脑的某些区域存在受体，可以与大脑自身产生的类似天然镇静物质结合。杏仁核是大脑颞叶中一个杏仁状的结构，是恐惧和焦虑反应的主要调节器之一。它含有天然的苯二氮卓受体，这些受体被激活后可以抑制我们的恐惧反应。与那些较少得到母爱呵护的成年大鼠相比，那些幼年时期被母亲舔舐和梳理毛发较多的成年大鼠，其杏仁核中含有更多的苯二氮卓受体。幼年时期的母爱呵护会影响成年大鼠大脑中焦虑调节的生理机制。这些差异无法用遗传因素来解释。

Although the psychological development of humans is much more complex than that of animals, intergenerational transmission of parenting behaviour and of stress is also the general rule. It is similar to the development of the child’s stress response. As a group of Canadian researchers have written, “Maternal care during infancy serves to ‘program’ behavioural responses to stress in the offspring by altering the development of the neural systems that mediate fearfulness.” 3 In short, anxious mothers are likely to rear anxious offspring, down through the generations.

尽管人类的心理发展远比动物复杂，但养育行为和压力的代际传递仍然是普遍规律。这与儿童压力反应的发展类似。正如一群加拿大研究人员所写：“婴儿期的母性照护通过改变调节恐惧感的神经系统的发育，对后代应对压力的行为反应进行‘编程’。”简而言之，焦虑的母亲很可能会养育出焦虑的后代，这种现象会代代相传。

Researchers developed scores assessing the quality of parent-child bonding. Scores of parental bonding were measured across three generations: between adult mothers and their mothers, and between these same adult mothers and their own daughters. The measures of bonding between mothers and daughters were consistent across the generations. 4

研究人员开发了评估亲子关系质量的评分系统。亲子关系评分在三代人之间进行测量：成年母亲与其母亲之间，以及这些成年母亲与其女儿之间。母女关系的测量结果在各代人之间保持一致。

In the adult children of Holocaust survivors with post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), disturbances of the HPA axis and cortisol production were found. The more severe was the parents’ PTSD, the greater was the impairment in their children’s cortisol mechanisms. 5

在患有创伤后应激障碍（PTSD）的大屠杀幸存者的成年子女中，发现存在下丘脑-垂体-肾上腺轴（HPA轴）功能紊乱和皮质醇分泌异常。父母的PTSD症状越严重，其子女的皮质醇机制受损程度也越大。

Mary Ainsworth, an early associate of John Bowlby’s and later professor of developmental psychology at the University of Virginia in Charlottesville, devised a method of assessing the pattern and quality of parent-child attachments. During the child’s first year of life, researchers observed mother-infant interactions in the home, recording their perceptions. At one year, each infant-mother pair was brought into the laboratory for a brief experiment, called the Strange Situation. “At various times in the twenty-minute procedure, the infant stayed with the mother, with the mother and a stranger, with only the stranger, and alone for up to three minutes. The idea was (and still is) that separating a one-year-old from her attachment figure within a strange environment should activate the infant’s attachment system. One should then be able to study the infant’s responses at separation and reunion. The most useful assessments came at the reunion episode of this paradigm.” 6

玛丽·安斯沃思（Mary Ainsworth）是约翰·鲍尔比（John Bowlby）的早期同事，后来成为弗吉尼亚大学夏洛茨维尔分校的发展心理学教授。她设计了一种评估亲子依恋模式和质量的方法。在婴儿出生后的第一年，研究人员观察了母亲在家中与婴儿的互动，并记录了他们的感知。一岁时，每对母婴被带到实验室进行一项名为“陌生情境”（Strange Situation）的简短实验。“在20分钟的实验过程中，婴儿会分别与母亲待在一起、与母亲和一位陌生人待在一起、只与陌生人待在一起，以及独自待最多3分钟。其理念（现在依然如此）是，将一岁的婴儿与她的依恋对象在陌生的环境中分离，应该会激活婴儿的依恋系统。这样就可以研究婴儿在分离和重聚时的反应。最有价值的评估来自该实验范式中的重聚阶段。”

The baby’s response to the returning mother, it turned out, was programmed by how the mother had interacted with her during the first year of life. Those infants who had received attuned attention from their mothers at home showed signs of missing their mothers on separation. They greeted their returning mothers by initiating physical contact. They were soothed easily and returned quickly to spontaneous play. This pattern was called secure . There were also a number of insecure patterns, variously named avoidant, ambivalent or disorganized . Avoidant infants did not express distress on separating from the mother and avoided or ignored the mother on reunion. Such behaviour did not denote genuine self-reliance but the pseudo-autonomy that we noted, for example, in rheumatoid patients: the belief that they must depend only on themselves, since trying to obtain help from the parent was useless. Internally, however, these avoidant infants were physiologically stressed when the parent returned, as measured by heart rate changes. The infants falling into the insecure categories had been subjected to non-attuned parenting in the home. They had received implicit messages of maternal emotional absence, or mixed messages of contact alternating with distance.

事实证明，婴儿对母亲归来的反应是由母亲在婴儿出生第一年与她互动的方式决定的。那些在家中得到母亲悉心照料的婴儿，在与母亲分离时会表现出思念母亲的迹象。他们会主动与归来的母亲进行身体接触来迎接她。他们很容易被安抚，并很快恢复到自发的玩耍状态。这种模式被称为安全型依恋。此外，还有一些不安全型依恋模式，被分别称为回避型、矛盾型或紊乱型。回避型婴儿在与母亲分离时不会表现出痛苦，重聚后也会回避或忽视母亲。这种行为并非真正的自立，而是我们观察到的一种伪自主，例如在类风湿性关节炎患者身上就观察到的那种：他们认为必须完全依靠自己，因为向父母寻求帮助是徒劳的。然而，从心率变化来看，这些回避型婴儿在父母归来时会表现出生理上的应激反应。属于不安全型依恋的婴儿在家中则经历了缺乏悉心照料的养育方式。他们收到了母亲情感缺失的隐晦信息，或者亲近与疏远交替出现的矛盾信息。

Already at one year of age the infants were exhibiting relationship responses that would characterize their personalities and behaviours in the future. The Strange Situation experiment has been duplicated hundreds of times, in many countries. The observations at one year are accurate advance indicators of behaviour at adolescence, including such features as emotional maturity, peer relationships and academic performance. On all these measures, children who had been securely attached infants scored consistently better than insecurely attached ones.

婴儿一岁时就已表现出未来性格和行为特征中体现出的关系反应。陌生情境实验已在许多国家重复进行数百次。一岁时的观察结果能够准确预测青少年时期的行为，包括情绪成熟度、同伴关系和学业成绩等特征。在所有这些指标上，安全型依恋的儿童得分始终优于不安全型依恋的儿童。

However, as Daniel Siegel explains in his book The Developing Mind , the most crucial finding concerning the intergenerational transmission of parenting was that the infant’s performance in the Strange Situation could be accurately predicted even before the child was born .

然而，正如丹尼尔·西格尔在他的著作《发展中的心智》中所解释的那样，关于代际养育方式传递的最关键发现是，婴儿在陌生情境中的表现甚至可以在孩子出生之前就被准确预测。

Professor Mary Main at the University of California, Berkeley, formerly a student of Dr. Ainsworth’s, developed an accurate means of assessing an adult’s childhood attachment relationship patterns with his parents. Her technique considers primarily not what a person said in response to questions but how he said it. The patterns of people’s speech and the key words they “happen” to employ are more meaningful descriptors of their childhoods than what they consciously believe they are communicating. The intended meaning of words reflect only the speaker’s conscious beliefs, from which painful memories are often excluded. The real story is told by the patterns of the narrative—fluent or halting, detailed or characterized by a paucity of words, consistent or self-contradicting, along with Freudian slips, revealing asides and apparent non-sequiturs.

加州大学伯克利分校的玛丽·梅恩教授（曾是艾恩斯沃斯博士的学生）开发了一种精准评估成年人童年时期与父母依恋关系模式的方法。她的方法主要关注的不是一个人对问题的回答内容，而是他如何表达。人们的说话模式以及他们“碰巧”使用的关键词，比他们自认为正在表达的内容更能准确地描述他们的童年经历。词语的本意仅仅反映了说话者的意识信念，而痛苦的记忆往往被排除在外。真正讲述故事的是叙述的模式——流畅还是断断续续，详尽还是寥寥数语，前后一致还是自相矛盾，以及弗洛伊德式口误、意味深长的旁白和看似不合逻辑的转折。

The test developed by Mary Main is called the Adult Attachment Interview (AAI). Just as the responses of infants in the Strange Situations, the narratives of adults could also be classified along lines that reflected the degrees of security they had experienced in their early interactions with their parents.

玛丽·梅因开发的这项测试被称为成人依恋访谈（AAI）。正如婴儿在陌生情境实验中的反应一样，成年人的叙述也可以根据他们早期与父母互动中所体验到的安全感程度进行分类。

It turns out that “the AAI is the most robust predictor of how infants become attached to their parents.” In other words, what an adult unconsciously reveals about his own childhood during the course of the attachment interview will predict his own attachment patterns with his children. Thus, AAIs conducted with the parent before the birth of an infant was able to forecast accurately how the infant would behave in the Strange Situation at one year of life. Furthermore, when those children are followed two decades later, their performance in the Strange Situation is found to have accurately predicted their own patterns of narrative in the Adult Attachment Interview.

结果表明，“成人依恋访谈（AAI）是预测婴儿如何与父母建立依恋关系的最可靠指标”。换句话说，成年人在依恋访谈过程中无意识地透露的童年经历，能够预测其与子女的依恋模式。因此，在婴儿出生前对父母进行的AAI能够准确预测婴儿在一岁时于陌生情境实验中的表现。此外，对这些儿童进行二十年后的追踪研究发现，他们在陌生情境实验中的表现能够准确预测他们在成人依恋访谈中的叙述模式。

Thus, the adult’s AAI narrative of his own childhood will often predict how he will nurture his future child, and therefore how his child, at one year, will respond in the Strange Situation. And, the child’s behaviour in the Strange Situation will foretell the type of narrative she, in turn, will give about her childhood twenty years later!

因此，成年人对自己童年的AAI叙述往往能够预测他未来将如何养育自己的孩子，进而预测他的孩子在一岁时在陌生情境下的反应。而孩子在陌生情境下的行为，反过来又能预示她二十年后会如何讲述自己的童年经历！

Parenting, in short, is a dance of the generations. Whatever affected one generation but has not been fully resolved will be passed on to the next. Lance Morrow, a journalist and writer, succinctly expressed the multigenerational nature of stress in his book Heart , a wrenching and beautiful account of his encounters with mortality, thrust upon him by near-fatal heart disease: “The generations are boxes within boxes: Inside my mother’s violence you find another box, which contains my grandfather’s violence, and inside that box (I suspect but do not know), you would find another box with some such black, secret energy—stories within stories, receding in time.”

简而言之，为人父母是一场代际之舞。任何影响上一代人但尚未完全解决的问题，都会传递给下一代。记者兼作家兰斯·莫罗在他的著作《心》中，以简洁的语言表达了压力的代际传递。这本书以令人心碎又优美的笔触，讲述了他因心脏病险些丧命而被迫直面死亡的经历：“代际就像层层嵌套的盒子：在我母亲的暴力之下，你会发现另一个盒子，里面装着我祖父的暴力；而在那个盒子里（我怀疑，但并不确定），你还会发现另一个盒子，里面装着某种黑暗而隐秘的能量——故事层层嵌套，随着时间的流逝而消散。”

Blame becomes a meaningless concept if one understands how family history stretches back through the generations. “Recognition of this quickly dispels any disposition to see the parent as villain,” wrote John Bowlby, the British psychiatrist whose work threw scientific light on the decisive importance of attachment in infancy and childhood. Whom do we accuse?

如果了解家族历史如何跨越数代，那么“责备”这个概念就变得毫无意义。“认识到这一点会迅速消除将父母视为罪魁祸首的任何倾向，”英国精神病学家约翰·鲍尔比写道。他的研究从科学角度阐明了依恋在婴幼儿时期至关重要的作用。那么，我们究竟应该责怪谁呢？

If we see that stress is transmitted transgenerationally, we can better understand why so many of the histories we have encountered in this book speak of families with generations of disease or of several members of the same generation affected by widely disparate and apparently unrelated illnesses. Some random examples:

如果我们认识到压力会跨代传递，就能更好地理解为什么本书中提到的许多案例都涉及家族几代患病，或者同一代人中的几位成员罹患截然不同、看似毫不相关的疾病。以下是一些例子：

  • N ATALIE: multiple sclerosis. Her oldest brother was an alcoholic who died of cancer of the throat. Her younger sister is schizophrenic. Her uncles and aunts were alcoholics. Her maternal grandfather was alcoholic. Her husband, Bill, died of bowel cancer. Her son has attention deficit (hyperactivity) disorder and has struggled with drug addiction.

    娜塔莉患有多发性硬化症。她的大哥酗酒，死于喉癌。她的妹妹患有精神分裂症。她的叔叔阿姨们都是酗酒者。她的外祖父也是酗酒者。她的丈夫比尔死于肠癌。她的儿子患有注意力缺陷（多动）障碍，并且曾与毒瘾作斗争。

  • V éRONIQUE: multiple sclerosis. She believes she was conceived during an incestuous rape. In her adoptive family, the maternal grandfather was an alcoholic and her maternal grandmother developed Alzheimer’s disease in her sixties. Among other medical problems, her father has early-onset high blood pressure.

    维罗妮卡：患有多发性硬化症。她认为自己是乱伦强奸的产物。在她的养父母家庭中，外祖父酗酒，外祖母在六十多岁时患上了阿尔茨海默病。她的父亲除了其他健康问题外，还患有早发性高血压。

  • S UE R ODRIGUEZ: ALS. Her father died of alcoholic liver disease; one of her aunts died of a brain aneurysm, another in a house fire.

    苏·罗德里格斯：患有渐冻症。她的父亲死于酒精性肝病；她的一位姑姑死于脑动脉瘤，另一位死于房屋火灾。

  • A NNA: breast cancer. Both her mother and maternal grandmother died of breast cancer—but neither through genetic transmission. Anna inherited a breast-cancer gene on her father’s side. She has two sisters: one is living with an alcoholic, the other is mentally ill.

    安娜：乳腺癌。她的母亲和外祖母都死于乳腺癌——但都不是遗传的。安娜从父亲那边遗传了一个乳腺癌基因。她有两个姐妹：一个和酗酒者住在一起，另一个患有精神疾病。

  • G ABRIELLE: scleroderma, with features of rheumatoid arthritis. Her parents were alcoholics. Her brother has had a colectomy for cancer of the bowel, and her sister was recently diagnosed with breast cancer.

    加布里埃尔：患有硬皮病，并伴有类风湿性关节炎的症状。她的父母都是酗酒者。她的哥哥因肠癌接受了结肠切除术，她的姐姐最近被诊断出患有乳腺癌。

  • J ACQUELINE DU P Ré: multiple sclerosis. Her grandmother was traumatized by the death of other children about the time her mother was born. Jacqueline’s mother predeceased her with cancer, and her father developed Parkinson’s disease.

    杰奎琳·杜普雷：患有多发性硬化症。在她母亲出生前后，她的祖母因其他孩子的夭折而遭受创伤。杰奎琳的母亲因癌症先于她去世，她的父亲则患上了帕金森病。

  • R ONALD R EAGAN: Colon cancer, Alzheimer’s disease. His father and brother were alcoholics; his second wife developed breast cancer. His daughter died of metastatic malignant melanoma.

    罗纳德·里根：结肠癌、阿尔茨海默病。他的父亲和兄弟都是酗酒者；他的第二任妻子患上了乳腺癌。他的女儿死于转移性恶性黑色素瘤。

The reader may recall from chapter 1 the outraged letter from a rheumatologist in response to my article about Mary. I had suggested that Mary’s childhood experiences of abuse and abandonment had created a coping pattern of repression and that her scleroderma was an outcome, in part, of that history. The specialist stated that scleroderma was an inherited disease, and that my arguments had “no credibility.” She wrote, “This column has the effect of misinforming the lay public and falsely assigning responsibility for the development of scleroderma to the victims of this disease and to their families.” We can now see that “assigning responsibility”—by which the rheumatologist meant allocating blame—is not the issue. The central issue is the unintentional transmission of stress and anxiety across the generations.

读者或许还记得第一章中那位风湿病专家对我关于玛丽的文章的愤怒来信。我当时指出，玛丽童年时期遭受的虐待和遗弃，导致她形成了压抑的应对模式，而她的硬皮病在某种程度上也是这段经历的后果。这位专家却声称硬皮病是一种遗传性疾病，我的论点“毫无说服力”。她在信中写道：“这篇文章误导了公众，错误地将硬皮病的发生归咎于患者及其家人。” 现在我们可以看出，“归咎责任”（这位风湿病专家指的是追究责任）并非问题的关键所在。问题的核心在于压力和焦虑在代际间的无意传递。

Another patient of mine, Caitlin, also died with scleroderma. Her course was much more rapid than Mary’s, for she was dead less than a year after her diagnosis. I came to know Caitlin well only in her final months. Although I had delivered her children and remained their doctor, until her diagnosis with scleroderma she attended a female physician for her own medical problems.

我的另一位病人凯特琳也死于硬皮病。她的病情发展比玛丽快得多，确诊不到一年就去世了。我是在凯特琳生命的最后几个月才真正了解她的。虽然我曾为她接生孩子，也一直是他们的医生，但在确诊硬皮病之前，她自己的健康问题都是由一位女医生诊治的。

Like Mary, Caitlin, too, was a kind and quiet soul with concern for everyone but herself. When she was asked how she was, her response was always accompanied by a warm, self-effacing smile that served to protect her listener from the physical and emotional pain she was experiencing. She would quickly divert the conversation to some matter of personal interest to the other, away from her own troubles.

和玛丽一样，凯特琳也是个善良安静的人，她关心身边所有人，唯独忽略了自己。每当有人问她近况如何，她总是带着温暖而谦逊的微笑，仿佛在保护听者免受她身心痛苦的侵扰。她会迅速将话题转移到对方感兴趣的事物上，避开自己的烦恼。

I will not forget my last conversation with Caitlin, at her hospital bedside. Her lungs and heart were barely functioning; she was less than twenty-four hours from her death. I asked how she felt. She immediately turned her attention to me, inquiring what was happening in my life. I related, with some disappointment, that a weekly medical column I had been writing for a local newspaper had been, just that morning, cancelled by the editors. “Oh,” she whispered, her face saddened with empathy, “how terrible that must be for you. You love writing so much.” On the threshold of death from a disabling disease at age forty-two, leaving four children and a husband, she uttered not a word about how terrible she may have been feeling herself.

我永远不会忘记在凯特琳病床边与她进行的最后一次谈话。她的肺和心脏几乎停止了跳动；距离她离世不到24小时。我问她感觉如何。她立刻把注意力转向我，询问我最近怎么样。我有些失望地告诉她，我为当地报纸撰写的每周医学专栏，就在那天早上被编辑取消了。“哦，”她轻声说道，脸上满是同情和悲伤，“这对你来说一定很糟糕。你那么热爱写作。”年仅42岁，身患重病，生命垂危，留下四个孩子和丈夫，她却只字未提自己内心的痛苦。

“It was a long-standing part of her nature to be cheerful and always welcoming, regardless of whether she was sick or well,” her husband, Randy, told me in the course of a recent interview. According to Randy, Caitlin “bottled up a lot of emotion,” particularly when she was upset. There were two items she would rarely talk about: her terminal illness and her childhood. “If she mentioned her childhood at all, it would be about the few good times that she had.”

“无论生病还是健康，她总是那么开朗热情，这早已是她性格的一部分，”她的丈夫兰迪在最近的一次采访中告诉我。兰迪说，凯特琳“把很多情绪都藏在心里”，尤其是在难过的时候。有两件事她很少提及：她的绝症和她的童年。“如果她提起童年，也只会说说她为数不多的美好时光。”

From Randy’s perspective, there was every indication that the good times in his wife’s childhood had been few and far between. Her father, a successful businessman, was a harsh and arbitrary taskmaster whose word was law. He was highly critical of Caitlin, the elder of the two children. “It seemed to me that she felt that when her parents conceived her, it was a great inconvenience. That she had come too soon and they really didn’t want her.”

在兰迪看来，种种迹象表明，他妻子童年的美好时光寥寥无几。她的父亲是一位成功的商人，却是个严厉专横、颐指气使的人，他的话就是圣旨。他对家中两个孩子中的姐姐凯特琳尤其苛刻。“我觉得她觉得父母怀上她是个很大的麻烦，觉得她来得太早，他们根本不想要她。”

That struck a chord with me. Caitlin had been a committed anti-abortion advocate but not the hostile or embittered kind. She knew that I supported women’s right to decide whether to continue or abort their own pregnancy. Because we had a mutually respectful relationship, she once wrote me to urge that I stop referring patients to abortion clinics. In that letter she said, “If abortion had been legal at the time when I was a fetus, I would have been aborted.” She had, said Randy, a deep feeling of not having been wanted.

这番话深深触动了我。凯特琳一直是一位坚定的反堕胎倡导者，但她并非那种充满敌意或怨恨的人。她知道我支持女性自主决定是否继续妊娠的权利。因为我们彼此尊重，她曾写信给我，敦促我停止将病人转诊到堕胎诊所。她在信中说：“如果在我还是胎儿的时候堕胎合法，我就会被堕掉。”兰迪说，她内心深处一直觉得自己不被需要。

Late in Caitlin’s illness, an incident occurred that, in the telling, brought tears to Randy’s eyes. “We were sitting here in the kitchen with all those pills she was supposed to be taking. She was feeling miserable. All of a sudden she burst out crying. She said, ‘Oh, I wish I had a mother.’ And her mother lived only a few blocks away. They were not emotionally close enough that the mom would come and comfort her and help her or put her arms around her. We had a homemaker at the time. She was there, cleaning the fridge. She felt so touched that she came over and hugged Caitlin. I thought, What a shame—this person who hardly knows her has more empathy for her than her own mother.

凯特琳病重后期发生的一件事，在兰迪讲述时，让他不禁潸然泪下。“当时我们坐在厨房里，她正吃着那些药。她感觉非常难受。突然，她嚎啕大哭起来。她说：‘哦，我多么希望我有个妈妈。’她妈妈就住在几个街区外。她们母女俩关系并不亲密，所以妈妈不会过来安慰她、帮助她，或者给她一个拥抱。那时我们家请了一位家庭主妇。她当时正在打扫冰箱。她被凯特琳的哭声深深打动，走过来拥抱了她。我当时想，真是太可惜了——这个几乎不认识她的人，竟然比她自己的母亲更同情她。”

“But I don’t want to blame the parents either. When you look at their family histories—well, her mother’s dad walked out on his family when she was a little girl. She didn’t have a dad, and her mom (Caitlin’s grandmother) had to struggle on all alone.”

“但我也不想责怪她的父母。看看他们的家庭背景——她母亲的父亲在她很小的时候就抛弃了家庭。她没有父亲，她的母亲（凯特琳的祖母）不得不独自一人艰难地生活下去。”

Randy’s view of Caitlin’s childhood was confirmed in a subsequent interview with her brother. “There was little emotional support and love in the family,” the brother said. “Our father was mean to us, and our mother was afraid. My mother is a very nice person—a great person—but she would never deal with the issues.

兰迪对凯特琳童年的看法在随后对她哥哥的采访中得到了证实。“家里几乎没有情感上的支持和爱，”她哥哥说。“我们的父亲对我们很凶，母亲很害怕。我的母亲是个很好的人——一个很棒的人——但她从来不会去处理这些问题。”

“My father was just overbearing. I don’t think we could have been five or six years old when we were sent to the basement every Saturday to clean. We weren’t allowed to come up until it was done. While we were at it, we would polish my father’s army boots. They had to shine.”

“我父亲非常专横。我想我们当时应该不到五六岁，每个星期六都会被送到地下室打扫卫生。不打扫完不准上来。打扫的时候，我们还要帮我父亲擦亮军靴。靴子必须锃亮。”

Caitlin, her brother said, was “a pretty gentle soul,” but to her father “she was just stupid. The very fact that she went to university ticked him off. He had no respect for anything she did. She was in the La Leche League (a group that promotes breast-feeding). My father ridiculed that. ‘How long is she going to breast-feed those kids—until they are teenagers?’”

凯特琳的哥哥说，她“心地善良”，但在她父亲眼里，“她简直愚蠢至极。她上大学这件事就让他火冒三丈。他对她做的任何事都毫不尊重。她加入了国际母乳会（一个推广母乳喂养的组织）。我父亲对此嗤之以鼻。“她要给孩子们喂多久的母乳——直到他们十几岁吗？”

After putting up with years of feeling dominated, even as an adult, this brother finally broke with his father and refuses to talk him. “Caitlin was very concerned that I had got myself out of the family. She couldn’t understand why I had done that. I tried to tell her it was the best thing for me, that I was a better person for it. She didn’t get it.”

多年来，即使成年后，这位哥哥仍然忍受着被父亲控制的感觉，最终他与父亲决裂，拒绝与他交谈。“凯特琳很担心我脱离家庭。她无法理解我为什么这么做。我试图告诉她，这对我是最好的，我因此成为了一个更好的人。但她不理解。”

Caitlin’s brother, too, wept as he recounted an incident identical to the one Randy had related. “Caitlin said to my wife on her deathbed, the day before she died—it’s hard, those images—my wife sat with her and held her hand, and Caitlin said, ‘I wish I had a mother like you. I don’t have a mother.’ I think the world of my mother, but she wasn’t a good mother. She wasn’t loving.”

凯特琳的哥哥也泣不成声，他讲述的一件事与兰迪所说的一模一样。“凯特琳在我妻子临终前一天，也就是她去世的前一天——那些画面太难看了——我妻子坐在她床边，握着她的手，凯特琳说：‘我多么希望我也有像你这样的母亲。我没有母亲。’我非常敬重我的母亲，但她不是一个好母亲。她不慈爱。”

The brother also revealed details of the family history that once more demonstrated the multigenerational nature of suffering. It was a shock to Caitlin and her brother to learn the truth of what had happened with their grandfather. An uncle who showed up for the funeral of Caitlin’s grandmother informed them that the grandfather had not died when Caitlin’s mother was a young child, which had been the family story, but had abandoned his wife and later divorced her.

哥哥还透露了一些家族史的细节，再次印证了苦难的代代相传。凯特琳和哥哥得知祖父的真相后，都震惊不已。一位参加凯特琳祖母葬礼的叔叔告诉他们，祖父并非像家族传说中那样在凯特琳母亲年幼时就去世了，而是抛弃了妻子，后来又与她离婚。

All their lives, Caitlin and her brother had been told that their grandfather had passed away suddenly. “When we asked my mom what happened to her father, she always said, ‘He died when I was seven years old of a heart attack.’ Our grandmother had given us the same line. We were so upset because here was a grandmother whom we loved and thought the world of. To know the truth would have meant so much to us and to our relationship with her. But that’s the way it always was. In our family you don’t talk about difficult issues, you hide them.”

凯特琳和她的弟弟从小就被告知，他们的祖父是突然去世的。“我们问妈妈她父亲是怎么死的，她总是说，‘他七岁的时候死于心脏病。’我们的祖母也总是这么说。我们非常难过，因为我们深爱着这位祖母，对她无比敬重。如果能知道真相，对我们以及我们和她的关系来说意义重大。但一直以来都是这样。在我们家，人们不会谈论棘手的问题，而是会把它们藏起来。”

Such lies, however innocently intended, never protect a child from pain. There is something in us that knows when we are lied to, even if that awareness never reaches consciousness. Being lied to means being cut off from the other person. It engenders the anxiety of exclusion and of rejection. In Caitlin it could only have reinforced the perception of not being wanted that flowed from her father’s harshness and her mother’s emotional absence.

这样的谎言，无论初衷多么单纯，都无法保护孩子免受伤害。我们内心深处都有一种感觉，即使这种感觉从未被意识察觉，也能分辨出何时被欺骗。被欺骗意味着与对方隔绝，会引发被排斥和被拒绝的焦虑。对凯特琳来说，这只会加深她因父亲的严厉和母亲的情感缺失而产生的“不被需要”的感受。

Less than a year preceding the onset of her scleroderma, Caitlin suffered a major rejection at the hands of her family, having to do with her exclusion from the family business. “My sister was never in the calculations,” her brother says. “It didn’t seem abnormal at the time.” Caitlin felt deeply hurt by the perceived rejection. She never brought up the matter to anyone, except to her brother shortly before her death. And she kept maintaining that he, the brother, should go back to the family. “She felt it was her obligation, her duty, to make things right. That would be the only thing Caitlin would do—to try to make things better.”

在凯特琳患上硬皮病不到一年前，她遭受了来自家人的沉重打击，因为她被排除在家族企业之外。“我妹妹从来都不在他们的考虑范围之内，”她的哥哥说，“当时我们觉得这很正常。”凯特琳对这种被排斥的感觉深感痛苦。她从未向任何人提起过这件事，除了在她去世前不久告诉了她的哥哥。她一直坚持认为，她的哥哥应该回到家族中去。“她觉得这是她的义务，她的责任，要把事情做好。凯特琳唯一能做的就是——努力让一切好起来。”

Caitlin had been assigned a certain role in the family system, a role bequeathed to her by generations of family history. Her own mother was deprived of attuned parenting from an early age, since we can surmise that the family’s problems did not begin the moment the grandfather abandoned his wife and children. We may be equally sure that the harsh parenting by Caitlin’s father originated in his own troubled childhood. The combination of her parents’ many unmet emotional needs led to Caitlin’s desperation to make herself lovable and prepared her for the role of the kind, gentle, uncomplaining caregiver who never became angry and never asserted herself. That is how the child’s adaptive responses to perceived parental demand, if repeated often enough, become character traits.

凯特琳在家庭系统中被赋予了某种角色，这个角色是由家族几代人的历史传承下来的。她的母亲从小就缺乏悉心的养育，因为我们可以推断，这个家庭的问题并非始于祖父抛弃妻儿的那一刻。同样可以肯定的是，凯特琳父亲严厉的教养方式源于他自己坎坷的童年经历。父母诸多未被满足的情感需求，导致凯特琳渴望被爱，并最终塑造了她温柔善良、从不抱怨、从不发怒、从不强势的照顾者形象。这就是孩子对感知到的父母要求做出适应性反应，如果反复出现，最终会形成性格特征的过程。

Caitlin adopted her assigned role successfully, but at the cost of her own health. The price was a lifetime of stress. Her role, and her life, ended with a rapidly fatal autoimmune illness within one year of a deep rejection that she no longer had the resilience to deal with.

凯特琳成功地扮演了她被分配的角色，但却以牺牲自己的健康为代价。她为此付出了终生的压力。在她遭受沉重打击一年后，一种迅速致命的自身免疫性疾病夺走了她的生命，也终结了她的角色。她再也没有能力应对这种打击了。
